Reviews.Title: “Excellent up to a point”
Reviews.Author: JonCurtis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March in a one bedroomed suite. This consisted of a large room with a king bed and a separate kitchen / living room with a sofa bed for my adult daughter. It was well designed with doors into the bathroom area from both sides of the apartment. The room was clean and comfortable and suited us fine. We didn't have a car during our stay and Cedric, one of the reception people, was more than helpful in advising us of the bus system and calling cabs. The breakfast were reasonably good if a little monotonous and generally we though we'd found a little gem and then it all went pear shaped. On returning to our room one night we saw the largest cockroach I have ever seen walking across the wall of the living room, despite chasing the little bugger with a cup, it flew somewhere never to be seen again. As a result my daughter had to make the ultimate sacrifice, yes she moved her mattress into our room and slept on the floor with the interconnecting doors sealed with towels. During the night I found another smaller roach in the bathroom which I managed to trap. In the morning Cedric arranged for us to change rooms so they could deal with the 'critter' problem. This room was the same layout as the first room but the mattress on the sofa bed comprised of the springs a very thin covering of fabric. We did ask if it could be changed but that never happened. After two days my daughter gave up trying to sleep on it and just slept on the sofa. I would have given it 5 stars for the first 7 nights then 1 or 2 for the remaining nights. Cedric is brilliant though. Hotel could do with room safes although there are small boxes behind reception.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean,comfortable and friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: satchmo999
Reviews.Content: The recepion staff are very friendly and informative - the best out of the 4 or so hotels we've stayed at in Orlando. Our room provided a very large kig siz bed with big TV and ample wardrobe and draw space. Also had adjoining room for our 14 year old son with double sofa bed, big TV, lazyboy recling chair, table+chairs. He was made up with having his own "bedsit" as his rom aslo contained a kitchenette with large fridge, dishwasher, hotplate, toaster, cupbaords, pots and pans etc. Bathroom had a good shower and bath. Everything was very clean and in good order. We only used the pool once, but it was fine. The one time we mamanged to make it out of the parks for a reasonable time we made it for "Happy hour" in the dining area where each guest can get a coupld of drinks free (2 x draft bud lites - very nice !!). The location of this hotel is in Palm parkway which is 10 minutes drive to downtime disney. Also by driving north on Parm parkway/Turkey lake road you can be in Seaworld in about 15 ms, universal about 20 mins. There are lots of eateries nearby - would recommend the Golden Coral which is on Vineland - about 5/10 mins away. Also a large Walmart on Turkey lake road is convienient (10 minutes drive). Would highly recommend this hotel and want to book it again for next year. Mark

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money for its location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah2809
Reviews.Content: Myself my friend and our 4 teenage children stayed here for 10 days during the Easter holidays. We stayed on the 4th floor. The bedroom was light and airy and there was a separate living area with kitchenette and a large sofa bed and a large bathroom which had 2 doors this became a little annoying as you had to remember to lock both doors, in the end we kept the bedroom one locked and blocked it with a suitcase. The 2 double beds were the comfiest we had ever slept in, in a hotel. The rooms were cleaned every day and the beds changed every couple of days. The breakfast was served everyday until 9.30 and was a hit with the kids something different every day. Monday though Thursday at 5.30pm - 7.30pm you were able to have 2 complementary drinks (wine/beer adults soft drinks for kids) and some sort of snack, this was very enjoyable to have round the pool. Now the pool, its not the biggest or the smallest you might see, but it is adequate. There are plenty of sun loungers around to soak up the Florida sun then a quick dunk in the pool to cool you off as well as a jacuzzi . The kids played endlessly in the pool with different balls and floats that people leave behind after their holiday. We didn't hire a car on this occasion due to the location of the hotel, it is smack right in the middle between Disney and Universal. The hotel provide a shuttle to Disney around 3 times a day which is free. But, they charge $10pp to go to Universal, the water parks and Sea world and only run once a day, there were 6 of us which would have made it very expensive, the local taxi cost around $20 return from Sea world and $30-35 for Universal which was great value and we were not restricted by time,top-tip, get the number of your taxi driver and use them for the duration of your holiday we did and he was always available when we text him a time to pick up or collect well done JOSEPH. As I said the hotel was in a great location very safe to walk around in the evening there are plenty of restaurants inc TGI'S, Angus steakhouse, Pizza hut, Denny's etc a Pharmacist, supermarkets and gift shops in about 10min and in around 20 mins you can walk to Down Town Disney. The hotel is perfect for families the staff are some of the friendliest I have ever met, nothing is too much trouble and will assist you at all times with regards to anything! Also there is free wifi with the grounds so no hefty phone bills to come home too. The only thing that niggled me was that there was no bar in the hotel or on site restaurant. Saying that I would certainly use this hotel again. Well done guys this hotel certainly made our holiday :) The location is superb right in-between the Disney Parks and Universal studios.

Reviews.Title: “One essential extra would make this an even better hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robocop1
Reviews.Content: This is a really great little hotel to use as a base for visting the surrounding attractions especially Disney as it offers a complimentary bus shuttle to Epcot where you can get transport to all the other parks. Our room was really more of an apartment with a separate bedroom containing two huge beds and a TV. There is also a separate bathroom with WC and a large washroom. On entering the apartment there is a kitchen with a big fridge/freezer, microwave, hob, dishwasher, table and 4 chairs.. This leads onto a lounge area with sofa's and another big TV. My one grievance is that there is no safe in the room to keep valubales. Instead there are some small safe boxes in reception but not enough for one per room and as the hotel was busy we consequently were unable to get one and had to carry my valuables around with us for the duration which was just as well as on one day we found our door had not been closed properly after it had been cleaned and anyone could have just walked in - luckily no one did. This may have been speciific to our room only but the air conditoning was incredibly nosiy when it kicked in and although we could have turned it off the room would have been uncomfortably hot at night. Breakfasts are good and change on a daily basis with 3 cooked items each morning supplemented by toast, bagels, doughnuts, cereals, fruit and yoghurt. Another little perk was the early evening Monday hotdog and alcoholic drink ( beer or wine) which were compliments of the manager to all guests. Really nice to come back to after a day at the theme parks. As has already been mentioned the pool is small and it's not really the sort of hotel I would stay in purely to sit by the pool all day. Loads of nearby diners & restaurants that are only a 5-10 minute walk away - all with good menus. The decor was a little dated but most importantly it was clean hotel. I would definately stay at this hotel again to use as a base for

Reviews.Title: “An ideal family hotel in the midst of Disney.”
Reviews.Author: kunverji1930
Reviews.Content: I'm currently staying at the hotel and so far everything from staff services to room and general hotel cleanliness has lived up to expectation. The only downside to this hotel is the breakfast. It needs more variety rather than omlettes and scrambled eggs every other day. For $3.99 we had a buffet breakfast just around the corner which had a huge variety and every mouthful was a joy to the palate. Other than this,a good hotel for families and couples alike.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel and fab stay....”
Reviews.Author: x-titfortat-x
Reviews.Content: we have jusy returned from an 11 night stay at this hotel and had a very pleasent stay here. Firstly, the location is great for all the parks, local amenities and shops. You can walk to the shops by cutting though a few buildings across the road which is really handy. We didn't go to all the parks but for the ones we did visit we hired a car or got a cab and it was literally 5/10 minutes to each park and about ten dollars in a cab. The hotel itself was clean and tidy and the rooms were great. our room had two double beds, a living room with a second tv (which was great when i kept waking up in the middle of the night because of jet lag) And a really ample kitchen with everything you need to do a bit of self catering should you wish to.....we didn't because there's probably a different resturant in the area to have breakfast, lunch and dinner a different place every day of the year! the pool area was ok. The pool was quite small and often over crowded which meant we never seemed to get a chance for a proper swim, but that's ok, we did appreciate that it was very much a child friendly hotel but it was a shame that there was no pool side bar for drinks and snacks as we enjoy that kind of thing on a holiday and it's nice to sit by the pool with a drink in the early evenings when it's still warm. Having said this, the pool was a lovely temperature and always spotlessly clean. The breakfasts were good, and for a complimentry meal at the start of the day you can't really complain. It'd have been pefect if they'd had more options of 'cold' choices like more cereals or fruits but what they did offer in the way of omelettes and bacon etc was ample. The staff in the hotel were great and a particular mention goes to Milton on reception and Joey who does the bar in the evenings. both of these guys were so helpful and friendly, advising us on the local area and where to eat. it's nice that they remember names/faces in such a busy hotel and place. Someone on here has said there is only one lift. nope, there is two. the first one is near reception and the other is at the end of the corridor - the later lift always arrives much quicker than the former! one quick tip for the evenings if you fancy a night out - go to Pointe Orlando (between 10 and 20 dollars in a taxi or about a half hour walk) It's a bit more lively and 'happening' with some bars and what not. we went there twice and enjoyed drinks and dinner in a few places and had a great time. another few tips for dinner - Chillis, Don Pablos, Perkins, Charlie's steak house (get your name on the wall if you can manage the 50 ounce steak but the prices might make you squirm!). we also swam with dolphins during our stay and i recommend this to everyone - absolutely incredible, but i'll leave that for another review. This was my first time in the USA and thanks to all the friendly staff not only in the hotel but the local area I now have the bug to visit more of the USA and can't wait to get cracking on our next trip to the states. Absolutely fantastic country and i now see why everyone raves about you guys! Thanks again... xxxxx

Reviews.Title: “'Great location'”
Reviews.Author: debrahuntington
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back after 2 weeks stay (2 adults/3 kids) and friends. 1st time to Orlando so were a little apprehensive and our expectations were high. We wernt disappointed! Hired a car booked it online easy. We found hotel straight away asked couple people on route. Location was spot on 5 mins drive to disney, 15 mins to universal, 5 mins walk to loads restaurants. Would recommend Hooters, gud for a burger, Black Angus steak and Shrimps were marvelous, Olive Garden italian and v. gud and across crossroads The Ale House the cheapest but definately worth a mention. Couple times we got taxis (8 people) so we could have a beer 30 dollars to Universal City Walk or 3 buses!!! Downtown Disney and Pleasure Island was 16 dollars, kids loved Disney Quest which were included on tickets we had bought online otherwise $40ish. Winn Dixie supermarket around the corner for supplies locals really friendly everytime we went we were offered someones saver card brill! Staff at hotel were great couple times wen we had a few busy days at parks came back to hotel had a soak in hot tub couple cold beers, Cedric on the desk had papa johns pizza ( never had a bad order always piping hot) on speed dial - great end to fabulous day. Edwardo was great with the kids at breakfast time kept them entertained - food was better than expected couple hot items fruit, cereals, toast and jams, juice, tea and coffee. Rooms i would say are bit dated but never the less gud value perhaps cud do with being bit bigger ( there was 5 of us and the sofa bed was not mega comfy) kitchen was more that adequate cud have cooked if we d have wanted. Maid service was great washed our cups etc clean towels everyday. Mon-thurs couple free beers and pop, crisps incl in price, managers special on wed wen you could have burger 1 week and hotdog other. Pool is fairly small but we always got a bed, hot tub, basket ball area, even got bbqs that you could use. Free towels. You couldnt ask for anything more other than perhaps foot massage! Few tips: 2 toll roads from international airport $1.75 for both make sure you get in right queue if you havent change a fine if not. We took a picnic to parks including couple frozen waters not a problem saved us loads(we ate out every evening) although food looked really nice and not a bad price. Refillable cups available which wer gud value. We took dollars with us and credit card in case we ran out which we didnt but you do need it for car and hotel, we roughly spent around $100-$150 for 5 of us on evening meal incl drinks sometimes bottle wine. Never saw a exchange shop. We ordered our tickets for parks online with ' i love orlando' £1600 for disney and universal and from what others said ours wer cheapest included fastpass in disney. Try to plan what rides you want to go on you can only have fastpass tickets on so many rides and every so often throughout day and queues can be long!! Wear comfy shoes!!! Sorry like War and Peace but so much i cud say but definately would use this hotel again. Have fun......

Reviews.Title: “Where not to stay near Disney World”
Reviews.Author: Tillyseattle
Reviews.Content: This is an old property that is poorly maintained with many defects in the room and not much concern on the part of the staff. The issues included missing door hardware, malfunctioning bathroom sink, tears in the furniture and burned out light that never was replaced during our stay. Also compared to other Hotels the breakfast provided each day was well below average. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay here and still a fab little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dgilluk
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hotel in a handy location. Stayed here end of March beginning of April 2012 and was our 3rd stay there. Suites are very clean, spacious and equip with everything you will need. The only disappointment is the King suites (one huge bed) are only located near the lifts or end of the corridor next to the air con units so can be slightly noisy, the beds are extra comfy! Safety deposit boxes are located behind reception; you sometimes have to put your name on a list for one if the hotel is busy. One of the reviews on here says there is only one lift but that is not the case there is two, one is located just off reception at the top of the hall way on the left and one is located right at the bottom of the hall way on the left hand side where the ice machines are, we used this one frequently as our room was near it. At breakfast they serve a variety of food on different day which is a bit repetitive but its great for free and to fill up before you head out for the day! The happy hour special on an evening is a nice little touch. Staff are all friendly and helpful. Disappointed that Jason on reception has left but these things happen. The guy who serves the drink at happy hour is lovely and he recognised us which was nice. There are plenty of restaurants within a short walking distance for example Cici's pizza restaurant/take out, steak houses, run and run Chinese take out which do delivery, McDonalds, Burger King, Steak and Shake, TGI Fridays, Buffalo Wild Wings etc and also a large food mart. You can walk to Downtown Disney which takes about 20 minutes. The Links buses run frequently outside of the hotel, all day passes cos $4.50. The hotel offers a shuttle bus service to all parks including Universal, the Disney drop off is at Epcot then you have to use Disney transportation to get to the other parks which is so easy. The only thing we found with the shuttle bus was that its restricting as there is only one from the hotel at either 8.30am or 11am ish and the earliest one back to the hotel is 6pm! I think the hotel should look into putting a more frequent service on! Hope this review helps people.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: hollytree63
Reviews.Content: Spent two weeks here with our family (2 adults/2 children). We wanted a suite-hotel (with a separate bedroom) as our youngest child was only 12 months old at the time and we knew she'd be going to bed long before we were! We also wanted somewhere fairly spacious and the Hawthorne Suites did not disappoint. It's a nice complex and excellent value for money. Staff were extremely friendly and approachable. The room was a great size with a kitchen/ diner, separate lounge area and bedroom (with two queen size beds). Kitchen was well equipped (dishwasher, microwave, fridge, hob and plenty of plates, cups, glasses, utensils etc). Room was cleaned well (every day if you want or you can opt to have it done less than this is you don't want staff traipsing in your room on a regular basis). The outside pool area and hot tub was pleasant. There are landscaped gardens and basketball courts. It's not a huge garden area (and the pool could get fairly crowded some evenings) but it was enough for my children and a good place for them to cool off in after a hot day at Disney World. Breakfast was free (as was parking) and there was a fairly good variety of hot and cold food. The breakfast area could get crowded but they had an extra 'over flow' room they opened up on some days so there was always enough seating to be found. Hotel was close - only a mile or so away - to Disney. There were shuttle buses that came to the hotel (as long as you were prepared to go at set times) although we had a car with us so didn't take these. Overall a really pleasant stay and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, will be back....”
Reviews.Author: SaintmarkLondon
Reviews.Content: I thought hard about giving this hotel 4 out of 5, but it's not quite a 5. But I should point out, before I write the review I will definitely come back and definitely recommend it. We stayed here for 10 nights in March/April 2012. The hotel is in a great location, close to Disney, sea world and 15+ restaurants. The olive garden 1/4 mile away is great. But there are plenty. There is a Walmart 7 or 8 mins away in the car also. So location is great. Staff - all of the reception staff are top draw, very good and helpful. Breakfast and maintenance staff too. The rooms are pretty good - kitchen area with coffee machine, microwave and fridge/freezer. 2 tvs and bath/shower. A little dated but nothing major. Clean and decent beds, pillows ok. The pool is ok, it's not massive and not dozens of beds, but we never had a problem getting one. Kids loved the pool, it was very warm. Reception and general areas are pretty good, clean and comfortable. Breakfast is good - it's free, so remember that. If you are from the USA and used to good buffets, it will be of average quality. But they do 3 hot items, various fruit, breads etc. We got a bit bored by the end of day 10, but to be fair it started the day off well. Enough choice and the kids enjoyed it. Also the coffee and tea is available all day, a nice touch. Coffee was half decent. Cereal, toast, bagels etc. They do a managers drinks and snacks evening mon to thurs. Two drinks, wine or beer, plus soft drinks. This was a nice touch and we relaxed by the pool whilst having it. There is free wifi in the room, enough for business use. Not super fast, but not bad. Overall, we all really enjoyed our time here and will come back. Please remember this is a 2 1/2 star hotel. It is actually more like a 3 star +. The rooms are nice, lobby nice, drinks and breakfast a nice touch. A great location, that is key. Why didn't I give it 5 stars? I grade hotels on value for money, this certainly is. Ut I would hate for someone to think this is a 4 star type hotel. There is no bar, the gym is useable but only has 5 items I. It (which by the way was perfect for us to use), the rooms are nice but a little dated, the pool is adequate but not amazing, the towels, for example, are not plush. Laundry room, which is helpful. That sums it up, more than adequate for families on holiday and out most of the day - but not plush. We will be back as great value for money. The staff should be commended for doing a great job.

Reviews.Title: “nothing really to moan about, did the job perfectly well!”
Reviews.Author: leo1977London_Uk
Reviews.Content: just arrived back from our holiday in orlando/clearwater we spent 10 nights at the hotel, found the location perfect for where we wanted to go, the breakfast was adequate for what we wanted, something quick and easy, the rooms were clean and everyone seemed friendly, the kitchn in the room was a godsend, we took a lot of picnics with us to the parks and this hotel is based right in the hear of where we wanted to go, in between disney parks with quick access to seaworld, discovery cove etc, we wanted to use our money for the attractions and meals in the evening so brought bread sandwich filings and snacks, drinks, water etc from the walmart on turkey lake road( just left out of hotel and keep going! We used the pool occassionally and it was perfect for our two girls and me and the wife, if i wanted to be ultra picky then there is a slight gap under the main door allowing some light andnoice in ( sorted with a towel in the evening) the two rooms was nice for us as many days the girls were shattered and faced with the choice of all going to bed at 8pm or going for a nap late afternoon, we could put them in the main bedroom. All in all a great hotel for the price and the amount it saves you in time and expense, would not hesitate to come back when disney inevitably calls us again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not so updated hotel”
Reviews.Author: masi68
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 5 nights and we did have a very good stay. Our room was next to the elevator and I guess the walls must be rather thin, because we hard it blinging now and then through the night. The interior was rather dark and we felt it could use some renovation. The rooms and as far as we could see, all areas in the hotel were very clean. The staff were ok, but not overly attentive and helpful, but for our needs it worked fine. Parking was no problem at all. The breakfast buffet, that was included in the price, was ok, but if you don't like fried food in the morning, there wasn't too much to choose from. The pool area was very nice, with also a small bakset ball area. However, there were very few sunbeds and if you got there late in the afternoon, it could be hard to find one that was free. The location itself of the hotel is very good, close to Disney World, Sea World, Universal Studios and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for La Nouba performance!”
Reviews.Author: travellingator
Reviews.Content: Since Downtown Disney can be such a busy place, we chose to stay at the Hawthorn Suites for the night of the La Nouba 9pm performance. Arrived early, enjoyed the lovely pool and hot tub, as well as complimentary beer/wine before heading to dinner. Easy 5 minute drive to Downtown Disney for evening events. The next morning, enjoyed a hot breakfast and read our books poolside before heading back to our home at 11am checkout! Lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good but...”
Reviews.Author: Klorina
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Orlando. It was 2 adults and 2 children( 5 years old). Pros: The location is great (close to all the shopping, parks, restaurants, supermarket, etc). Clean (the room was cleaned on time and well). There was no bad smell or stains. The housekeeping even did our dishes. The room had everything we needed:2 separate rooms for privacy (king suite), small kitchen with all the utilities, Bathroom could be entered from either the living room or bedroom. This was good bc kids did not disturb us and we didn't disturb them. The pool is clean and well-maintained. It's small, but was never full, so wasn't overwhelmingly crowded. Breakfast that they serve was pretty good, better than I would expect from a place like this for a free breakfast. They changed the items daily and pretty good variety. Free parking for hotel guests, as opposed to other Wyndham hotels I was looking into (charge $15 a day). The hotel itself is located in a quiet street, green and surrounded by other nice hotels and vacation clubs. The quality of beds and pillows was pretty good. Usually it's difficult for me to find good pillows in hotels, not this time. Cons: The room that we stayed in (201) was facing the pool. All the rooms facing the pool had air conditioning units right outside of the window. The unit turned on and off all the time, throughout the night. They were noisy and were working non-stop. Another negative ( you can avoid by making sure you don't stay by the elevator), was the elevator button. It was making noise all night long and was very annoying. Another thing is that the elevator was very slow. Thankfully, we were on the second floor and could take the stairs, but for those who stayed on the higher floors was inconvenience. Overall, it a good hotel for the price we paid. Next time if we go, we will stay in a different room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: notso186338
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 weeks through Virgin Holidays. Good choice if you don't want International Drive. A 40 min walk to Down town Disney, free bus to Disney Parks, but good idea to have a car if you wanna go elsewhere. Our room was clean and comfortable, daily maids was nice. The 'free' evening snack and drink was a little lacking in thought, should visit Homewood Suites on international Drive, now they know how to lay on an evening snack! Staff were all great. Did not use pool area, but it was always being used by others, so must have been ok. We stayed during spring break. Kids coming out of the Walls, so lifts busy, but use the stairs, it keeps your weight down!! Breakfast ok. All in all, a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great value. Terrific stay”
Reviews.Author: zeppelin27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights with our 2 boys (ages 19 and 14). The location was perfect for our trips to Universal Studios and Discovery Cove. Staff was very courteous and helpful. Breakfast was plentiful with good selection. The staff at breakfast were friendly and eager to answer my questions about ingredients in certain foods (I must eat gluten free). I was impressed with the number of items that I could eat. Our suite (2 queens + pull out couch) with kitchen was spacious. We faced the pool area and it was very quiet at night. It was nice not to feel crowded in a hotel room. The kitchen had everything we needed to make our own meals a couple of times. The boys enjoyed some down time in the game room and on the basketball court. The room was very clean with one exception - a slight bit of mildew on the shower curtain. I brought this to the front desk's attention and the curtain was replaced with a new one. I would def. recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: EmsyC
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend were staying here for half marathon weekend at Disney and had a blast here. We were skeptical about a first floor room but we were in and out so much it became convenient. We had an executive suite that included 2 luxurious queen sized beds and an en suite kitchen . Kitchen had ample materials to cook (heck we made steak twice that week) and 2 burners - even a dishwasher! The living area/kitchen was one area, bathroom another, sink another, and bedroom another. Each of these areas had doors so that they could have been closed off for privacy - loved it! Don't forget a tv in the bed room and another in the living room! The free wifi in the room was very good, fast enough to FaceTime on an iPad/iPhone no lag. If you need Internet at the hotel, you will need to pay, bring your own devices! I can't say much about the shuttle, never took it. One of the Disney world entrances were 5 minutes away via car so we never used it. This hotel is close to outlet shopping - 2 major ones. Have to drive there, looks close on the map but don't be fooled! Vineland and International outlets maybe 15 minutes away tops. There's also plenty of food in the area from sushi to Olive Garden. And we found a Target and Publix where we bought our steaks to cook, very convenient. On the topic of food, the free breakfast at the hotel was great too. They alternated everyday. scrambled eggs, sausage, ham, waffles are just some of your options. The oatmeal was also memorable - creamy and warm. Bananas and some canned fruit are other options. We attended the free reception in the afternoon once - we never made it back in time for the others, too much to do! They offered juice,soda, beer, and wine for free as promised.

Reviews.Title: “A great relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff K
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for the money. We stayed for 5 nights and had a great experience. Suites were spacious and very well equipped. The breakfasts were awesome for a continental breakfast. There were hot items as well as all the usual cold food and there was something different every day. Staff were very helpful and knowledgable in giving information and directions in the area. Hotel is very close to Epcot Center-6 minutes for us- and Seaworld-10 minutes for us. Only negative about the whole stay was the VERY slow elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great family stay”
Reviews.Author: powerhouse44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights with our 2 kids (6 and 10) and in-laws next room over. We chose it because this hotel because we wanted a suite with a separate room so if the kids got up early, they could hang out in the living room (this in fact happened and it worked perfectly!). The rooms were clean, spacious, and quiet. Beds were comfortable. If you have kids, I recommend the poolside room view. The staff was pleasant throughout the stay. We took advantage of all the fun amenities: pool, hot tub, game room, basketball court. Everything was clean and maintained well. We had breakfast each morning and it was good. Each day brought something different; scrambled eggs, pancakes, sausages, waffles, ham, oatmeal, fresh fruit, juices. Breakfast was from 7-9:30am. We also took advantage of the happy hour Mon-Thur 5:30-7:30: beer and wine (2 drinks per person) and a light snack (pretzels, chips, etc.). Do not plan on counting this as your dinner! Wednesdays are the manager reception which had burgers and they were pretty good. The hotel location was good; lots of shops and restaurants nearby and not far from the Disney entrance and Downtown Disney (not walking distance though). Overall a great stay and I recommend this hotel for anyone that prefers suites and close to Disney. I felt like we got a lot value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for the budget”
Reviews.Author: Steph962
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a perfect base to explore all those theme parks in Orlando. It is closed to both Universal, Disney and SeaWorld (within 15 minutes of driving), and there are also many restaurants within walking distance. A Walmart is located approximately 4 miles or 8 minutes north of the hotel (Turkey Lake Road), so you can buy everything you need there. That said, I would definitely recommend anyone going to Orlando to have a rental car, it will make your life much more easier (and it's cheap too). Back to the hotel, it is a five stories building near all attractions, but yet it's in a quiet neighborhood so there is not any issue related to surrounding noise. The room decor is definitely not modern, but they are kept clean and functional. I booked the King Suite and it is large with separate bedroom and a kitchenette. My room has a view to the pool. Although there is only two lifts for the whole hotel, I never need to wait long for the lift to come. Swimming pool and a basketball half-court is free to all guests. Parking, wifi internet, free breakfast are also included in the rate. For the room rate I was offered, this is definitely a great value. The breakfast is nice and include eggs and one hot meat (sausages, bacon, ham, etc) per day. Also has breads, bagels, corn flakes, yoghurt, fruits, etc. Very enough for us to start the day, and I never get bored about it. Remember this is complimentary breakfast, any expectation of lots of choices is simply irrelevant. There are free shuttles to parks but since I have my own rental car I didn't use it. The hotel staffs are all very friendly and helpful. Some little issues, the sounds of water running along the pipe from the next room can be heard so it may cause those light sleeper some problem if your neighbor take a shower in the early morning. Also the cooking utensils are limited and some are heavily stained. But when I ask the housekeeper they promptly get another cleaner one for us. To summarize, a very good hotel for the budget and it is well located. Don't expect it to be a luxury resort and you will be alright.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandra Y
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Hawthorn Suites Lake Buena Vista, Orlando from 23 February through 2 March. What a wonderful find! The suite was immaculate and consisted of a bedroom, living room area, galley kitchen with full refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher, and two counter burners, and bathroom with tub and toilet separated from the sink area. There were two TVs (no one has to fight over what shows to watch), coffee maker, hair dryer, plates and utensils...everything you need. The staff were incredibly helpful and courteous. A buffet breakfast was available every morning from 7:00 - 9:30 am with hot and cold items. We never got to the pool or the exercise room, but it was there if you wanted it. The laundry room was clean and tidy. The hotel was very convenient to Disney Parks (about 10 minutes away), Universal Parks (15 minutes away) , a HUGE outlet mall (5 minutes) and was within walking distance of many restaurants and several large grocery stores. The price was EXCELLENT and was initially how I found it on the internet. However, the absolute BEST part of staying there was Mary, our housekeeper. Everyday, she made a towel animal for us and incorporated various objects we left in the room - tiaras, stuffed animals, etc. into them! One day it was a Swan; then a Teddy bear, Micky's head, and a sea turtle! We raced into the room after visiting the parks to see what Mary had made for us! We really got a kick out of them! I will DEFINITELY stay there again the next time I am in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “February 2012 8th-22nd”
Reviews.Author: Helen G
Reviews.Content: This our third stay with the Hawtorn Suites twice in this particular one at LBV and would use again. The hotel is close to Disney , Universal Studios , Wet n Wild, Seaworld etc. The Staff are welcoming and very efficient just cannot fault the place at all. We used the pool and jaccuzzi. Great breakfast which gave us a start to our day and met our taste. We did attend the Managers evening with wine , beer and hotdogs which was very nice. Free safe to put all your valuables in. Plenty of space to park. Will be returning again in the future.I do prefer the location of this one as have stay at the other Hawthorn suite just off International Drive and didnt like it International Drive reminds me of the seafront in Blackpool and is constantly jammed with traffic dont waste your holiday sat in traffic stay in this one at LBV better location all round and even close to WalMart.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Enjoy a Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Susan M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and well maintained with housekeeping each day. We appreciated the extra room of a suite. The staff members were very friendly and helpful. The daily breakfast met our needs and we also enjoyed the manager's reception during the week. Our family used the pool each day during our trip. It was never overcrowded, and we had the opportunity to meet several other families. The hotel was in an excellent location to access Downtown Disney, Seaworld and the major highways for other sightseeing. I am rating this hotel as excellent given the comparison to what we got for the price as we have stayed at a moderate hotel on Disney property in the past. This hotel acutally exceeded our experience on Disney property two years ago. We definitely will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTEL IN A GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: superstarintheworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one week for a trip to Disneyworld and SeaWorld and we loved the hotel. The location is really good and if you don't have a car you can use the free shuttles from the hotel, they bring you to all the Disney theme parks ( it takes around 30 minutes because the shuttle stops in other hotels to carry more people ) and to Sea World ( that was better because the shuttle was just for us and we reached SeaWorld in about ten minutes without other stops), anyway for us the shuttle were free because we booked through Virgin Holidays but if your agency does not have the free shuttles included you can still use them and pay about 10 dollars per person for a round trip. The staff is nice but nothing special. The room is great, it is a suite so it has all the comforts of home and you can actually cook there so you can save on meals, there is no restaurant on site but you can order food from other restaurants ( we did not do it ) or you can have a walk to some local restaurants, but we did not do it either. There is also a supermarket close to the hotel and some shops that sell Disney merch and other stuff at lowest prices than inside the theme parks. The free breakfast is okay if you are American or British, but we are from Italy and we did not like the items they served so after a couple of mornings we stopped doing breakfast there, anyway they serve coffee, milk, cereals, fruits, and some cooked food. There is a parking outside but we did not have a car so we do not know if it is free or not. The hotel is quiet and you don't hear noises from the cars even if it is quite close to the street, the cleaness is okay, you can buy tickets to some of the major attractions including Disney directly in the hotel. The area is safe and the rooms are quite too, we rarely heard noises from other guests. Overall we liked our stay there, it was also pretty cheap for its location and its quality and we recommend it to people, both families and not, that want to enjoy a Disney holiday in a safe and nice hotel close to all the major theme parks. ps= they also offer a shuttle to Universal and Universal Islands of Adventures that was quite a long trip, almost a hour, because the shuttle drivers stopped to several other hotels to pick up more people so if you want to reach the parks faster you will need to book a private shuttle or a taxi; for all the theme park's shuttle they don't have much choices regarding the time tables, the one that is better connected is DisneyWorld but for instance they drop you off at Epcot and you need to use the monorail too to go to Magic Kingdom or the free Disney bus to Animal Kingdom. For Seaworld and Universal Studios ( both Universal parks) they don't have a night shuttle and can be a pity for Universal if you want to enjoy the CityWalk at night, then you have to book a taxi or a private shuttle to come back at your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: jonesj27562
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location and breakfast was good which were 2 of my criteria. It could improve on the room cleanliness. The glasses in the room still had water in them after the room was cleaned and the glasses in the bathroom appeared to be just put back into their place by the sink on TOP of the cover that originally was on the glasses. Just kept bottled water after that. We were on the 5th floor. The hallway was like 90 degrees but our room was cool. We were very far from the front and I wonder if that is because we used Expedia! Anyway the shuttle left 3 times a day from the hotel so I ended up driving to the park. Overall it was ok. They could work on the cleanliness

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time allways”
Reviews.Author: Lynn343
Reviews.Content: We have been to this hotel for five visits, and have booked for a sixth. Bernard and his team do the best to accommodate us in all our requests we love the helpfulness from the front desk and the rooms are so tidy and clean. The maids are fantastic. Mary is one of the best. Makes us little towel gifts each time. Makes you feel special. We look forward to our next visit. It is like coming home to us. We have been to Florida for many holidays. This is by far the best. We have stayed on Disney but since finding this hotel nothing else compares to the Hawthorn suites. Guys we will be back soon see you all then. L&B

Reviews.AuthorLocation: San José, San Jose, Costa Rica
Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable vacation!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: María Clemencia M
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great staff, great service. Our stay was unforgetable. We will return next January. Our daugther is missing too much this beautiful hotel!! Thanks for all.

Reviews.Title: “Not walking distance to Downtown Disney”
Reviews.Author: Kikomax
Reviews.Content: We traveled here for 4 days with 4 adults and a 2yo and stayed on the 4th floor.. The room was clean with a good functional floor plan allowing my 2yo to nap during the day. Also the staff was friendly but had difficulty getting our key activated and halfway through our stay the key stopped working again. We did get pool view room per other recomendations and it was quiet but the walls are thin so we had to talk quietly while our 2yo napped. I was surprised they supplied paper towels for the kitchenette but no dish soap and limited shampoo and no conditioner or lotion.The breakfast were decent and filled you up for the day pool and spa were nice. I was deciding between this and another hotel but decided on this one because of a comment by another guest about a "short walk to Downtown Disney". It is not a short walk to Downtown Disney it is 1 mile away and you have to cross a 6 lane busy road to get there! I did talk with a mom there who was upset because she was not allowed to take her double stroller on the shuttle bus to disney the shuttle service didn't allow it and the manager was unwilling to give her the umbrella stollers they had there even though another employee had offered them.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CAZ6743
Reviews.Content: from the first time we set foot in the hotel to the time we left, we found the staff to be more than accommodating, friendly and helpful - from the reception staff, kitchen staff to the housekeeping staff. The breakfasts every morning were great with something for everyone. The towels and bins were changed every day in the room, and the bed linens were tidied or changed when required. Having the suite gave us more space than just a room for four of us. We used the kitchen facilities and found we had all the dishes and cutlery etc that we needed. Good base for all the theme parks and shops and restaurants nearby. We definitely want to come back again for our next holiday.

Reviews.Title: “good time”
Reviews.Author: catie J
Reviews.Content: We stayed five days and our room was great .. The staff was wonderful and we got our room for a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: rjandmj
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 3rd floor and got a room not overlooking the pool. The kitchen area was in tough shape with peeling cupboards and poorly supplied. The fitness area has a couple of primitive treadmills but adequate. The breakfast was good. It served it's purpose but I guess we have been spoiled by other Hawthorn Suite facilities in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Competitive; yet some Inconsistency”
Reviews.Author: To_Travel_is_to_Live
Reviews.Content: Positive: Free Wi-Fi, Big rooms, Big bed, Free parking, Friendly staff, Downs as bedding standard, Pool very clean & heated, Free small pool towels, and among all lovely quiet compared to all the buzz of Orlando though located right in the triangle of Disney, SeaWorld, Universal with a maximum of 10 minutes’ drive to each. Negative: Bed too soft; Breakfast very unhealthy: No organic choices, no fresh fruit, wheat in all bread – should include bread choice with fibre contend of 8-12%, listed eggs as part of the breakfast buffet- checked two days but there were none; Housekeeping inconsistent- only received 3 out of 6 cleans and had to ask for standard coffee replenishment and dishwashing soap every day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Hotel great price and the continental breakfast A+”
Reviews.Author: VillRey
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel, nice place to stay ; ) clean, room spacious and attentive staff. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: kwajalein92
Reviews.Content: We found the Hawthorn Suites nice for our week long stay. We were in Orlando for a family Disney vacation. We loved having a living room/ kitchen along with a bedroom. The staff was pleasant. The hot breakfast was adequate, much better than a typical continental breakfast. We also liked the location of the hotel. It was convenient to everything. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disney World/Universal Trip”
Reviews.Author: brownbb57
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a very close to Downtown Disney but is hard to find. The maid service leaves a lot to be desired as does the overall condition of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsWalker30
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hawthorn on for the first part of our Honeymoon. We wanted to do Disney and Harry Potter. We have nothing bad to say about the Hawthorne. The rooms were fantastic, really big and the bed was huge!! It had a kitchen, dining table and little living room with the bedroom and the bathroom off both. After a hard day at the parks it was a great place to go home to. We ended up parking the car and walking over to Kitty O Sheas for a drink or walking somewhere for dinner. There is a great Italian across the road (whose name escapes me!) but it really is fab. On the subject of the parks, Disney was fantastic and as we had done Universal before we just bought a day ticket for Islands of Adventure so we could go to Harry Potter. If you are a potter fan you will LOVE it. No detail has been missed. The only downsides are: A. The crowds - It was so so busy!! It ruined it a little for us as you were shunted about like mad and queued endlessly for everything. B. The cost - The photo for the Harry Potter ride is $30!! Everywhere else they range from $15-$20 but there seems to be at least a 25% mark up on everything at Potter land. On the whole though! BRILLIANT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: SMCFAN_10
Reviews.Content: Booked through Expedia after searching the reviews on trip advisor. All the great feedback was right on. The suites have a full kitchen, a nice living room space and a bedroom. The bathroom/tub&shower are seperate from the sink/mirror area. The beds are very comfortable and do the job after a long day at the attractions. The hotel was very quiet. There are a number of choices for breakfast each day that change a little daily. The hotel sits in a quiet area off the busy main streets. 10 minutes from Disney. Easy in and out with ample parking. There is also a happy hour each evening during the week if you return to the hotel early. All the staff was very helpful and patient with everyone. Check in and out was quick. A special thanks to Shadanza, Carlos and the breakfast staff. We had a great stay and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: Jessy P
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through expedia, weren't sure what to expect. When we got there, we walked into an amazing suite! Fridge, stove, dishwasher.. I mean everything you need for a week long stay. There was a kitchen table, a seperate living room from the bedroom, and a seperate mirror/sink/getting ready area from the washroom... couldn't be more perfect for a few girls on a trip. The rooms themselves were amazingly clean, and I'm a clean freak, I couldn't find a spot of dirt. They were kept in that shape throughout the entire week. The free hot breakfast was delicious! It was different every day, so you didn't get bored of the food, and I didn't have a single bad breakfast there. We loved the shuttles to and from the Disney parks, saved a lot of money on parking, also a great way to get to know the people staying at the hotel with you. Best part of the hotel was the desk staff. They were so much fun! They were helpful (always pointing us to the BEST restaurants for supper), funny, and always had time for us. They even suggested other cool places to go see (like beaches that suited what we were looking for), printed off maps for us, and really made our stay enjoyable. We even looked forward to going past the main desk, so we could have a visit! - The canadian girls!

Reviews.Title: “The Best kept secret in Orlando!!! Thank you to Cedric, Carlos, Shadanza, Pete & crew!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Paulino D
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed at a nicer place where the ENTIRE staff caters to your every need with such genuine kindness and courtesy...And, what a great deal! They not only offer full size suites, but the breakfast and happy hour are an amazing touch! Carlos who runs the happy hour not only provides excellent service with a smile, but remembers every guest and treats them like family... Cedric and Shadanza at the front desk make every day great, and are 2 of the nicest individuals we've met during our stay! Even their maintenance staff & housekeepers are all so great...Pete, you're the man!!!!! They ALL deserve raises there! Do yourself a favor and book your next Disney stay here...you'll be glad you did!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Mizarmour
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in November, while we visited Universal Studios and Seaworld. The location is great, there is an abundance of restaurants just up the road, and it's within 10 to 15 minutes of Universal Studios, Seaworld, Disneyworld, and a Walmart. This was our second time staying here, and we really llike the room layout. We stayed in the two queen suite. There is a kitchenette, a living room area with a pull out sofa and a tv, and there is seperate bedroom with another tv in there. The free hot breakfast is nice, especially since you're spending so much money everywhere else while on your vacation. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel staff I've ever met.”
Reviews.Author: Bigdrinks
Reviews.Content: Spent 18 days at this hotel over Christmas. and was perfect for my family of 2 adults and 2 kids to do all the Disnesy/Universal stuff. The location is ideal. The hotel is spotlessly clean and from the moment we checked in with Bernard til the day we checked out with Shadanza we were treated like valued guests! A special mention must also go to Carlos who was a great host at the evening managers reception. I'd have no hesitation of recommending this hotel, or indeed, returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to rent with at a very good rate”
Reviews.Author: Isabel G
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at this hotel and I love it. I love the way the room is distribute you can have the kids in the living room sofa and have your privacy in your room. Free breakfast and clean rooms. Great Staff. I will stay in this hotel every time I will go back to Orlando Thank you Isabe; Gonzalez

Reviews.Title: “Close to parks, but NOT WORTH IT!”
Reviews.Author: Takemetoalaska
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Marathon Weekend and we were disappointed. We thought we were getting a suite with a full-working kitchen. There was no oven...a sorry excuse for two burners...an outlet in the kitchen that doesn't work....and a fridge that wouldn't cool & spoiled our food. The TV's weren't flatscreen & there's no DVD player in the bedroom. Our bathtub had a leaky faucet. The beds were average as far as being comfortable. All in all, I would rather have paid the same $ to stay @ one of Disney's lower-rate hotels & still have been just as close.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more!!”
Reviews.Author: Ellie T
Reviews.Content: It was an absolutely brilliant stay we had here, and for being a middle range hotel, it could be said to be better than some higher end hotels I have stayed in! The rooms were spotless, and a really good size. There were four of us in a room, which was comfortable and not overcrowded at all. The sofa bed is really only suitable for one person to sleep on, but the other beds are very comfy. Having a kitchen within the room as well is very useful, although we didn't really use ours. We had a large group staying here in several rooms, and all really enjoyed the stay. We went through Virgin who also offered free shuttles to Universal and Disney, which we did use, although you have to let them know if advance of getting on the buses, which are a little old and bumpy!! We didn't have any cars over the week, being a large group, and instead used the number 50 bus outside the hotel, the shuttles and a private transfer company Florida Dolphin Tours which was brilliant. There are also many restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, and we liked Amici Italian and a couple of others about 5mins walk away. It is perfect location, as it isn't as busy as international drive area. The pool and hot tub are also great as well. The breakfast is basic, but if you are happy with toast or cereal and a couple of hot things each day it is perfect, and saves having to go out or pay more for these American hotels. I will certainly be returning to this hotel if I come back to Orlando, there is nothing I can fault them on!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome - Can't wait to go back again next year!”
Reviews.Author: John1979Canada
Reviews.Content: Amazing Hotel. Great location. Close to many restaurants, Win Dixie Grocery Store, Super Walmart, Target, Sea World, Walt Disney World and the Premium. The hotel is one block away from the East entrance into Disney World, brings you right to Downtown Disney. The rooms/suites are spacious, clean, have a full kitchen which makes it easy when travelling with little ones. The best part is that the entire staff are kind, friendly and helpful; which is rare to find these days. We stayed there for a week during the beginning of Jan. 2012, and had a blast. The breakfast buffet was superb, the pool area and basketball net was great, the arcade room and pool table...all things that kept my 3 year old entertained. We are definetly heading back next Christmas break, I won't stay anywhere else when I visit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel close to all parks and resturants”
Reviews.Author: Plymmum
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home after 14 nights at this hotel and i just wanted to say what a fab place walking distance to shops and resturants and that the staff were all very polite and very helpful rooms were a good size as there is 5 of us two adults two teens and a 6 yr old we will come back hopefully soon.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, well maintained hotel”
Reviews.Author: megansworldtravel
Reviews.Content: Location convenient to all major attractions. Suite was spacious and clean, beds very comfortable, kitchen well equipped and sufficient for our needs and breakfast was adequate to get the day started. Staff were helpful and friendly. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location but conventient”
Reviews.Author: Hx4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked away in a quiet location but is still very convenient for both Disney and Universal parks. Rooms are spotlessly clean and have a useful kitchenette. Just down the road from the Hotel there are loads of restaurants including one called Sweet Tomatoes which offers fresh salads, soups and breads - the kids loved this place! I would definitely recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: Would definitely recommend this Hotel to anyone! All the staff are friendly bar none, rooms are fantastic especially the beds!! ( first time in years I have woken without backache!) as someone else has said it was very quiet and never heard a thing whilst in our room for the full 14 nights we stayed. The complimentary breakfast was adequate, just lacked a bit of variation, but it is 'complimentary' so can't complain there. Location could not be better for any of the attractions. We would return anytime to this Hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant for Disney and Universal.”
Reviews.Author: MrsCBryant
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a family. Rooms are nice and big. Even has a big fridge freezer with an ice maker in it. Reception brilliant and friendly. Breakfast is sufficient to start your day. So close to anywhere you might need to go. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Wuggums
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Hawtorn Suites, and we had a great stay. The staff was so nice, and the room was excellent (And very big, like at suite) There lived a family with 4 kids in the room next to us, but we didn't here them at all, and could sleep like babies. Only negative is that, if you burn popcorn in the microwave like we did, you cannot open windows to the get some fresh air inside. So our room smelled of burned popcorn.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Courthalecki6
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful, Despite the hurricane blowing our window out on one of my family members rooms, but thats not the hotels fault. Great breakfast, close to all kinds of theme parks and things to do! We were there during Hurricane Charlie, but everyone was okay & other than crappy weather it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice within the area!”
Reviews.Author: Karlo33
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a short but very nice vacation at the Orlando area. My sister, her husband and myself wer very well impressed and greatly surprised by the Hawthorn Suites Lake Buena Vista. Friendly staff, great facilities and very near every attraction that we were visiting. We will absolutely return to the hotel in the near future. Very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Visit in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: LisaBOttawa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hawthorn Suites for 5 nights at the end of November while visiting the Disney World parks for the first time. I did a lot of research for an Orlando hotel and chose this one because of the good reviews on Trip Advisor. It was a great choice for our family. We had a rental car so didn't use the shuttle. We loved the hot breakfast every day and enjoyed the snacks at night. The 1 bedroom suite worked for our family of 4 but I wish they had a 2 bedroom option. My husband slept in the living room on the pull out couch and I crashed with the kids in the bedroom in the very comfortable 2 queen beds. I asked for a suite away from the elevators on the top floor overlooking the pool, and that's exactly what we got. We used the pool and hot tub once and it was great. We loved the pizza place the hotel promotes (Flippers). We found ourselves ordering dinner from there 3 nights. The pizza and salad was great and it was under $30 for the 4 of us to eat!! After a long day at the parks we found the hotel very comfortable to return to and just kick back with food delivered. Staff were very friendly and with free breakfast, Wifi and parking, it was a great deal at $500 for the 5 nights. We would return!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: RERD09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights on our trip to Disney World. We had a car and it was very easy to get to the parks. Our suite had kitchenette with two burner hot plate but no conventional oven. Regular size fridge. There are minimal knives and utensils but they are adequate. Our beds were very comfortable. Bathroom had separate sink area from toilet/tub area. The general upkeep on the room was good. It was clean. The daily included breakfast was good with hot and cold dishes but only one egg and meat dish each day and they are different. There is cereal, fruit, pastries, juice and breads. There is plenty to eat. Very nice pool/ hot tub area which our granddaughter used a lot. The hotel is in a quiet area. The only negative I have is related to service. We had problems with a broken alarm clock that was reported but never replaced. We had alarms on our phones so we got along. We got this hotel at a good price and felt we got our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: badgershouse
Reviews.Content: Hi we have just got back from our holidays, we stayed 2 weeks and had a 1 bed room suite, it had 2 beds which were very comfy, it was very spacious for me and my husband and my Five year old boy. It had a kitchen will all you need , the only thing it didnt have was a kettle - as i like my cup of tea in a morning but we just bolied a pan instead. The room was very very clean and the maid even did our washing up if we left it. The hotel offered a breakfast every morning which was really good it offered 3 things every day to make a breakfast e.g sausages, scrambled eggs and pancakes or another day it could be ham, omelete and french toast and also had toast, fresh friut and yoghurt. Also had friut juices and coffee. A really good selection. The staff were allways very friendly and would help with any thing you asked. i would stay here again as it had everthing you need to have a wonderful holidya in florida. i would give this hotel 5 stars *****

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: pukkapies
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay. Hotel was exactly as described Staff always helpful and very pleasant. We will definately be returning.Thank you

Reviews.Title: “We were well pleased”
Reviews.Author: Craig L
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and comfortable. Came back from Disney every day to find that Housekeeping had done a superb job replacing towels, making the bed and even washing our coffee pot. The staff are all extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was a pleasant change from the usual bagels, cereal and toast you find at most hotels. The corned beef hash I had this morning was stinkin' awesome. My wife would like to add that the home made oatmeal was also superb. Location was great. Very near all the theme parks, a short jog from I-4. Gripes: Only one elevator in our section of the hotel maked for longer wait times. Wireless internet connection was very fluctuant and very slow at times.

Reviews.Title: “clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: ianandkim831
Reviews.Content: we've just returned from a ten night stay at the hawthorn suites and had a great time, the check in staff are friendly and efficient and will deal with any problems immediately, we had the complimentry breakfast each morning, not a great choice but it's free so i don't understand people moaning about it, always cereals, toast, fruit, yogurt, tea and cofee and a small selection of hot food each day, it kept us going most the day, eduardo at breakfast had my son giggling most mornings, we went as a family of 3, 39,29 and 6. only 15mins drive to disney, sea world and outlet stores, room consisted of bedroom with r/c tv, sofa bed in lounge with r/c tv, fridge freezer which was very handy for keeping drinks cool, microwave, hob, plates, pans and cutlery, it was like a self catering b&b. would recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay there again. free drinks in the lobby 5.30 - 7.30 with snacks a nice little bonus too. rooms cleaned well each day and whole hotel area spotless. well done hawthorn, thanks for a nice stay. the astill family, U.K.

Reviews.Title: “Search no Further”
Reviews.Author: Christopher R
Reviews.Content: Kudos to the front desk staff, incredibly nice, helpful, informative. Housekeeping top-notch (kid threw up in public bathroom…wouldn’t even know it 10 minutes later!). Maintenance staff very quick & efficient (helped get the outdoor grill working – cooked outside 3 times!). . Purrfect location. Wouldn’t EVEN look anywhere else. Would even pay a bit more to stay there (shhhhh).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Location and Property”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: This place was great! Very reasonably priced, the staff was great, plenty of parking available, our suite was spacious and the facility was clean. They offer a breakfast in the morning, and eventhough we did not partake of it, everyone else seemed to be enjoying it. It would be nice if they could offer more fruit and non-meat options for those that dont eat meat. They also had beer and wine with light food in the evening. Again, due to our diets, we were unable to enjoy this as well, but again others seemed to be pleased. We had a rental, so getting around was not a problem. Even with us not being able to take part in the provided dining, I still give it 5 (five) circles.

Reviews.Title: “super”
Reviews.Author: billnasty
Reviews.Content: what a great place clean comfortable everything you needed with friendly helpful staff especially Cedric Eliana and Shadanza who were all so helpful and knowledgeable the breakfast and free drinks were a real bonus good location but I would recommend a car would come again and will recommend to friends and family

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Worrypenny
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here and certainly the good out-weighs the not-so-good. It's location is good; well placed for both Disney and Universal and would recommend the use of a hire car. We used Palm Parkway onto Turkey Lake Road for Universal Studios rather than the busy I4. There's a great Walmart on Turkey Lake Rd but love the Super Target on the US192! And we used Hotel Plaza Blvd to access Disney property; although it takes a little longer to get places,the parks etc are well sign posted. You could possibly walk to Downtown Disney but it would take best part of an hour. Our suite was ample for us with kitchen area, lounge area plus dining table and chairs, bedroom and bathroom. We would have liked a kettle as well as the coffee maker but I suppose that's a very British thing! Having a full-size fridge was great. The suite was cleaned everyday which was a godsend. We missed not having a safe in the room but there are limited safety deposit boxes at reception. The breakfast was adequate. The hot items changed little from day to day. It was nice to know that if we came back from the parks early, a free drink was waiting during happy hour. Above all, the staff were superb; friendly, informative and polite. Great stay, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “GEAT VALUE FOR MONEY & CENTRAL TOO”
Reviews.Author: springburnlodge
Reviews.Content: we found the hawthorn ideal to visit florida near all the parks and the hotel and free breakfast was ideal,

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Mic6_11
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. We stayed for 14 nights. The room was great with everything that was needed. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was perfect with lots of variety for the 6 of us! The pool and outside area was beautiful, and very quiet. The location was fabulous as is was so central to all the attractions. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. Great value!!

Reviews.Title: “Visit to Disneyworld”
Reviews.Author: Jane B
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel thru Expedia and AARP. Looked at it on line and it was close to where I wanted to be. It turned out to be perfect in every way. The staff was polite without being invasive and the suite was clean and very comfortable. It is located in an area that had wonderful tall trees and lovely landscaping. i would recommend it to anyone wanting a quiet but elegant lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: WDW11
Reviews.Content: We are repeat guests at Hawthorn Lake Buena Vista. Last month was our 18th visit. Each and every time we stay here and have a great time! This is a very comfortable hotel, the perfect hotel to stay while in Orlando! This last time we stayed from October 15 to October 30. It literally became our home away from home for these last wonderful 7 years! Let´s be more specific: 1. The LOCATION is the best you can get. The hotel is located at 8303 Palm Parkway, Lake Buena Vista, a charming and quiet street, less than 2 mins from SR 535 and the Downtown Disney entrance. We have stayed at two Disney hotels before (Coronado Springs/All-Star Movies) and felt kind of in the middle of nowhere. That´s not the case with Hawthorn. Exiting the hotel make a right towards 535 and you are in the middle of everything: The Crab House, Olive Garden, Red Lobster, Macaroni Grill, Pizza Hut, Burger King, McDonald´s, Post Office, two Walgreens, Wal-Mart, Orlando Premium Outlets(off 535), Black Angus Steakhouse, Sizzler, Dixie´s Supermarket (good prices), Gooding´s Supermarket (expensive), only to name a few (really). Nothing compares to this location; 2. The HOTEL is lovely! It´s relatively new and looks like it. As you walk into the hotel you´ll be greeted by a beautiful lobby. To your right is the front desk and the staff is always helpful and friendly. To your left is the dining area where breakfast is served everyday. It´s a hot breakfast and a pretty good one and...free. I think it´s ridiculous to give this hotel a not so good review based on its breakfast. The great majority of the Orlando hotels don´t even have any breakfast at all. So, I think that having scrambled eggs, bacon, harsh brown, pancakes,cereals, milk, hot beverages, juices, bread with toasters, bagels, muffins, donuts, jam, cream cheese and fruits is a nice way to begin your day and plus you get to avoid the hassle of having breakfast at the parks. To your right are the corridors with plush carpeting and soft lighting leading to the rooms and the elevators (big and nice looking too); 3. The ROOM is just as lovely as you see at their site. Big, beautifully decorated and cozy! Ah, and no funny smell too. We usually stay in a Queen Suite away from the pool (can get noisy!) – even-numbered rooms. First of all, there´s a full kitchen and I mean full. There´s a big refrigerator with ice-maker, dishwasher, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, two burner stove top, and all the utensils you need. The dining area adjacent to the kitchen is charming with a wooden table and 4 chairs and a chandelier providing plenty of light when you eat or use your computer. By the way they provide free wi-fi access and a very fast one too. And then there´s the sitting room with a comfortable sofa, a couch and a TV with remote. The room was a really big one, with two queen beds, a dresser with 4 drawers, a big closet with lots of hangers and a rack for your luggage, ironing board and iron, alarm clock, another TV and plenty of room for our 4 gigantic bags (I love shopping!) . The bathroom is pretty much standard, with a tub and a shower (a good one and yes, as other members stated they are a bit noisy ) and a big sink outside with all those nice toiletries; 4. The HOUSEKEEPING is terrific! Not too much of an intruder but always making sure the room is clean. Everyday when we came back to our room everything was looking good, the bed was made, the dishes had been washed, we had new towels, new tissue box or whatever was missing before but our stuff was untouched. Some days we returned to our room to find some cute towel animal waiting for us on our beds! Cute! This last stay our fire alarm went off while we were sleeping but maintenace took care of it beautifully! 5. The STAFF: This hotel has a very friendly staff from manager (Rafael) to housekeeping. But there are some staff members that deserve higher praise: Bernard (front desk), Cedric (front desk), Aracelli (housekeeping) and Alfredo (maintenance). They make a difference! Spending our hard earned vacation in Orlando is our definition of heaven but staying at the Hawthorn Suites Lake Buena Vista upgraded our expectations even more. Now we are officially spoiled! Needless to say we already made our reservations for next February!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable”
Reviews.Author: LCXY
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable accommodations. Nice to have the living and dining areas to sit in. The kitchen doesn't have a full stove, just two burners, but how many people actually cook a full meal in the room. The breakfast had many choices but I was disappointed they didn't have a waffle maker which I thought was advertised. Also, would have liked raisin bran cereal. But, there were plenty of other choices including fresh fruit. The location is also convenient to a small shopping center that we walked to to get dinner one night. Very reasonably priced. Nothing fancy but gives you everything you need. Having complimentary wireless is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RL35
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. It was comfortable and clean. The maids were a little inconsistent in replenishing things like coffee and toilet paper, but the staff overall were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good tasting and there was a nice variety. The hotel is very conveniently located, especially if you are going to Disney; it really could not be any closer other than if you were staying at the Disney resorts. It's also surrounded by lots of restaurants, shops, mini-golf, etc. I recommend a meal at Bahama Breeze which is very close by. The food and drinks are great as are the staff and the atmosphere. There was a very special man, I believe his name was Eduardo who worked on the breakfast staff. He always greeted us with a big smile and was so sweet and helpful. We will not forget you. Thanks Hawthorn for a great trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: Jordan J
Reviews.Content: Spend the first week of our 2 week holiday at the Hawthorn Suites and chose here partly because of the good reviews on this site and we weren't at all disappointed with our stay. We arrived exhausted from a 9 hour flight and Cedric was very welcoming and patient when i couldn't find my credit card! All of the staff at the hotel were friendly and welcoming. When arriving to the room for the first time, we were suprised just how big it was. Everything was clean, only complaint here is that the glasses in the kitchen cupboard were dirty - very minor. There is everything you need in the room and everything was in working order. Bed was huge and very comfortable. Housekeeping was spot on, breakfast was good, they had water, orange juice, coffee, tea etc then two types of cereal and milk, 3 types of bread with toasters, bagels, yoghurt, then there was different hot items each day... sausage, scrambled egg and crispy bacon etc. Best thing is you can have as much as you like! Breakfast area seemed busier on fri, sat, sun as you'd expect. Car Parking was a doddle. Location of the hotel is excellent in quite a quiet area away from the busy shops and restaurants. The hot tub and pool area was good and never crowded. Overall we were delighted with our stay and would consider staying again if we ever holiday again in Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations”
Reviews.Author: travellerstale62
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week from 20/10/11 and were very satisfied with location accommodation and the staff. Our room was on the ground floor it was spacious, comfortable and spotlessly clean, the only bad point was the sound of the showers in the rooms above which was annoying at 2am, but luckily that was only once. The reception staff were very helpful and always cheerful and polite especially Cedric. The breakfast was disappointing although there was always toast, yoghurt and fruit if the hot option was not to your taste. The waiting staff were helpful and efficient. Lastly the complimentary bar on the 4 nights it was available was very welcome after a long day out, Carlos the barman was very friendly and worked hard and coped well when busy. We would happily return to this hotel and thought it well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “For adults traveling without children, probably not the best choice.”
Reviews.Author: cakes
Reviews.Content: We are "kids at heart" and love Disney. We chose the Hawthorn Suites based on price, location, and (always) TripAdvisor reviews. Overall, this was a good experience. I had requested a king size bed and a "quiet location away from the elevators". Our room had 2 double (maybe queen?) and was directly across from the elevator. So, things didn't start out very well. My husband called the front desk right away and was told that no king size bed rooms were available. They agreed to adjust the rate and we agreed to stay. The room was huge, larger than some apartments. Probably a good choice for large families and why there were so many of them. Lots of children running up and down the halls. The room was clean. Breakfast was very basic and crowded, so we skipped it a couple of times. During the week...Mon-Thurs, there is a evening reception with 2 free drinks (beer or wine). Nice touch. Unfortunately, they serve the beer in styrofoam (sp?) cups! Yuck! I brought a glass down from the suite the next 2 nights. We did not use the Disney transportation from the hotel. Since we know our way around all the Disney properties, we decided to walk to Downtown Disney and get Disney transportation from there. It was an enjoyable walk of about 35 minutes. The biggest problem we had at this hotel was noise. On the first evening, we received a call from the front desk to ask if everything was ok.....at 10:00 pm! We were both sound asleep.
