As other people have mentioned, we knew when our neighbors were taking a shower. This wasn't really a problem until the last night (a Friday). People were showering all night long. No kidding! We thought they would eventually stop but no such luck. Based on the price we paid, we thought this a decent hotel but probably will try to find somewhere a little quieter next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent valued option close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: loseapoint
Reviews.Content: This is excellent value in a good location. Rooms are nice and big and, although the fixtures and fittings are not top quality, they all work perfectly well. The only criticism would be the breakfast - although it is described as including hot options , there were only three hot items and, on the two days we stayed, their quality was instantly forgettable!

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Christin D
Reviews.Content: We were sent to this hotel after the hotel we had booked told us that they did not have a room for us. The Hawthorn hotel may have been out of our personal budget, but it was paid for by our reservation at the other hotel. We had some problems with being sent over from another hotel, but the front-desk staff was very very patient and kind and solved everything for us. We did have to move rooms after the first night, but the hotel moved all of our things for us. The breakfast was awesome, every morning. Hot breakfast with eggs, a different meat every day, different breads, cereal, fruits, and juices. I loved it. I went to bed each night wondering what was for breakfast the next day. This hotel was further away from Universal Studios than we would have liked, but it was only a 15-minute, easy drive. No shuttle to Universal provided by this hotel. The kitchen area was wonderful. We ordered Chinese food one night and were able to save the leftovers for another night. We were definitely traveling on a budget, so being able to have our own food and snacks was nice. The water at the hotel is really gross. Please bring your own bottled water. The plumbing was loud, but I noticed it mostly when I was in our bathroom, and the neighbors were in their shower. We would definitely stay here again, even if we were going to Universal, as we were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holliday”
Reviews.Author: tone49
Reviews.Content: Having been to Orlando before this was our first stay at the Hawthorn Suites,the hotel is in a great location with good facilities,close to Disney, restaurants,and shops, The rooms are a good size, comfortable and cleaned daily.The breakfast has a good choice of hot and cold food,but it would have been nice to have bacon more than just once a week, never the less a great start to the day.The evening reception is ok but would have preferded to have beer served in a glass not a polystyrene cup. The staff are friendly and helpfull and Eliana on the front desk was delightful. We would stay there again and recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise Disney Trip”
Reviews.Author: Tanya N
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fabulous. Great location, close to all of the Disney parks, Downtown Disney and International Drive. All the amenities we needed free breakfast, Internet, and parking and 100 percent non smoking. The room size was great and full suites which met our needs. The staff were extremely friendly. Check in and check out were very easy. We would stay and recommend this hotel to others. The only complaint we had was there were never enough wash clothes in the room. They knew there were 4 of us in the room and some days we had 2 cloths, some days 3. We had to ask a few times for more. We also had a bug in our drawer. The front desk staff came up right away and removed it. It happens in that humid climate.

Reviews.Title: “Our fourth stay was every bit as satisfactory as all the others.”
Reviews.Author: MareP_11
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at the Hawthorn Suites in Lake Buena Vista. There are friendly staff who are happy to oblige with virtually anything; tolerant housekeepers (of us relaxing in our rooms until later on in the day) who keep the rooms clean, tidy and well stocked with clean towels and linen, some adding little personal finishing touches; free buffet breakfast; comfortable mattresses on the beds - great for a long lie. It is in a great location - very close to the Disney Parks, Seaworld and Universal. All routes to and from these parks is relatively direct, especially if you use Palm Parkway into Turkey Lake Road. There are plenty of restaurants nearby as well as supermarkets and gift shops. In the past we have stayed as a family of four in a one bedroom suite, two bedroom suite and more recently, in two rooms. All have been faultless, in my opinion. My children were happy staying there when they were younger, but they didn't get the opportunity to try a livlier hotel that could be compared!

Reviews.Title: “5 stars if it wasn't for noisy plumbing.”
Reviews.Author: angel103
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got home to the UK from a fabulous holiday at Hawthorn Suites, our 3rd trip to Orlando though first for this hotel. Location is perfect if you're driving. Nice quiet road and very central for all the attractions. Disney is so close, Seaworld is a very short, easy drive and you can get to Universal using Turkey Lake Road which is way better than the crowded I4 which we hardly used at all. Plenty of car-parking, the hotel is clean and the beds very comfortable. We liked having a separate bedroom and though we weren't travelling with children we thought this arrangement would really suit families with small children as you have a small sitting area and kitchen. The pool was a bit small and my husband thought it would be a great idea to remove the basketball area to make way for a larger pool area. The breakfast was adequate, nothing special but enough and better than looking for somewhere to eat on your way to a park. There are plenty of places to eat nearby, some within walking distance. We particularly liked Olive Garden. Sweet Tomatoes is a great healthy choice at Crossroads at LBV but beware if you wish to walk of drivers turning right at red lights despite the pedestrian crossing indicating you can cross the road. My review would have been a 5-star but our sleep was often disturbed by guests in neighbouring rooms taking a shower . . . once at 3:30 in the morning. A little extra sound-proofing would be a real improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Cant find anything to fault!!”
Reviews.Author: LynAndFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a party of 7 adults in two 1 bedroom suites, and were very appreciative of the friendly helpful staff, from housekeeping to the happy hour barman to security to reception! The rooms were cleaned and made up daily with plenty clean towels. We had the free buffet breakfasts every day and were glad of the pool, jacuzzi and happy hour after long hot days at the parks! We used the free shuttle buses to the disney parks, and there are lots of lovely reasonable resturants and shops within walking distance of the hotel. Dont however ask reception to phone you a taxi, as the one they called for us charged us DOUBLE the other cabs we used! We got to know a couple who had a taxi each and used them for the rest of the holiday. No complaints, other than the sofa beds are not really suitable for an adult couple for 14 nights! I have already recommended the Hawthorn Suites (either one, we stayed at the one near Universal last time) to a family coming out next October

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: bulkbag
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, good room lay out, beds very comfortable, very clean excellent housekeeping,Front desk staff so friendly and helpful ( nothing was to much trouble ). Ample parking, great location for all theme parks, shopping malls and brilliant restaurants,breakfast was not to my taste but I would not complain as this was complimentary. The only thing missing would be a bar to relax in after a hard day at the parks. I would strongly recommend this hotel, and I would stay there again. would recommend a car, Clean pool and terrace area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: angelambudd
Reviews.Content: We rented my parents a one bedroom suite and we stayed at the Hilton bonnet creek. This was a great place if you need two rooms at a great price. Small pool and limited shuttl service so I would recommend a car. Very clean and the service was great fir this level of hotel. Highly recommend for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Ernest A
Reviews.Content: Great place for a great price. Unit was clean, spacious, convenient and very reasonable. Staff was friendly and breakfast buffet was great with different items everyday. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: C J
Reviews.Content: It's a really nice hotel.The suites were clean and spacious. The location was great. Its close to restaurants and shopping. I will definitely return and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good! Nothing else.”
Reviews.Author: Marcia_Barroso
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, good service and the suites are spacious, breakfast could (and should) be better but the location is fantastic. The hotel is between Disney and Universal Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit, would definately make it three”
Reviews.Author: Nicki C
Reviews.Content: Stayed once at a disney hotel and twice at Hawthorns and have visited Florida 7 times so what does that tell you, this is a fab hotel to base yourself at and it is more than adequate for your needs, after all lots of your stay will probably be at the parks, I know ours was, all the staff are lovely and the taxi firm that operates there are exceptional, would I go back? Absolutely

Reviews.Title: “Quite Interesting Considering”
Reviews.Author: TravelinUndertaker
Reviews.Content: This trip was a business and a personal trip all in one. I was at the NBC in Orlando and I was looking to get away but be in the mix of things. Better location than being right on International Drive, but close enough that I could enjoy I drive. Very Close proximity to WDW and the resorts, as well as Sea World, and Universal. Staff at front desk was amazing and knowledgeable. Would I stay here with my family ... if and only if they had 2 bed room suites which I dont know if they do. Romance getaway ... yeah, the walks arent thin enough that the people beside you will hear, I dont think. Great place if you are solo and just trying to get into the fun of things.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for Disney holiday”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTappers
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 days here in June, and have to say that like many comments on here we were very pleasantly surprised by the standard of accommodation for the price. On arrival, Jason was extremely welcoming, and couldn't have helped us any more. The suite was a good size, kitchen had everything we needed, the bed and furnishings were very comfortable and clean, as was the whole hotel. We had a suite with a view of the pool area. The lounge & dining area were a nice size, plenty of room to relax, and although there isn't a bar, they do offer happy hour complimentary drinks, and you can purchase additional if required after the happy hour. Breakfast has got a bit of a bad press on here, but it is complimentary, and I honestly would say was of a good standard. Sure, grits aren't to everyone's taste, but there were sausage muffins, eggs, fresh fruit, pastries, juice & coffee available. We didn't eat every morning, but when we did it was pretty good. The pool area was a little on the small side, however we had no problem at any time getting a sun bed, and the pool was clean, and big enough to have relaxing swim at the end of a busy day. In terms of location, you could be at Downtown Disney in 5 mins by car. You have all the restaurants that the Crossroads has to offer a 15 minute walk away, and it was easy to get to the I4 from here. There is a Walmart on Turkey Lake Road about 10 mins drive away too. I would recommend a car if you were staying here, as it puts everything in easy reach, and there is ample parking. All in all,a very nice property, for a great price, and the service I would rate above that we received at the Disney hotels we stayed at for the remaining 2 weeks of our stay. I wouldn't hesitate to revisit this hotel on future Orlando trips. Thanks to Jason and the team for a great stay. Chris & Justine, Cambridge, UK

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: smp020
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of august, from the moment we arrived tired and stressed after a long flight, Jason at the front desk was excellent, he is brilliant for hints and tips about everything, extremely helpful. The hotel suites are great, we were 2 adults and 2 older teens and we all had enough space, pool was great for what we needed, and the location was excellent for disney, universal and for shopping. Downtown disney very close by. There are places to eat walking distance away and plenty of places that deliver also. Wouldn't hesitate to reccomend this to anyone, great place at a good price. My only advice to the hotel was breakfast was slightly different most mornings, seemed to be on a weekly rota, corned beef hash on a monday morning or example, but our teens didnt always love it, but it is included so that is a huge bonus, there is always toast, cereals, porridge etc so no need to go hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MJ M
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on reviews that I had seen and I wasn't disapointed. In terms of value for money and location, it was excellent. The buffet style breakfast being included was another big bonus, saving time, effort and money. The food selection may not be quite what you would expect in higher grade hotels, but it was more than sufficient for our needs and sets you up for the day ahead. The room was a good size and the layout fine, with the kitchen area and large fridge/freezer being very useful. The only slight issue was that the ablutions were sometimes quite noisey. If someone else, e.g. another room was using the bathroom the toilet/shower noise was transmitted quite loudly so if you're a light sleeper you may get disturbed.

Reviews.Title: “What a find”
Reviews.Author: Lesley B
Reviews.Content: I ghave been to Orlando approximately 5 times and this is the first time we stayed in a suite. A really lovely, friendly hotel, with excellent staff and a really relaxed atmosphere. The rooms were of a good size with all the facilities needed, the pool on first reaction seemed small but what a wonderful place to rest and relax after a day out - the hot tub was exceptional. There are only approx 110 suites in the hotel and this makes such a difference. We had a room overlooking the pool and you never heard a sound. There was also a good laundry and internet room. The daily cleaning service was really good and nothing was ever too much trouble. Will definitely be the location for our next visit. Location is fantastic Lake Buena Vista is like a well kept secret, near to everything especially the parks and shopping but away from the constant bustle of traffic lights and people on International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: saratygs
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hawthorn. We had a spacious suite and staff was pleasant. Hotel is very well located just a few minutes to Downtown Disney. Great little breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, friendly staff, hope to stay again”
Reviews.Author: SandyandShaun
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed here in August 2011 and had a great time. The staff were always friendly and willing to help. The suite was spacious. It could have done with a bit of modernisation but it was always beautifully clean and looked after so it didn't really matter. The pool is small, but clean and in a nice setting and it was good to have pool towels provided. The jacuzzi was great. The buffet breakfast was fine with cereals, porridge, fruit, toast, yoghurts etc every day and also a small selection of hot food such as eggs, bacon, waffles etc. The early evening snacks are mostly crisps, pretzels or popcorn but you do get free alcohol and soft drinks. The location is perfect for Disney as it is just a couple of minutes drive from Downtown Disney but is on a quiet non-busy road and is very close to a lot of resturants and a 24h supermarket. Overall we all liked the hotel and would definitely go back to again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, we both liked, my daugher and I.”
Reviews.Author: rada351
Reviews.Content: It was a very quiet hotel, nice to rest during night after coming back from the parks so tired. Also was clean and shiny, the personnel was very friendly, the general manager, the front desk manager and Mrs. Eliana from the front desk was always ready to answer us questions and give us details of everything we want. Also the breakfast buffet was good. We definitely will be back next year. The location was excelent and the price too.

Reviews.Title: “definately stay here again”
Reviews.Author: karen m
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks with my husband and children aged 6 and 4. The hotel was in an ideal place very close to all the theme parks, there was a shuttle bus daily but we hired a car. Lovely restaurants 5mins away would recommend olive garden and chevvy's. Breakfast was varied and there was plenty of it, the kids particularly loved the doughnuts and pancakes!!! The pool is small but adequate for chilling out in the afternoon. Staff a thet hotel were friendly and accomadating. Room was spacious and fridge was invaluable for chilling water to take to the parks in a cool bag saving us pennies!! We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel, Terrible Pillows”
Reviews.Author: zw2l
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at Hawthorne Suites. Im not sure what rooms cost at this hotel, because we stayed using points. It was a "class 4" hotel, requiring the most points, so i am guessing that rooms would be in the higher range. If so, this hotel is not worth it. It is a completely mediocre hotel in every way. It seems older, but is well maintained and was adequately clean. The biggest issue was the terribly hard, flat pillows, that made sleeping very difficult. The hotel is also right between Disney and Universal Studios, so it is full of families, and consequently, full of children yelling in the halls in the early morning. Other than these two issues, there was nothing really wrong with the hotel, but there was nothing great about it either. Not worth the money, and not as good as the average Holiday Inn Express.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great, staff very friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: Kim B
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 week stay. We were really happy with our choice and would definitely come back. The staff were great and very helpful. Breakfast variety changed every day. There was fresh fruit,yogurt, eggs, waffles, bacon, ham etc. We had 2 teenage boys and they both enjoyed their stay. We would recommend it. Great location, lots of restaraunts close by.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: LittleLaura521
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hawthorn Suites. The suite was spacious and well stocked for the three of us. Its not far from Disney, Universal or Seaworld and we hired a car which made getting around really easy. Good choice at breakfast, if you dont like the hot option there is plenty of bread, bagels, cereals or fruit and yoghurt. We would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Brissy_traveller_11
Reviews.Content: Clean spacious rooms, great common areas, great viarety with the included breakfast. Helpful staff with tours

Reviews.Title: “Will Not return”
Reviews.Author: Rick G
Reviews.Content: Had to wait 5 min or longer to check in, with no one else waiting, when arriving because manager (Jason) was eating his dinner in the office, no bell on desk to alert that there are customers waiting. Even talked loud to wife who was standing a few feet away to get someone's attention, to no avail. had a spider crawling around on bathroom floor, when we woke up, and wife noticed she had numerous, bites on her lower leg, presumably from the spider, also saw large spider on floor near breakfast area. Highlight of hotel, was how nice the breakfast staff was, one in particular always came to play with kids the 2 days we were there. Booked on expedia, so price was reasonable, but that was about the only thing that was.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Anjelgal
Reviews.Content: We got back today, yes it's a budget Hotel, but it's clean, it's perfectly suited to our needs ( we only sleep and shower there). I had read reviews before we went and was almost put off by them - don't be! This is a lovely little place, the staff were fab with us, even when our booking was bodged up by the tour operator, they came to the rescue and gave us a better suite! The room was clean and housekeeping came daily. Yes the complimentary breakfast is a little sparse - but it's COMPLIMENTARY!!! It's fine if you don't like the jumbo breakfasts available in chain restaurants. Go there - you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Orlando base”
Reviews.Author: kingedgy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for forteen nights as a family of three - two adults and teenage daughter. This suite hotel is modern and well presented with spacious rooms each with sleeping area separate to lounge / diner / fully equipped kitchen. It also benefits from being on a quiet tree lined avenue with none of the neon lights found in some other areas. Room was clean with very comfortable queen beds, Just a couple of shabby areas where the cupboard doors were starting to de-laminate in places. The inclusive breakfast buffet was perfectly adequate and with enough variety for it not to become boring. The main benefit for me is the location. Close to Disney and only a short distance from Seaworld and Universal. All accesible from Palm Parkway where it is located and able to be reached quickly without using the notoriously congested I4. Numerous decent restaurants and the Orlando Premium Outlets are close by. In summary, decent rates, great location and comfotable spacious accomodation ideal for families wishing to visit the nearby attractions.

Reviews.Title: “My Review was not posted”
Reviews.Author: AtlanticCanada
Reviews.Content: My first review was removed and I'm not sure why. This information is important. We had booked and paid for our hotel room 4 months in advance and had also received a confirmation number. When we arrived at this hotel we were told the rooms were over sold and we were moved to another hotel miles away from anything. I explained our situation, spoke to the manager, (we were one of the first people to arrive and rooms were still vacant) and they really did not care. We want a hotel on a bus route as this one is and to be moved to a hotel that isn't and a $60 cab fee to get some place is not acceptable. They reserve the right to over sell. We travel to orlando every year and have stayed at this chain of hotels before. The hotel cleanliness, pool and breakfast were adequate and what I expected for the price. The pool is very small and when they have bus loads of team, students, etc its not safe to be in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, great value”
Reviews.Author: Hookele
Reviews.Content: We found every aspect of this hotel to be a great value. From the ultra friendly and helpful and front desk staff to housekeeping, we were very well treated. We were pleased with our choice to stay here and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nigel706
Reviews.Content: A well located hotel near Disney that offered one bedroom suites and complimentary breakfast.. Monday to Thursday evenings you were offered drinks and snacks which became a meet up point with others on holiday. The hotel was continuously being cleaned and the staff were always very helpful. I would recommend this hotel to couples and families as it covered both requirements. The only minor let down is that the pool could be bigger.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION FOR DISNEYWORLD/GREAT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: Luz75
Reviews.Content: 1.Close to Disneyworld/Breakfast very good 2.The shuttle service in and out of Disneyworld was outstanding 3.The staff were friendly and accomodating specially the front desk agent ELIANA - always with a smile and OUTSTANDING 4.Great PRICE 5.Room very clean 6.We love this Hotel 100%

Reviews.Title: “Disney - not as convenient as you think!!”
Reviews.Author: Kateraid10
Reviews.Content: Okay let me start this review by saying that, as frequent Disney vacationers we expected this hotel with it's "complimentary shuttle" to Disney parks to be similar to previous ones we stayed at. The rooms are very clean and standard. The hotel staff is very friendly. The breakfast buffet is great as it's complimentary but get there early or you won't be able to sit down. Disney shuttles Only take you to epcot with departures at 8am 10am and 12:45pm and only pick you up at 6pm 8pm and 10:30 pm. The later pick up time also fills up quickly and you could be stuck leaving the parks at 6pm or having no transportation home. Keep in mind most firework shows start at 10 pm so if you wanted to see the wishes fireworks at magic kingdom you cant because you need to take the monorail back to epcot to catch your hotel shuttle which means your leaving the park at 9:45 ish. Shuttles are sometimes up to 15 minutes late and they expect gratuity. If you stay at a Disney resort in the downtown Disney area, complimentary Disney busses depart every 20 minutes all day until 2am and I would recommend this for anyone coming to Orlando for Disney. A perfect example of why: yesterday it poured rain all day and we could only leave the park at 10:30 pm. Unless we wanted to spend $50 on a cab back to the hotel. This "complimentary" shuttle service is pretty lame.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: SarahH31
Reviews.Content: Excellent base for Disney & universal as well as airport. Good choice of restaurants nearby within walking distance. Complimentary breakfast was a bonus and the cooking facilities in the suite were good - shame we couldn't open the windows as despite using the fan, the food smells still lingered. Having a balcony would have been even better! We used the complimentary shuttle bus to Disney - which was good but times were limited when we were there not sure if they run more frequently in July/August. A better option to save car park costs at the disney parks is to park at Downtown Disney (free and loads of spaces) and then catch one of the free more frequent buses to the disney resort hotels and then onto the parks. All in all a great holiday and cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Smithsjs
Reviews.Content: Just returned from14 nights at the hawthorn suites and felt this hotel deserved to be praised. 1st off the beds they were sooooo comfortable best beds ever! Room made up daily to a high standard. Kitchenett was very useful especially fridge saved a fortune doing own lunches and drinks for parks. Pool was lovely not huge but was big enough for inflatables in there. Coffee and tea available all day 24/7 mon to third soft drinks and beer and wine and snacks available and wednesday evening hot dogs then burgers all included. Breakfast was good 3 hot choices that changed daily plus waffles, bagels, toast, fruit, yoguart, fruit juice etc you would have to be a real fuss pot not to find something that you liked. Staff all very friendly and hotel kept very clean nice quite location could walk to some resturants but car would be better. Huge walmart on turkey lake road which is a much better road to use than i4 . Excellent hotel perfect for families.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we´ll be back”
Reviews.Author: AZULISIMO
Reviews.Content: great price, great location, close to the Disney parks and Downtown Disney, very good breakfast in the morning, free transportation to the parks, if you are looking for a good beer or fresh water in the afternoon if the day indicated, very clean, comfortable, safe, and the hosts always carry a smile, highly recommend it, surely it will go well

Reviews.Title: “great value for the price”
Reviews.Author: love2travel730
Reviews.Content: Our family spent 5 nights here in early July. It was a great hotel for the money and close to so many restaurants and activities. While this is no 5 star hotel, the people working there do everything possible to make your stay as nice as they can. Several times, we needed extra towels. They were delivered within minutes of my asking. The breakfast was very much the same each day, but all we were looking for was some fuel to get us going. We would definitly stay here again! Excellent value for what you pay!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely going back”
Reviews.Author: Valas1
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Orlando several times before and this was the best place we've stayed. The rooms are lovely and even the sofa bed in the lounge is comfy. They have hot coffee on tap in the lobby all day. The staff at the front desk are very helpful and friendly. If you don't drive there is a free shuttle to the major parks and downtown disney is well within walking distance. I wasn't so keen on the breakfast but my mum loved it; and if you dont like it much there's a sizzlers at the end of the road which does an amazing breakfast anyway. All in all (aside from a pair of squabbling siblings) one of the best holidays I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Coming back :)”
Reviews.Author: kishan12345
Reviews.Content: Jason and all of the front desk clerks helped and the rooms were very good and clean. I definitely would recommend this hotel and encourage you to go there!!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: loudydog
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before a trip to Disney World. Staff at front desk was very friendly and helpful. Jason at night saved us a lot of money by telling us off the beaten path places to visit instead of the usual tourist traps. The room was huge. We had 5 people staying in a 2 queen suite and had plenty of room. the rooms were very clean and we only had a 10 minute trip to Magic Kingdom. Great value and service. The pizza number on the key cards also served good pizza.

Reviews.Title: “So coming back!!”
Reviews.Author: FinnWithFins
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th time in Orlando, and this hotel offered very cheap and good quality stay at Orlando. Theme parks are only 10mins away. Disney downtown only 5min drive away, that would also be walking distance away, if any energy would be left after full day at theme park. ROOMs are big and bedroom lineas are what you would expect at 5 star hotels. POOL is big enough and heated, also jacuzzi/hottub is large and defenataly hot :) Altough chlorine usage in at hottub made our skin itch and colours faint from our swimsuits/shorts. BREAKFAST was very simple and useless, mainly sweet bakeries. But besides of breakfast, we will come back to this hotel!! If looking something better hotel, theme parks own park hotels would be the next step, but also prices would be then 10times higher. FREE and safe parking privided. Quality outlets right accross the main highway.

Reviews.Title: “Used Before & Will Definately Use Again”
Reviews.Author: Lingschippy
Reviews.Content: During the last 5 Family Vacations to Florida we have stayed in numerous hotels during road trips and main vacation. We have stayed in hotels with all different Star Ratings. This is the best hotel we have used. Ideally Positioned hotel with easy access to all Orlando attractions. Only 5 mins drive to Downtown Disney / Typhoon Lagoon / Seaworld / Aquatica. and 10 mins drive to Universal and other Disney Parks. Breakfast Buffet is very good with a selection of Cereals / Mini Donuts/ Fresh Fruit / Yoghurts, Tea / Coffee / Fruit Juices and different selections each day for hot items including Toast / Bagels / Muffins / Scrambled egg / Egg Patties / Sausage Patties / Hash Browns / Bacon / Corned Beef Hash. Eat as much as you like. Hawthorn suites are slightly more expensive than some other hotels/suites. But you get what you pay for and Hawthorn are the best. From reception to maids to breakfast staff to maintenance all staff are always pleasant and will do all they can to make your stay enjoyable. This is the fourth time we have stayed with them and when we next travel to Florida this will be our first choice. Only downfall was that the pool only opens after Breakfast so no chance of a swim before breakfast and after breakfast you dont want to swim. Then on return from a long day at theme parks pool closes at 10pm so if you stay for theme park shows you will not be able to use pool to relax late on. During our 22 day holiday we only used the pool once as pool was only open the same sort of times that theme parks are open. Some other hotels have pools open before Breaskfast and close later at night. Overall still an amazingly good value place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: thewearytraveller85
Reviews.Content: Booked a hotel suite with 1 bedroom. Kitchen stuff all there + great fridge/freezer. Breakfasts basic in morning but enough when you are doing the parks all day. Close for great restaurants but have to walk about 20 minutes(only down side). Staff very helpfull and friendle. Very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: pgweb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks in June and enjoyed it. The only down side was there was not restaurant in the hotel and the nearest eating places were 15 minute walk away which is a long way after a full day in the Parks. The air conditioning was excellent and the rooms were very clean but basic. I would not stay here again but the only reason being I would go to a hotel with more eating facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Zoey_16_jm
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 12 nights and it was great. The location is perfect; many different restaurants and fast foods are just minutes away, Disney is extremely close, and so is Sea World. The layout of the rooms are very convenient yet a bit outdated. The breakfast was always warm: eggs, cereals, bacon pancakes, hash brown...The pool is small, but we only used it once and it no one was there. The laundry room is also accessible and convenient if necessary. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are clean. Free parking is also a plus. We would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice, breakfast was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: HAD1974
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with my husband and 3 kids. Rooms were nice and set up like an efficiency apartment...small living room and kitchenette, separate bedroom with 2 queens. Room was small but clean. Our room was on the first floor and was quiet. The security door leading in from the parking lot did not lock so anyone could walk into the hotel. The pool was very small and crowded. My kids could not even get in, which was very disappointing. The "breakfast buffet" is really just a typical continental breakfast, serving bagels and toast, egg patties, and cold luncheon ham slices. Nothing great and not what the hotel lead us to believe prior to our booking. We were also told by the staff that the entrance to the Disney parks was within walking distance. This is true, but to get to the actual parks, you would definately have to drive or take a shuttle as they are several miles from the actual entrance. They do not offer free internet access in their business center either. You have to pay using a credit card to access which was a real turn off for us. Overall and having stayed in multiple hotels along the way on this vacation, I would not stay here again. We spent $140/night for a $89/night hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They gave me a clogged toilet...and then asked me to plunge it”
Reviews.Author: GNRMatt
Reviews.Content: We only got to spend one night at this hotel, but even in less than 24 hours, they people at the front desk managed to make this a negative stay. Let me first start with the positives. The hotel is very easy to reach from Disney World, especially Downtown Disney. The hotel lobby is simple, but inviting and clean, as is the rest of the hotel. And, that about ends the positives. The rooms are quite small and cramped. For an area rich in hotel rooms, you can easily find a more comfortable room for less money. In addition, in the bathroom, the sink has no space to place any items on, which is quite annoying. The biggest issue we ran into though was with the service. When we went to use the toilet, we discovered that it was clogged and needed to be fixed. I tried calling down to the Front Desk, but there was no answer after several rings. I went straight down there instead and asked that someone come and fix the toilet, but they said that maintenance and housekeeping weren't on duty for another few hours so no one could fix it. Plenty of staff were at the hotel, so someone should have come and taken care of this. The most they offered me was a plunger to fix it myself. This was a completely unacceptable answer for a hotel to give. In the hospitality industry, asking a guest to plunge a toilet is a big problem with your service. The front desk refused to do anything about this. As we were checking out in about an hour at this point, there wasn't too much recourse for us except contacting Wyndham directly. After I contacted Wyndham via their website, they did get back to me about a week later with an offer of a $75 refund to be delivered to me, which was received after about another week. I'm glad that Wyndham did provide this compensation, but they didn't address the need to re-train their front desk staff on how to deal with these situations. In addition to this major issue, they also did manage to "lose" our reservation and we had to jump through a few hoops to get them to find it. Due to this, I believe it is best to avoid this hotel and use one of the numerous other hotels in the Disney World area.

Reviews.Title: “pleased with choice”
Reviews.Author: SUEANNE4
Reviews.Content: Our last few florida vacations have been spent in a condo and love the facilities it offered but did seem to spend a lot of hols clearing up so felt the Hawthorn Suitesoffered the best of both worlds kitchen facilities but with someone else making the beds!!! Spent ages researching on trip advisor before settling on the Hawthorn Suites. We werent disappointed, good price, good location, nice rooms which housekeeping serviced perfectly everyday, had all we needed but did take our travel kettle rather than use the coffee maker. Friendly staff, small pool but perfectly adequate with plenty of sunchairs, towels etc - with the temp hitting 100 we used this a lot!! We used the free breakfast far more than we thought we would. Know that has been critisised but we thought it was good, 3 hot items, cereals, toast ,fruit, yoghurt, juices etc and the advantage of not having to get up and go out for breakfast. Laundry room was useful and reasonable price no dirty washing to take home!! The only slight criticism was internet connection in room not good, computer facilities were available at small charge downstairs although printing boarding passes was free and very handy as didnt have to get to airport as early. We would def return to this hotel and am grateful to all that have posted helping us with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a home from home”
Reviews.Author: ruthie_toothy
Reviews.Content: I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone reading this. Overall a delightful place to stay for many reasons. ROOMS - We had two double beds in bedroom and lounge with good quality sofa bed. A kitchen with dining table and bathroom with separate dressing room. TV in both rooms. Not modern but very clean and comfortable. Rooms cleaned to high standard every day by lovely friendly staff. FREE FOOD - Breakfast was enough to keep us all going till lunch time. Every day saw porridge, two cereals, various breads to toast, yogurt and fruit, plus changing hot food every day with two or three of scrambled eggs, sausages, bacon, French toast, pancakes, waffles. Every evening some kind of snack which the kids loved to have like pretzels or crisps. One evening a week burger and hot dogs. Very basic but free and a welcome touch. STAFF - This made the hotel for us. Greeted on arrival by Jason who knew our name before we even spoke to him. What a friendly and helpful guy! Eliana on Front desk was the sweetest of people who we all adored and will miss very much. Could not do enough for us. We felt like we were guests in their own home, that was how well they treated us. Every other member of staff we met from the lovely Spanish speaking guy in the restaurant who played with our kids, to the cleaners, other front desk and even the taxi drivers called in for us were so friendly. LOCATION - Very central to both the Disney parks and Sea World. About $15 in a taxi to Epcot or $25 to Magic Kingdom. Although if you are intending to come back to the hotel during the day or go out again in the evenings a car would be preferable. We paid just £200 all in to rent a car for a week. The bus laid on by the hotel is awful and to be honest not roadworthy in my opinion. I was told that this bus would soon be replaced. It also stops at other hotels on the way to Epcot so can take 30 mins instead of 10 by taxi or car. POOL - lovely and clean just right for a dip in the afternoon after a busy hot day at the parks. Also had a jacuzzi. VALUE FOR MONEY - you can't beat it! In summary would we go back here? You betcha!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed a Wonderful Stay-Again!”
Reviews.Author: FrankU32
Reviews.Content: Nice,clean,spacious rooms with a decent kitchen and 2 comfortable queen beds! All of the workers were very nice and hospitable,and seemed to enjoy their jobs-that's a rarity these days;Very nice people.Ice cold beer(2),chips and salsa,popcorn,and wine for happy hour was a nice touch.Breakfast was not great,but served our purposes-waffles,bagels,toast,bacon,sausage was decent;All of the milk and juice you could drink too! Some people don't speak so well about the breakfast or happy hour,but we thought it was decent enough,and a nice gesture by the hotel-It's not something they HAVE to offer at all.Anytime we go to Disney/Universal,we'll stay here,no doubt.We stayed here in 2007,and the place and people are as nice as then-Great people,Nice place!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: GatorVictoria_BC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 8 days and was just totally surprised by the comfortable room and size of suite. It was like having our own one-bedroom apartment away from home. The location was convenient and easy to find. Fairly close to Disneyworld but you definitely need a car. The hotel has a shuttle but it is very limited during the time we were there - 3 times in morning and 3 times in evening. The breakfast included was adequate - always had some type of egg, bacon/sausage, pancakes or waffles, fruit, yogurt. Enough selection to satisfy most people. Sometimes coffee wasn't hot as I would have liked. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Housekeeping staff were quick and very thorough to keep everything fresh & clean. Our room was toward the back and a corner unit so on the most part it was very quiet - only thing annoying especially at 6AM - you could hear the showers running. Pool was nice but can become crowded if lots of families are there. Towels were a bit thread bare. Appreciated the laundry facilites but for a complex that large - two washers & two dryers isn't enough. Don't bother with buying tokens as you can just use quarters.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely superb holiday”
Reviews.Author: bigstays
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed back to this hotel like family - Jason was pleased to see us and welcomed us as old friends! Our suite was as expected - well, we have stayed before! The bedroom is huge with 2 queen-size beds which are one of the most comfortable we have slept in and the pillows are firm which suit us perfectly. The bathroom area is split with sink in one room and adjacent is small room with bath,overbath shower and toilet. The lounge area is spacious with a small kitchen area attached and dining table. The kitchen is well stocked with cutlery, crockery/cooking utensils, pots and pans. There is a hob, microwave, dishwasher, full size fridge and coffee maker - coffee is replenished every day. The suites are a perfect 'home from home' - great if you've got children like us, they can settle for bed and you can relax in the lounge. The hotel have brought in a new 'green' policy whereby you must remember to hang 'clean my room' sign on door before going out for the day - on several occasions we returned to very messy beds and tip still on the bed - oops!! The hotel has a lot to offer - free breakfast, which is changeable each day but generally offers cereal, fruit juice, yoghurt, fruit, bread for toasting, porridge and usually 2-3 hot choices - sausages, bacon, egg, hash brown (although not often enough - delicious!!). In the evening Monday - Thursday was the 'social hour' which lasted between 5.30 and 7.30pm - sadly this has been limited to only 2 alcoholic drinks each (wine or beer) and seems to have put a lot a fellow travellers off from coming back to the hotel for a chill-out. Last year, through the social, we met loads of fantastic people but this time, new friends were thin on the ground. There is also free wi-fi available and free shuttle bus to Disney - time are a bit limited though - but the Lynx 50 bus runs regularly outside the hotel, running to Seaworld and Disney. Pool is small but rarely crowded. A superb holiday hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute there”
Reviews.Author: capercam
Reviews.Content: Cannot recommend this hotel enough to travellers. This was our home for three weeks, using it as a base to return to. Although not super luxury, for what we paid and received in return was very favorable. Staff were very helpful when needed. Suites were very spacious with a hint of home. Excellent location to all of the attractions. Our extended family were right across the corridor. Beds are very comfortable. Free internet. A very attractive avenue and super quite at night. I would highly recommend this hotel and we hope to return some day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Close to Disney. Good value”
Reviews.Author: Powtravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 11 nights at the end of march. Rooms were clean and spacious. Beds were really comfortable. Breakfast was fine. Enough variety to get the day started. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Only small downside was the fridge in our kitchenette was leaking. Maintenance were very prompt to fix it for us. Overall we had a wonderful stay. It is close to the parks but you really need a car to get around. Free parking was great. We would recommend hawthorn suites for a great value family hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow ... still great!”
Reviews.Author: Gemmalovesflorida
Reviews.Content: I have stayed with my family previously at the Hawthorne Suites and had a great experience. I returned 2 years later with my sister, our partners and a friend and all i can say is the standard and quality has not slipt. We did have a problem with our bed's not being changed, but we reported it and it was sorted straight away. The breakfast was different than last time, there didn't seem to be as much of a variety, however you couldn't complain. The rooms were always kept clean, we made great use of the fridge/freezer and kitchenette in room. The pool was great to unwind and relax after a hot day in a park. 'Happy Hour' was great for free drinks and a snack and we did use the 24/7 arcade. The is a man there during the day where you could buy discounted tickets, however we didn't use the service as we already had our park tickets. They also offer a shuttle service. The staff were fantastic, i have to say Jason was great!!! He was friendly and always offered us great handy tips and directions if we needed them. He made us laugh and made the atmosphere a friendly one. Also Haliena, she was the morning shift. She was so so so friendly..nearly cried when we left. She madeus feel like part of the family and nothing was a problem for her if we asked a question. The car park is great too.I would reccomend to anybody who is going to disney or even universal as it is only 5-10mins away from there (if driving)...thank you for making our experience so great, see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Leapin' Lizards! We liked this place a lot.”
Reviews.Author: samies-mom
Reviews.Content: Checked in on May 15, 2011 for five nights. Check in was exceptionally easy - took less than 5 minutes (we arrived around 3 p.m.). The lobby is large and very attractively appointed with large comfy furniture in pleasing colors. The room does have good space. We utilized the "kitchen" table every day. The full fridge is really helpful for milk for our 4 year old, sodas for ourselves, and left overs from the local restaurants for all of us. The bedroom is large. The mattresses are comfortable, and have passed the "bedbug test" (not only visual inspection, but a five night stay with no tell-tale bites). The bathroom area is clean, if a little "old". It's helpful that the vanity area is surrounded by doors - one leading to the bedroom, and one leading to the kitchen/dining/living area. It makes for a handy "dressing area". Essentially, one could take a shower and step out of the shower area and get ready in complete privacy in the vanity area while the rest of the family could either be watching TV or getting ready in the bedroom, also in privacy. The air conditioning seemed to work very well and was quiet in our room. The rugs are very dirty - bring slippers or flip flops to combat that problem. I suspect the rugs need a good steam cleaning (at least in our room), but that really would be our only complaint about the room. The pool is a completely decent size and was very quiet during our stay. The hot tub is also decently sized and adequate. The hotel provides towels outside and in a plentiful amount. There are little lizards (gekkos?) everywhere in the pool area! You really do have to be careful not to step on them. They are very small, non-aggressive, and don't seem to want to interact with the humans and we saw them nowhere other than by the pool, so there was absolutely no "ick" factor surrounding these little guys. I suspect they could be helpful in "bug" control, of which we saw none, other than just standard dragonflies, etc. The outside area has 2 gas grills, but I never saw anyone using them, so I do not know how they work, but they seem clean and the area around them is clean. There is also a half basketball court. The housekeeping staff does a good job of keeping the rooms and common areas clean. The hotel also has a "green" policy of not changing out all bed linens, etc. every day unless you want them to. It's nice to know that the hotel does have a conservation policy in effect. The complimentary breakfast is varied and good. Hot items during our stay included scrambled eggs, pancakes, corned beef hash, hashbrowns, etc. They also provide bagels and/or english muffins and bread for toasting. They have 2 cereals, three different types of milk (whole, skim, and 2 percent), apple, fruit punch and orange juice, as well as mixed fruits and oatmeal. Certainly a plentiful supply of food, especially at the cost of FREE. But listen to the warnings about it being over at 9:30 (or 10 on the weekends) - at 9:35 a.m., you'd never know there was any food in the place just five minutes earlier. Monday through Thursday there is also free beer, wine, soda, and chips and salsa from 5:30 p.m. to 7:30 p.m. The wine is cheap, the beer is warm, but hey - it's free, and the service is always very friendly. There is also complimentary coffee and tea available all day. 10 minute walk away is a 7-11, Olive Garden, local Lebanese restaurant, and many other restaurants. This particular hotel happens to be very close to a very "active" area. There is a bus line that stops on the street where this hotel is located that goes directly to either "Walt Disney World" or "The Magic Kingdom" (as indicated by the signs on the bus). The hotel provides 3 complimentary morning shuttles to WDW, and 3 returning in the evening. We had a car with us, so we did not utilize the city bus service or the hotel shuttles ourselves. The entrance to Downtown Disney is not a comfortable walking distance away, but is about a 5 or 6 minute drive away. We would definitely recommend this hotel and this location for budget-minded travelers. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, nice location, will recommend”
Reviews.Author: Trip_Banana
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hawthorn during Easter school holiday and had a wonderful time. Hotel is very clean, rooms are spacious, beds are super comfy, nice large bathroom and full kitchen (no kettle though?!). Location is very nice, quiet and surrounded by lakes and greenary. Lots of places to eat within the walking distance and a couple of small supermarkets (7 Elevan for example). Bus No 50 serving Lake Buena Vista stops right outside the hotel which was very convenient as we did not have a car. The bus takes you right to Sea World (5 min journey) and Disney (15 min) Hotel provides complimentary suttle, but only to Disney. For Universal you have to pay 10 USD per person incl children. All other Hawthorn hotels in Orlando provide free transportation to ALL the parks including Sea World. We were slightly dissappointed as I would think the policy should be the same for all hotels under one company. Oh well... Staff at the reception are very friendly and helpful. We had to move rooms as our first one was right next to mechanical room and it was very noisy with the lift going up and down all the time. We were moved no problem the same day we asked and our second room was super quiet facing the parking lot. Swimming pool is rather small for the size of the hotel and can be overcrowded in the evenings however we still enjoyed cooling down in the pool after spending all days long in the heat! Some complimentary services Hawthorn provides add a nice touch to your stay: free wireless internet, complimentary drinks in the evening (between 5 and 7 p.m.), free local calls. We would certainly return to Hawthorn as overall we had a fantastic time and small downsides like no transport and small pool certainly did not matter much to us. Great location, clean, spacious rooms with comfy beds and super friendly staff matters more. Thank you, Hawthorn and we miss Florida already!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Budget Option”
Reviews.Author: whatifitworks
Reviews.Content: I was going on a Disney-centric trip with a bunch of friends, and wanted to stay close to the parks. I began doing my hotel and search, quickly found the Hawthorn, and...So many five star reviews?? Could this be possible?? After staying for a solid week, Hawthorn Suites is indeed a five star hotel, so long as these are the categories you're looking to meet: 1) Literally 5 minutes from the entrance to Disney property - you basically drive down the street, take a left, and you're at the big gate. 2) Unbelievably cheap prices - in our case, less than $100 a night for a suite with king sized bed, pull out couch in the main area, and kitchen with stove, microwave, and fridge. Of course, you can't expect much by way of frills - a subpar continental breakfast, a fuzzy TV - but I'm not gonna be the guy who complains that the eggs at his under $100 hotel were soggy. 3) Our room wasn't huge, but the beds were comfortable, plenty of space for four people, we heard nothing from our neighbors, and it served the purpose we were hoping for - a place to sleep - several grades above the squalor of an Econolodge. 4) Service was very helpful, and we even added on a few nights without any trouble. 5) Pool and hot tub outside - not sure when the world universally decided hotel pools should close at 10, but otherwise nice. This is a wonderful place for families and groups making the Disney pilgrimage to stay at - extremely close to the park, very good prices, clearly family oriented, and reliable and clean. Only complaint: the continental breakfast goes until 9:30, at which point they promptly pull everything away. Don't get me wrong, I'm not expecting them to keep making eggs and bacon, but is it really that difficult to leave the cereal out for a little longer?? Not a big deal, we just bought cereal and milk for the room. Now, if I wasn't going to Disney, or looking to feel like I was getting away from the whole Disney/family vacation thing at the end of the day, I probably wouldn't stay here. But if that's the purpose of your trip, this is definitely a great budget option.

Reviews.Title: “The Hawthorn Experience”
Reviews.Author: markjoolivia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 6/4-20/4 and the experience was a pleasent one. The rooms are nice and large with everything you could want. Two nice king size beds, vey comfortable, good air con. Massive fridge freezer, dishwasher, toaster etc. Free continental breakfast was good with enough choice to fill you up ready for the parks. The happy hour was a nice touch 4 days a week 2 free drinks and nibbles. The was a nice Win Dixie just around the corner and a papa Johns Pizza next to it. Used both and would recommend. Plenty of places to eat within walking distance such as Olive Garden, TGI's and our favourite for value and searvice was the Orlando Ale House had 3 really good meals here and for 3 of us including drinks came to $40. The swimming pool was nice if a little small but it was never crowded. Also used the small fitness room several times which was O.K.

Reviews.Title: “could be nearer”
Reviews.Author: Biggie_d_69
Reviews.Content: A very nice clean hotel, but quite a distance if you havent a car, could really do with having a bar, not having one is totally weird to me, also make sure you dont leave any valubles on show in your room as i had two diamond earrings go missing and my daughter had a toy go missing as well, when reported to reception they said i must of lost them and wasnt interested in helping. The food is nice and fresh and plenty off and the rooms are massive but could do with a balcony, you cant even open the windows.

Reviews.Title: “The overall best experience.”
Reviews.Author: lisalisah
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for Spring Break and it was awesome. The cleanliness, the rooms were perfect. The customer service was great. I highly recommend everyone to stay here. We will definitely be back. Thanks The Hawkins Family

Reviews.Title: “Location...Helpful...Great Experience at Reasonable Rate”
Reviews.Author: JohnShoemaker
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend chose this hotel for a weekend trip to Orlando where her daughter was playing in a Volleyball tournament...we needed a separate bedroom and a comfortable place for her to sleep...perfect for that. Upscale feeling and clean...Kitchen was great touch...could keep snacks in fridge..plan on bringing your own goodies...no real food on the property...except breakfast...which was a cut above normal for hotels like this. Jason the front desk manager was superb (both helpful and nice)..quiet and you feel like you're"out of the way"...but very close to Buena Vista and Disney Smaller pool...but no one used it so never crowded. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here before and still pleased with the experience”
Reviews.Author: Allthingshorsey
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and reasonably sized with kitchen in a separate room to the bedroom which allowed us to eat in and save a bit of money. We last stopped 2 years ago and it is still excellent value. We made use of the managers evenings with free wine and beer (saved us quite a bit) and met some nice folk as well. Breakfast is free and as I usually only have toast it was more than adequate. WIFI is free throughout the hotel and in the rooms, we will certainly be stopping here again. An addition to our last stay is another games room with pool table, air hockey and table football.

Reviews.Title: “What a Find”
Reviews.Author: scott07
Reviews.Content: We booked this holiday literally 48 hours before departing for a week away to catch some winter sunshine and hoped the Hawthorne Suites would be ok, we shouldn't of worried as we were very pleasantly surprised. This is an area we have stayed at several times before but I was impressed with the rooms and how well equipped with a kitchenette area, a separate bedroom which mean't you didn't hear any noise while sleeping and overall when we return to Florida I would definately consider staying here again. The breakfast they offer is very basic so we decided to eat out after the second morning at 'Sizzlers' around the corner which was amazing value and good quality. What we hadn't bargained for was that it was the week of thanksgving so quite busy everywhere but we enjoyed the hustle and bustle of it all.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wondeful experience staying at the Hawthorn Suites Hotel in Lake Buena Vista.”
Reviews.Author: disneyMarcoIsland
Reviews.Content: My sister and her husband were visiting us from Michigan and we decided to go to Disney World since they had never been before. We decided to stay at this Hawthorn Suites Hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and quiet, and the free breakfast was delicious. It was also convenient to all the Disney parks. We will definitely stay at this hotel again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: luciaklem
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 10 days in April/2010 with my husband and my baby child and we would definitely stay here again in our next vacation (May/2011). This hotel is great, the service was great, the rooms was very comfortable and very clean and the breakfast is perfectly fine. The hotel is located close to Downtown Disney. We really love our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Daviesic
Reviews.Content: Close to Disney, nice Breakfast, Free Internet, good all round place to make the most of Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: bcharette
Reviews.Content: Hotel was as advertised. Clean & nice. The free breakfast every morning was more than adequate. The customer service was outstanding. The girl at the front desk was extremely friendly and courteous.... I believe her name was Elianne. She really made you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vasdot
Reviews.Content: Everything as hotel was great, very good location,very close to Disney, close to supermarket, and restaurants.We thought it was much better than Double Tree where our daughter was staying.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel would recommend .”
Reviews.Author: brewsters
Reviews.Content: stopped there for 2 weeks this was a great base for us ,hotel is clean and tidy and really quite ,stopped at marriot hotels in past which has always been full of football tours with this been a smaller hotel it wasnt.the staff were lovely and always eager to help in any way they could especially bernard on front desk. breakfast was great different choice everyday,would deffinately stay there again .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay, best in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Inglenook20
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to these suites and hopefully we will be going again next year. It is a small complex and therefore has a cosy friendly feel and this year we met people "snowbirds" we had seen last year. Having the breakfast and the evening drinks means you can get to know people if you want to [ and it saves a lot of money], The pool area is small but the pool is lovely and at the time of year we go we did not have any problems getting a sunbed, however this may be different in the summer when everyone returns from a day in the theme parks. The location is wonderful. It is quiet but so close to everything, last year a car would have been essential but the Lynx bus[no.50] now runs every 30 mins and we spoke to a fellow Brit who was using it and getting around very well. You can walk to over 25 places to eat within 10 to15 minutes [ and we did]. With a family a car may still be the best option. The breakfast here is really good and FREE. The staff are very friendly and helpful, the cleaners all smile and take time to speak and Eduardo, who clears tables at breakfast is great with the children. The suites are spacious and provide everything you could need and are cleaned every day. The attention to detail such as towels made into swans or even a monkey hanging from the shower rail make you feel that the staff have pride in the place. We have been to Orlando many times but now we have found these suites we would not want to stay anywhere else and would recommend these suites to anyone wanting to stay during the winter months.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money...”
Reviews.Author: julian_bLondon
Reviews.Content: - Let's put it this way... we are already planning to go back to Orlando and if we book direct or go with Virgin again we will stay in this hotel. - Clean rooms and hotel. - Cheerful and helpful staff. - Breakfast good enough given it was included in an already cheap price. - Wireless internet free and reliable. - I've stayed in worse places and paid loads more. - Kitchen isn't a full kitchen, you get two hob rings and a fridge freezer and microwave. I guess most Europeans would fore go the dishwasher for an oven. This is relevant as food costs in the States have gone mental and if/when we go again I will be happy to stay as long if not longer but will be cooking in the room even more. So an overn would be great for all the cool pizzas you can get at Wal Mart etc. - Worth nothing if you cruise up Palm Parkway you get to a big Wal Mart. - All in all Palm Parkway is one of the best locations to get to all the theme parks and this is one of the best places to stay in the area. I have stayed in a few other places over the years. This is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for our money”
Reviews.Author: Putuhepa
Reviews.Content: Long review, but I believe it covers all the things I wanted to know when I was planning my trip. Location: Hawthorn is very well located if you have a car. Free parking. If you don´t mind walking like 10 or 15 minutes you have all kinds of restaurant nearby and some minimarkets/gifts shop. If you don´t mind a 20-30 minutes walk you may go to a supermarket or to Walgreen. In a stretch you can go as far as Downtown Disney. And that´s it. For anything else you need transportation. Don´t even try walking to Premium Outlet (which is fabulous, everyone must go) like I did, unless you have an extra hour and really enjoy walking. The hotel: It´s spacious, confortable and clean. The décor didn´t bother me. The staff was nice, like American people in general (I just came from England and the difference in the way the tourist is treated is shocking). The concierge offers car rental and tickets to all the parks, at least most of them, at reasonable prices. There is no restaurant inside the hotel, but like a said there´s all kinds of foods in a walking distance. Certain days Hawthorn offers some kind of happy hour. A nice touch. Swimming pool is small but popular between the guests. There´s also a hot tub, half basketball court and a fitness room. Can´t comment on either. The room: I was upgraded to the suite so I had a living room, a kitchen, a bedroom and bathroom all by myself. The bed was huge and wonderful, the curtains darkened the room enough, the AC was good, the range of channels was great, so were the kitchen´s facilities. The bathroom, though, could be better. It´s not just that I hate shower curtain, but the shower itself was not good. Also, one can listen when other guest take a bath. A suggestion: take your own shower cap, shampoo and conditioner. Though the rooms lacked a safe, they have free internet, which was great. Breakfast: I really don´t understand what the complaint is all about. The breakfast is perfectly fine. It´s not wonderful, but if you are staying at Hawthorn you are not paying for wonderful breakfast, so enjoy what is offered, which is not bad, I repeat. Transportation: If possible, rent a car. But if you, like me, are afraid of driving in a different country, there are alternatives. - Airport: Hawthorn does not offer transportation to the airport, which is far away, like everything else in Orlando. I was by myself, so the best choice was taking a Mears Shuttle. I believe I paid 33 dollars for a round trip. I can´t say for sure, but I think if you are in a party of four or more, it may be cheaper to take a cab. Unless you are very cheap, travelling on a budget, adventurous and the luggage is not heavy, don´t take Lynx buses. They take FOREVER to get anywhere. - Disney parks: They are not far away. Parking a car can be a little expensive (15 dollars a day, something like that) but you are free to leave and return, which may be a good idea depending on the weather. Hotel bus is old but it´s on time. Three convenient times in the morning, three not so convenient times in the evening. One must pre-book the return bus, but I was by myself and had no trouble changing my mind during the day. Large parties may not be so easy to accommodate. After the bus picks the guests at Hawthorn it takes no more than 15 minutes to reach Epcot. The problem is inside Disney. You have to take the monorail, ferryboat (MK) or buses (Hollywood Studios and Animal Kingdom) to get to other parks. It can be a drag but there´s nothing you can do about it. Lynx bus is an option if you need to go to the parks in the afternoon, if you want to leave early or if you want to go do Downtown Disney. - Universal parks: Free transportation if you are travelling by Virgin, 10 dollars to the rest of us. The problem is it´s the same Disney bus, so one must go first to Disney and then to Universal. By the time you get there, Harry Potter´s theme island will be crowded. Also, if you are visiting a park a day, you certainly will finish it long before the pick-up time. No idea about Lynx buses. Best choice: Mears Shuttle (17 dollars round trip, if I remember correctly). - Outlets: Despite the proximity of Premium Outlet, one must go by cab. There´s an outlet that offers free shuttle in the mornings. It´s not as good as Premium, but it´s good enough. I recommend it. Other shopping areas (Mall of the Millenia, Florida Mall, Prime Outlet) are far far away. Don´t take Lynx buses. It took me 1h30 to Florida Mall. - Cabs: very expensive because everything is so distant. Everything considered Hawthorn is an excellent option and I would recommend it. Only one thing though. The day I left Orlando my wallet disappeared either at the hotel or at the shuttle. I have my suspicions but can´t swear on it. I just thought I should mention to explain why I´m giving Hawthorn only two stars.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: bgtwins4me
Reviews.Content: My 8 year old twins, my sister, and I were fortunate to stay at the Hawthorne Suites on our recent trip to Orlando. Upon arrival we were greeted by the friendly front desk clerk, Bernard. The housekeeping staff, especially Gladys, were very helpful and kind. My son was sick during the first part of our stay and she would ask about him whenever we saw her. The breakfast buffet had a wonderful variety every day. We went down at different times and never had a problem with food running out or being cold. The pool area was well maintained. The front desk staff were so kind to help return my daughter's doll that was accidently left behind when we checked out. Our only complaint would be the limited shuttle service to Disneyworld. Regardless of that, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: Prostaff_mmw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a weekend getaway (February 18 - 22) through Travelocity to Orlando, Fl. Prior to booking this trip we went to the web site for this Hawthorn suites in Lake Buena Vista to see what the rooms were like. Hawthorn Suites claims to be an all suites hotel with some executive rooms also. Upon our arrival we found this to be a big lie. Travelocity booked us into what they called an Executive King Guest Room. This does not even come close to a low cost hotel chain room. The bathroom had a 1960 style sink with no drawers for storage or shelves. Therefore, there bathroom items had to be carried back and forth from our luggage. There was no microwave or refrigerator in this room. This so called executive room had nothing but a king bed and an old outdated TV with lousy picture receiption. The maid service was not any better as our bathroom was never cleaned or room vacumn. Towels were changed and bed made and that was it. After complaining to the General Manager he told us we booked with Travelocity and therefore he could not do anything. Travelocity always books these bare rooms. If we were unhappy we had to deal with Travelocity. We called Travelocity and complained since they state they have a guarantee that is something is not right with your booked trip they will make it right. This is also a lie because they told us there is nothing they can do and they do not guarantee the conditions of the room. This experience has left my wife and myself with a bitter taste and since we travel alot we will make sure we never stay at a Hawthorn Suite again nor ever useTravelocity again. We plan to write both the CEO's of Travelocity and the CEO of the major chain that owns Hawthorn Suites to adivse them of the condition of the room and our trip experience. Both of these companies once they received payment basically said screw you and would not assist with the problem. The false advertising of the room descriptions to entice traveling guest to stay there should be reported to proper state authorities. I think if anyone choses this place you should will be booking at your own risk. This was the worse room we have ever stayed in including when we were fresh out of college and not making alot of money, the low end motel chains were better than this. We bought into the hotel and room description this time but we will not be taken by these companies in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for larger family”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkGutdoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights visiting disney with three kids (8,10,12). Need a suite accomodation as we can't fit in a regular hotel room. Kitchenette very basic, and pretty small. Relatively clean room, not spotless. Continental breakfast was average to below average quality, but the staff was very attentive, as it was very busy at breakfast time. Overall for the price (just over 100/nite on a peak week), can't complain at all.

Reviews.Title: “Hosted Large Group at Hotel”
Reviews.Author: richmond25
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very comfortable. Had to turn the ice maker on and wait for ice, so the first few hours we were without ice. Surprised that the fire place in the lobby was not light as it was a very cold few days. Would have been nice to sit by the fire and relax. Do not go to this hotel expecting to have a nice expanded continental breakfast. I often stay at locations that offer a free breakfast and this was the worst even experienced....cream cheese, but no bagels, very runny oatmeal, cold eggs, to name a few oddities.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: Ciske001
Reviews.Content: Had a small business meeting recently and utilized the Hawthorn for sleeping rooms and meeting space. The staff and employees were great to work with. They handled every request we had quickly and with a smile. Everyone from the front desk to maintenance was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Cesar070363
Reviews.Content: What a good time we had at this hotel! The room and all other facilities offered were enough to please me and my whole family, during our 9-day vacation at Orlando. I agree with most comments I have read on this site, especially the notes regarding the excellent location and the outstanding treatment provided by Hawthorn Suites' staff personnel. I could personally watch the lovely and professional support that Eliana gave not only to me and my fellows, but to the great number of customers who came to her as well, looking for different kinds of assistance. I believe that such things should be always pinpointed, once they make people, on both sides, much more thankful and comfortable, no matter what they do, or where they are!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable and Comfortable Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sjacqueline52
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was adequate to start each morning. The manager's reception was okay, nothing great. The service from the front desk, to maintenance to housekeeping were all pleasant and helpful. We encountered two minor problems within the first day and they were fixed and taken care of promptly. The separate living/kitchen area from the bedroom was very nice. Sometimes my health will cause me to be up late at night and I didn't want to bother my fellow travellers. The beds were very comfy and the kitchen area allowed us to save some money for snacks/lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the suite and found the entire hotel relaxing and welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: duwiesmom
Reviews.Content: We liked the location so close to Disney and used it as a base. We found the rooms clean and quiet and the staff very friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay off Disney property”
Reviews.Author: FoxViews
Reviews.Content: Located in a safe clean neighborhood only minutes away from Disney! We stayed here for 3 nights, and found the Hawthorn Suites to be everything that we had read about on Trip Advisor. Suite was nice and spacious, with a separate bedroom. Very clean and comfortable, no complaints about housekeeping. Breakfast was your typical affair, but those with a sweet tooth may want to bring their own (no donuts in sight!) They did have a warm pot of oatmeal ready to go, which is different from the usual instant packages. Other Trip Advisor reviews have mentioned Jason at the front desk, and we found him to be very helpful. Always ready to chat, always willing to give directions or advice on a local restaurant-he's a true asset to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Transportation a Problem”
Reviews.Author: MCRT-88
Reviews.Content: This is a quiet remote hotel in the heart of Lake Buena Vista, situated almost perfectly between Walt Disney World and Universal Studios. This is a big problem if you don't have a car. Maybe I should blame myself for not doing enough research before we went, however this hotel was advertised as running 'regular shuttle buses' to all of the major theme parks in Orlando. The shuttle bus to Walt Disney World ran three times a day in the morning. This sounds great on paper, however space on the bus is on a first come first served basis. Return times are also very limited and need to be pre-booked in the morning, not so ideal if you have children and you may need an unexpected return to the hotel.
