The bus drops off and picks up at Disney's Epcot and then runs through to Universal Studios. There are three big problems here: 1 - Reaching other Disney parks from Epcot in the morning is a pain, having to rely on Disney transport and changing frequently often via a Disney hotel. 2 - Universal Studios is in the complete opposite direction of Disney from the hotel, meaning the journey is a long old treck. 3 - The last bus from Epcot is at 10:30pm, meaning you can't watch the Magic Kingdom fireworks at 10:00pm and make it back to the shuttle bus. Suitcases are not allowed on the bus and therefore making early check-in at Downtown Disney (we booked via Virgin) a nightmare to get to. There is also no scheduled transportation to Seaworld Orlando, which is another problem in itself. Besides the transport, the hotel itself is run to a fairly good standard, breakfast is a bit limited and doesn't beat the build your own option at Denny's.

Reviews.Title: “A good surprise”
Reviews.Author: Vergilio
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff is very friendly . It is within walking distance to a good choice of restaurants for those who don't have a car and there is a concierge selling park tickets. The fitting room is small and have just equipment for aerobic exercises but it's ok for the basics. The free wi-fi is very good- a strong signal over all the hotel. The room is very quiet ( they did a sound isolation on the doors), spacious, clean and very convenient division: the bedroom is separated from the bathroom and both separated from the stay room and kitchen(good too) so if you decide to watch tv too late the others can sleep without problem. They offer a good breakfast and the staff take care all the time to provide the items and keep the tables clean ( unfortunately there are some guests who don't help with this). Good location and easy access to almost the atraction.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good with lots of space”
Reviews.Author: MarcioLS
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and my 5 year daughter stayed at Hawthorn Buena Vista from 1st to 13th January 2011 and were very satisfied. Localization: Nice (almost anywhere in Orlando is nice when you have a car) Breakfast: Simple, but nice Space: Ohhh! Great! A room with 2 queen size beds and another room with sofa, tv, table for 4, and a full kitchen. On the negative side I can say the windows that you cannot open, so it's impossible to receive the fresh air from outside. Other negative point is the noise from the bathroom, when somebody of your own, or other, rooms, takes shower. I recomend and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's Clean!”
Reviews.Author: whittin
Reviews.Content: If you want a clean hotel that has a kitchen to cook meals this is the place. The hotel is located very close (down the street) from the Walmart. I enjoyed my stay in Orlando and I want to provide all future visitors what I found to be true about this property. First - The Complimentary hot breakfast. We were served something different every day. The eggs were pressed out like pancakes along with round patty type sausages. If you wanted yogurt, you had to scoop it out of large plastic containers (really sanitary with lots of kids running around). The oatmeal was served in a heated pot and it just looked "yucky". There were toasters provided so guests could toast their bread. Each day was a surprise with the best being salsa and chicken strips for breakfast. I guess I expected a hot breakfast or continental style breakfast similar to what most American's consider a hot breakfast. Second - •Free manager's reception - There was a choice of beer or wine (which was nice) but the hors d'oeuvres consisted of potato chips and pretzels. I know that I read somewhere that the hors d’oeuvres were hot and the reception served cocktails and not beer and wine. I know, I guess I'm being picky - but I'm just letting you know ahead. If someone would have provided me the information above, I would have stayed someone else.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: Bonniefaescotland
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hawthorn Suites LBV for the past 9 years and gradually over the past 3 years it has become less attractive. The cleanliness is not at the standard expected for a Wyndham Resort. The complimentary breakfast is the same now as it was 9 years ago and could do with being more appetising. The rooms have become a bit shabby and the upholstery could do with a really good clean - replacement would be even better. The bed settee in our room was torn in two places and the easy chair had one leg broken so was unusable. Despite that, we did enjoy our stay and the staff are very kind and helpful - in fact, they are brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Good Basic Suite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ckinney412
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel are extremely clean and fairly spacious for a family of four (two adults, two teens). The kitchen is fairly well equipped with all that you need to cook, except frying pans, although there is pots, but only service for four people so you have to wash dishes each time. The service was good from the front desk, but none of the maids spoke English, so you have to ask the front desk for what you need. We couldn't use the pool when we were there due to an unusual deep freeze in Florida, but there is a BBQ area and a basketball court and a nice outdoor space for families. The hotel area is very quiet and well kept. There are also some restaurants and shops within walking distance. The breakfast each day was more than ample, but my husband was disappointed that there was not bacon once during our week-long stay, but the kids and I were very pleased with the offerings. Overall I would recommend this hotel to families as a good budget wise, family friendly hotel. I felt safe and was very surprised at how clean the entire facility was. I would not recommend taking the shuttle, though, for two reasons. First, the schedule was too sporadic and did not allow for an afternoon return from the parks to rest and cook dinner. Second the shuttle looked very old. We had a rental car and chose to use it, despite having to pay for parking. This is the first time we have stayed in this hotel on our trips to Disney, and I would probably go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable home away from home”
Reviews.Author: mmoss
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while visiting relatives in the area for the holidays. We didn't visit the parks but did walk to Downtown Disney for some shopping and free entertainment. Our room was very comfortable, clean and quiet. The spa was hot and the pool heated. Location close to several restaurants and groceries. We enjoyed breakfast every day and the evening social twice during our week long stay. We will definitely return and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay. I would do it again and recommend my friends and family.”
Reviews.Author: wyzard73
Reviews.Content: The entire staff was very polite and helpful. We requested extra shampoo and the staff provided us with a fairly large variety of shampoo travel size bottles. The suite was quite comfortable and had more than enough room for us, a amily of four. The location was very close to all the major theme parks and to International Blvd, the main "drag" for everything else Orlando. The one drawback from our stay was that the pool was closed for annual maintenance and upgrading. If we ever make it back to Orlando for a family vacation, or business for that matter, I'll be making reservations there again. Very happy and the pricing was competetive and reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “GM with poor judgement and attitude”
Reviews.Author: rthdad
Reviews.Content: The hotel did not have our reservation in the system. After calling the reservation center and giving them our confirmation number they siad they forgot to put it in the system and would enter it right away. After waiting for 30 minutes we finally had to leave and come back later. My teenager then came down the flu. When we went to breakfast the next morning there where signs that said no food could go up to the room. This is the first time I have ever run into this in a suites hotel! After telling the front desk about our ill son and asking them if we could take him up some juice and a little something to eat they called out the general manager. I travel often and I can tell you the Rafael is the biggest jerk that I have run into. He said that he would rather have the rest of the customers exposed to him then to allow an exception. If you ate their on Monday I am sorry that you had to be exposed to this. The food was lousy anyway and we skipped it the next day. The elevators are slow and there is poor access to the rooms. Not good for tired kids at the end of a long Disney day. There are to many good hotels in this area to put up with this one. And to you Rafael, I work for a large company that will never use Hawthorn again!

Reviews.Title: “Overall excellent location, service & facilities at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: TartanTeddyBear
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked into a Standard Room but offered a Suite for $10 pn which we took up. Suites were spacious & very clean. Beds were fantastically comfortable. Didn't use the kitchen facilities but fridge was great. 2 TVs in the lounge & bedroom with great selction of channels but TVs weren't the greatest in terms of up to date technology. The free wifi was brilliant & worked every time. Tea and coffee 24 hrs a day FREE. Any dealings with staff were great & they were all friendly & efficient. The location is excellent for all the main attractions including Universal & SeaWorld avoiding I4. The breakfast is free and is an excellent touch & covered all the basis for a simple option of cereal, juices, yogurts, fruit as well as eggs, sausage, toast, Bagels, Pancakes & waffles. Didn't use pool. They also have have free beer in the early evening Monday to Friday and Wednesday have a complimentary hotdog / burgers. Overall excellent location, service & facilities at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “The most accommodating place in town”
Reviews.Author: NTJD
Reviews.Content: I don't normally complete surveys however this time I am compelled to do so... tTo list a few items; I was very impressed with the impeccable facility (cleanliness is a must!), the pleasant staff and yes... my favorite - the heated! and all for the right price! Well done! Nieves

Reviews.Title: “A great buy for the Money”
Reviews.Author: teacher36967
Reviews.Content: My wife and I met our two daughters and their families in Orlando. The grandchildren included twin 5 year old girls, a one year old girl, and a 3 year old girl. We spent five days touring Disney World. The facility is well kept and has all the necessary amenities, including a complete and tasty breakfast. Our suite provided plenty of space, had a full kitchen, two comfortable queen size beds, and a great tub and shower. I used the computer facility to run my boarding pass. Jason, at the front desk provided good information on dining options close by. The only downside is that our refrigerator did not cool. The freezer worked fine. We used the breakfast area for a one year old birthday party on Friday night.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: celsea
Reviews.Content: What can we say, myself my wife and two sons 10 & 14 stayed in the Hawthorn for two weeks this Nov. We all loved the hotel everything abouth the place is 1st class,from the front desk to the housekeeping all are happy to help and always very helpful. The rooms are very big giving everyone their own space to chill out after a long day at the parks.Breakfast was very good giving you a good start to the day, but with no bacon over the two weeks a little odd for a US hotel. Only other slight gripe was the safe box at the front desk would be much better for every room to have a safe built in, never very private at the desk opening your safe box with money and documents on show. but these are small points, we loved our stay and would like to thank all the staff working at the Hawthorn Suites LBV for making our stay so GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Would book again”
Reviews.Author: serenity1706
Reviews.Content: Arrived tired after a long flight to be met by friendly smiling faces and a swift check in. Rooms are large with a large bedroom, separate vanity and shower roon, sitting area & small kitchen area with dishwasher fridge freezer, microwave and 2 ring hob (which went completely unused! fridge was a god send 'tho). Can't recommend the beds enough, which were extremely comfortable and gave a great nights sleep after long days. Our rooms were cleaned every day and the cleaning staff were very helpful and thehotel offer a shopping service if you want to stock your fridge with snacks. Breakfast was plentiful with some slight variation each day, my one comment would be that whilst breakfast aimed to cater for all tastes, it was a little "samey" each day, and fresh fruit salad rather than tinned would be appreciated. That said there was fresh fruit of some variety every day. The kids loved the half basketball court and small swimming pool, and the adults really appreciated the hot spa when aching feet couldn't take any more pounding! There is a managers happy hour from Monday-Thursday with free wine and beer and soft drinks for children. We rarely used it, it being early in the evening, but did catch it once each week of our two week stay. The front of house staff were excellent, more than helpful and willing to go the extra mile and were, undoubtedly, amongst some of the best front of house staff I have encountered. Oh (and just because he said it) Jason rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but can hear everything in room”
Reviews.Author: deniseiowa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location to all your Disney parks and Downtown Disney. THe only drawback in our room we could hear everything- at 11:00pm heard a shower going like it was in our room, and the sinks on at 12:00 in someone else's rooms. It sucked, because the last am of our stay, we were flying out at 7 am, so sleep was very precious for our family, having to arise at 4:30 am- ALso the pool and whirlpool was very small and not real warm!!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful excellent staff and clean as a whistle”
Reviews.Author: Clive5
Reviews.Content: This accommodation can be summed up in just a few words and they are Rooms super clean Beds very comfortable Kitchenette just right Good tv channels Free wifi worked every time Tea and coffee 24 hrs a day FREE Outstanding staff Easy to find Free access to check in flights online Great location for a flydrive base People have raised a problem with the breakfast being dull and boring well at home I have 2 types of breakfast. The breakfast is free and is an excellent touch if you want 100 different things for breakfast sizzler is round the corner and costs $3.99 Pool area nice for a break This is not a hotel it may not have the glorious touches they have but it does have free beer in the early evening Monday to Friday and Wednesday have a hotdog on the house this and not the costs of a hotel and you can even ask them to get your shopping for you. Not a rip off in sight just the very highest quality of service

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for as a base for visiting all the parks”
Reviews.Author: TheGoslingsLondon
Reviews.Content: Ten of my immediate family stayed at the Hawthorn Suites from 23 Oct to 7 Nov 2010 in three separate rooms and we couldn't fault it. There was an ample carpark. Twenty or so restaurants within walking distance or a short drive. The Disney complex is literally round the corner and Seaworld and Universal are a short drive away too. There's a really good supermarket round the corner too. The staff were really helpful and the beds were to die for - seriously comfortable mattresses and pillows. Just what you need after an exhausting day walking round the parks. The rooms were cleaned every day and the separate lounge and kitchen area made the room really spacious for our family. We loved the pool area and jacuzzi and they even provide towels. Happy hour from 5.30 to 7.30 was a bit hit with our family, especially as it was free - with nibbles provided! Breakfast got a little samey after two weeks but then all the food does after a while so that's not a complaint - there were hot options every day with fresh fruit and juices and we always found something we liked. The free safety deposit box was a plus too. All in all, a lovely relaxed hotel which was a perfect base for us as we were out every day and somehow we always managed to time our return from the parks for Happy Hour and a couple of hours in the pool. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sabume
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one week while on vacation, I would definitely stay again. Hotel was kept very clean! Would have given 5 stars if not for the breakfast offerings. It's located right across the street from one the entrances to the Disney Complex (closer to the Downtown Disney side), so it's convenient access if you're going to the parks. Free parking, and no extra hidden resort or miscellaneous fees! They do a free happy hour (pop or beer/wine) on weekdays. They offer a free breakfast every morning, it's ok but nothing great - I've had better breakfasts at Super 8. They had a couple cereals, bagels, fruit, ham (cold sliced lunchmeat in a serving dish), eggs, etc. We got a free upgrade to a suite with kitchenette (wonderful to have a full-size fridge for keeping drinks cool!).

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location, easy access to parks”
Reviews.Author: bex51
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from touring parts of south east USA, staying in 7 different locations, using Trip Advisor advice and reviews to help plan our trip, most of which has been totally reliable. I booked a 4 night stay here based on reviews. Firstly desk staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was better some days than others, but it was fine. However, I was disappointed with our room. It was dated and had a strange smell, carpets were very worn with loose threads, bathroom had no space to put toiletries etc. Bedding was tatty. Kitchen is basic, a good fridge/freezer and dishwasher, but no detergent after first day. Every day the maid put dishwasher on for 2 cups, but didn't use detergent so they weren't cleaned! It seems strange that most reviewers seem very happy with this hotel. Perhaps guests staying longer or booking through a package get better rooms than independent short stay guests . On the plus side the suite was a good size, the price is good, we had no problem with noise and the location for Disney etc is great. For that reason I would recommend this hotel in the hope that we were just unlucky with our room!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value--highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: dewain7704
Reviews.Content: The Hawthorn Inn and Suites, Lake Buena Vista FL was our first stop in FLA. I picked it because of proximity to Magic Kingdom, and for the fact that we had two families needing separate sleeping quarters. The room we were given fit that perfectly....a separate bedroom with bed, and a pull-out bed in a separate area. The room had a microwave, refrigerator, two TVs, and even a dishwasher...The value was exceptional, in my opinion. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The one downside of the whole visit was the shuttle service to Magic Kingdom. I was under the impression that the shuttle went directly to Magic Kingdom, about 1/2 mile down the road. Alas, not to be....the shuttle picked us up at the main entrance, but then we went to several different hotels before being deposited several miles away at Epcot. From there we had to take the monorail to the transportation center, then another monorail to Magic Kingdom. The whole episode took over 45 minutes! I would have appreciated being told that the shuttle was not a direct route. Having said that, however, the shuttle was free, saved us $12 parking, so I'm really not complaining. I would highly recommend this facility to anyone going to the Orlando area. Also, the complimentary breakfast was great! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: millythecat
Reviews.Content: if you looking for a good hotel close to all the theme parks then look no further.all of the staff are good but Jason on the reception is excellent. if i was his manager i would give him a raise to make sure i kept hold of him, ask him anything, he will do his best to sort you out with the answer and he really made our stay that bit special. breakfast is adequate and if you want you can always pop down the road to wal mart to stock up on extras.if we go to florida again we will definetely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: lynnsaxton123
Reviews.Content: very clean relaxed hotel with great friendly and helpful staff beds were a dream kitchen was great jason at front desk was most helpful but all friendly the only thing that we could of done with was a bit more information on public transport as there was 9 of us and it got expensive for taxis jason helped if he could but all in all we had a lovely stay at howthorn suites and we would come back breakfast done the job but a bit more variety would have been better. thank you for a great 3 weeks lynn

Reviews.Title: “Live report”
Reviews.Author: KatieLincolnshie
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after endless trawles over trip advisor- It has not dissapointed. We arrived last week and were greeted by the very helpfull staff. The room is very clean and comfortable. DH says he feels as though he is sleeping on a marshmallow ! We do not have a car and have found the transport fine. With the virgin package there is also free transfer to universal and sea world. The weather so far has been excellent too. Hotel photos are an accurate representation so I will add no more. The breakfast which is FREE is different everyday cannot believe that others have moaned about this as we have found adequate choice for us 4 - including picky teens!!! Locally there are many restaurants within walking distance, we have also walked from Down Town Disney- 30 mins pleasant walk. Would have no concerns reccomending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: kiwigirl3015
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights in September and found everything great. The location was perfect for us visiting theme parks such as Discovery Cove and Seaworld, and Disney. Universal was a bit further away. Loved the quiet location, easy parking and comfortable rooms. 2 beds in a separate room were fantastic for the kids who fell asleep earlier. The pool was a great way to cool off in the evenings. Breakfast was average - but free - and toast, fruit and juice is all you really need to start the day so we weren't complaining. We found staff helpful and friendly and yes, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest time and location”
Reviews.Author: janbarnhart
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled to this resort to enjoy Sea World and Disney with a three and one year old....from the time I called to say, "how do I find you" to check out the staff were ALL superb. Jason at the front desk to the table cleaner in the dining area went over and above their job discriptions to make our stay the GREATEST....Thank you Hawthorn Suites for a fantastic training of your workers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent HOTEL WOULD RECOMMEND IT TO OTHERS.”
Reviews.Author: Hotelreviewer123011
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so good that we went again. The pool was just great. It was nice and cold and just perfect. service was great if you needed anything they would try and get it (from the hotel) quick as possible. The breakfasts were sooo tasty and filled me up. The gym was so cool as well. It had towels and lots more. Beds were so comfy i could lye there all day!! Bathroom was nice and clean too. Big t.vs were great for us in the evening! This hotel is sooooooooo EXELLENT and would definitely recommend it too a friend if anyone would go to florida go to HAWTHORN SUITES!!!

Reviews.Title: “I am glad I chose this one”
Reviews.Author: jerseyans
Reviews.Content: This was a great choice that I made while looking to stay for a week. I selected it based on the reviews of other travellers, and I am glad I chose it. The rooms are bigger and nicer than many other hotels where I stayed, including some pricey ones. My kids had enough room to play around in the suite. We had a suite. the kitchen was sufficiently stocked with cooking pot and pans, cutleries, and dinnerware. The staff were very friendly. Room service was spotless. Upon checking in I noticed the refigerator was not cooling properly. Once I called the front desk, I had a technician working on it within 15 minutes, and he got it working in another few minutes. We used the laundry room, and the room as well as the appliances were very clean. The breakfast was really great. There was a different menu every morning, and the food was really good. I did not use the free shuttle, so can't say anything about it. We did not go to the pool or the fitness center (had enough exercise walking in the Disney parks). The location is great. The hotel is very close to the disney parks, as well as seaworld. Also, there are plenty of dining places close by. Some are even walkable.

Reviews.Title: “Jason THE MAN!!”
Reviews.Author: simonangela_dinnis
Reviews.Content: The most fabulous hotel. Well placed - it's only 15 minutes walk from goodness knows how many restaurants. The hotel offers to collect your grocery shopping FREE from the supermarket - just put your list into reception. Spacious room - with large fridge/freezer and ice maker. Dish washer (all detergent supplied by hotel) plenty of towels (for the room and also the pool. Super comfy big beds. Many tv channels. Now the breakfast, bearing in mind THIS IS FREE!!! Different every day - fruit, yoghurt, eggs, sausage, hash browns, pancakes, waffles, toast, bagels, juice, tea, coffee, hot chocolate. This will save you a fortune. Monday thru Thursday FREE wine/beer evening - a nice way to just sit for a moment in the air condtioned lobby and just chat with other guests. Free shuttles to Disney, Sea World & Universal. Pool great and hot tub too. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. We were made to feel so welcome. Thankyou Jason - you are the man!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: holidaytime
Reviews.Content: These suites were ideally located, all major parks, good range of restaurants, supermarkets, shopping outlet and the I4 to further afield destinations (Kennedy, Florida Mall and coast) all within easy driving distance. The suites were well equipped and it was nice to have a bit more extra space than just a hotel bedroom. The kitchen (with full sized fridge) enabled us to make up picnics for days out. There was also free Wifi, free parking, outdoor swimming pool and a laundry room. One small thing missing was a safe in the room which would have been easier than using a safety deposit box.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: paulsMidlands
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel for two weeks in August. The suites are a really good size with two double beds in the bedroom and a pull out double bed in the living area. The beds were so comfortable probably the best hotel beds I have stayed in. The cleaning staff were excellent at keeping our very messy room (we have two teenagers!) clean and tidy. We felt all areas of the hotel were clean. We found all of the staff to be really helpful and very friendly. If I had to make a criticism it would be that the pool was a bit on the small side, but then who goes to Florida to sit by the hotel pool? The location is good just far enough away from all the madness of I drive, but in easy reach of shops and restaurants, although you may struggle without a car. I would recommend the Olive Garden nearby if you like pasta but there are lots of places to choose from. I would definitely stay at the Hawthorn Suites again and would have no hesitation in recommending this place to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: sarfam
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and were excited about staying at HS, and were very disappointed with our stay. Here are the reasons: 1. Not as clean as we would like. 2. No full set of dishes/silverware. 3. Some television channels did not work. 4. Water pressure very low. 5. Breakfast not very good. 6. Pool water extremely warm! Not very refreshing after a hot day at the parks... 7. Restaurants not very close - too far to walk with 2 young children with the heat and with the rain! 8. Free shuttle to park at VERY limited times. 9. Hotel staff not very accomodating. I'm not quite sure why this hotel gets such good reviews. I suppose if you have your own car it would be easier to get around, however...

Reviews.Title: “Great location with a great price tag!”
Reviews.Author: NeverStagnet
Reviews.Content: The Hawthorn Suites in Lake Buena Vista was located in a GREAT area!!! There were restaurants right down the block that you could walk to or places all over the main drag to drive to. The hotel room has a full fride/freezer in it and there was a grocery store located down the road so we stocked up on a few items to keep in the room. The room was spacious and comfy! We were just a hop skip and a jump from the parks which made it super easy to get to where we wanted to go which in our case were the Disney parks! If you want enough space for a group of people for a great price that is located in a great area then there is no question you need to pick this place!

Reviews.Title: “AWSOME!”
Reviews.Author: Dilbert217
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, the service was great, the rooms where clean, the beds were really comforable. The location is great, located close to Downtown Disney and just a few minutes away from Seaworld. I am looking forward to staying again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJROxford
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 2 week stay at the Hawthorn Suites and just wanted to add my thoughts. I've put that the hotel was 'very good', but if there had been an option for 'good' then that would have been more appropriate. The pros were the lovely big & comfortable beds; just what you need after a long day in the parks (they are that good that I've emailed the company that makes them to find out if I can buy one!). The rooms were spacious enough for myself, wife and daughter to relax in (though I think a family of 4 would find it a bit awkward, what with both double beds in the same room, at least in the kind of room we had). The staff, from reception to cleaners were all friendly, helpful & unintrusive (We had a problem with the loo one morning and the maintenance man was sent straight up to fix it). The bed linen was changed every other day and the room was spotless. The location is excellent, on a road away from the main drags but within easy driving distance of both Disney & Universal, with a host of places to eat a short walk away. The cons are that the decor and furnishings in the room are quite dated and in need of updating (the walls are painted a kind of ochre colour and this tends to make the rooms a little dull and gloomy). There was some peeling wallpaper and borders in our bedroom which was a bit untidy but not a major problem. The breakfast is plentiful and the quality was okay - my wife loved the porridge - but a little 'samey', with scrambled eggs and/or meat patties/sausages - no bacon or fried eggs for instance, but again not a massive problem for us. The room lacked a kettle to make tea (though you could make coffee if you wanted) and my wife felt there should have been more crockery/glasses etc. Overall we had a good stay at the Hawthorn Suites because we treated it as a base and spent most of our days and evenings out at the parks or in restaurants. For those reasons we found it sufficient for our needs. Would we stay there again if we came back? Probably not, as I'd want a few more facilities and a bit more 'class', but this is still a decent hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: dhaffner
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure to stay at the Hawthorne Suites Hotel on Palm Parkway July 4th - 7th. What a great experience for my first trip to Florida/Disney World. We checked in with Jason at the front desk and he became an invaluable source of information and good places to eat at. He was so very friendly and customer service oriented, enjoys his job and it shows. Everything you could want in a hotel and more. Great breakfasts, workout room, pool, hot tub. You would not go wrong staying at this hotel. And so conveniently close to Disney. This will definitely be the place we will stay whenever we are in Florida. Keep up the good work and thank you for the pleasure of staying with you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - will be going back!”
Reviews.Author: dgilluk
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here for two weeks in August 2009 for our honeymoon. We had moved across to this hotel from the Comfort Inn across the road after having a very unpleasant few nights stay there. So this hotel was a breath of fresh air! I felt right at home! The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable with a huge queen size bed big enough for 4 people! The only thing is these suites were located near to the lift which did disturb us a little late at night and early on a morning. The full kitchen facilities in the room were great. Having a seperate living/dinning and bedroom area was brilliant and the air con was great. The rooms are extremely clean! The pool area was small but very clean and relaxing. Hot tub was lovely after a busy hot day around the parks. Breakfast was lovely and there was a different variety of things. The only thing is they kept repeating the same thing every other day so after two weeks it became a bit boring. But cant complain. The drinks reception on a night was great and really refreshing after a long day in the parks! The hotel offers free shuttle buses to the parks which were really easy to just hop on which were hassle free. The only thing that i would say is that they dont run that frequently therefore they were very full with people standing, which i didnt like. The hotel is in a good location, there are a few fast food places for example a pizza place, McDonalds, Burger King and restaurants to eat at just a short walk down the road and theres also a small supermarket. Overall this is a great hotel, very clean and i will be going back!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed at, and only...”
Reviews.Author: Madbadger2742
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I've ever stayed at, and only one I'll use in Orlando now. Jason at the desk made the stay that much better. Clean, helpful, spacious, perfect location. Well worth the money (which was not much.)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing a must stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: ServiceFirst01
Reviews.Content: Beautiful and cozy, great staff, nice pool and rooms. I would stay here again in a heartbeat, can't beat the value and service, beat my expectations by a mile.

Reviews.Title: “room and hotel was great---personnel and service were horrible”
Reviews.Author: futurelawyer2005
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy attitude, being ignored or even having people be rude to you, then you will enjoy the Hawthorn on Palm Parkway. If you love a comfy bed, large room that is like an apartment and proximity to everything, you will enjoy the Hawthorn on Palm Parkway. We arrived on the Amtrak on 6-27 and stayed until 7-4. To begin with, I would have GLADLY paid an extra $5 a night to have shuttle service to the hotel. But, they don't provide it. I had to arrange and pay $40 for a shuttle about 5 miles away. I would have gladly paid another $5 a night for a taxi or shuttle to the airport, which they don't provide. That was another $40. Don't take the hotel shuttle to the Disney theme parks. We took the 8:30 pickup on Monday the 28th....and arrived at Magic Kingdom at 10:45!!!!!!!!!! The lines were already horrendous when we got there. So.....I followed a tip I found online about taking the DEDICATED Link 50 public bus to and from the Disney parks. AMAZING!!!! For $2, you can be at the Disney parks in 30 minutes, in a clean, cold, safe bus that ONLY has a route just for Disney parks. It dead ends at the Disney transportation center where you get on the monorail and go to any Disney park! Better yet, I followed another tip online to a) leave the park around 2pm (when it is the hottest and lines are the longest) and b) return around 6pm (after the cooling afternoon showers and when the lines are short). We did one full day, nonstop (which was a total nightmare) and used the hotel shuttle and we did another day 9am to 2pm and returned at 6pm, using the Link 50 route. The difference was stunning! Not only did we get to ride Big Thunder Mtn and Splash Mtn twice each but also two other rides by 10 am BECAUSE we took the Link 50 bus from right in front of the hotel!. We bought an "all day pass" for $4.50 and $2.25 for kids and rode off and on all day, with no delays, in comfort. Also, the Link 50 runs every 30 minutes, beginning 1 hr before and 1 hr after the parks close. So, my best advice: avoid the hotel shuttle and use the Link 50. The complimentary breakfast is free....because it isn't good enough to charge for. But, it is convienent to inhale on the way out the door to attractions. The afternoon "social" is a joke. It is the cheapest heartburn beer and wine and isn't worth paying for. Most everyone that stayed here was from the UK or other countries in Europe. My guess is less than 10% of the visitors were American. The front desk employees are horrid. They are rude and condescending and lazy. One particular insult to me was, when asking for a baggage cart over the phone, to "come downstairs and get it yourself". Another time, I asked for some butter from the bar downstairs so we could cook some grilled cheese sandwiches in our room. I was told to call back in 2-3 minutes because he was "busy and couldn't deal with that". I called back 10 minutes later and BEFORE he ever said hello....he greeted me by saying "Jeez, you're persistent, aren't you?" Don't ask them to find a phone number for you, for any local information, for help, for anything. They resent you and hate their jobs and hate you too. Also, for the custodial staff, be prepared to speak Spanish only. Being from Texas, I was fine....but other Europeans were completely lost trying to communicate with them. And the housekeepers begin knocking on doors at 8 am to clean. They did it EVERY day while we were there. The rooms are spacious, the bed is amazing, the kitchen great! We went to Winn Dixie, 2 blocks away, on our first day. Spent $70 on bagged, frozen complete meals, some lunch fixings and some snacks and that lasted us all week long! We probably saved $400 not eating out. A cooler cost us $7.50 at Winn Dixie and we took that around with us. While you have to ask for enough dishes from the front desk (to which they will insult you for asking them to do anything), the kitchen was like an apartment and fully functional. The housekeeper even does the dishes for you! (a tip would be welcome) We stayed on the 2nd floor and had the laundry right down the hallway. It is expensive and not the best....but it works. Besides the great rooms, the best thing about this hotel was the location. Staying on International Dr or anywhere near there is torture and we learned to stay away from there a long time ago. Palm Parkway is calm, clean, quiet and pretty. Best of all, because there's no traffic, getting to and leaving from are quick and hassle free. It is also on that dedicated Link 50 route for Disney parks. Its also 2 blocks from a huge shopping center where you can get any and everything. The pool, jacuzzi and fitness room are all well taken care of and provide plenty of clean towels. On the whole: for rooms and location: a 10. For service: a terrible 3.

Reviews.Title: “For what you pay, this is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Starfish13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights to see the space shuttle launch in Cape Canaveral. There is nothing wrong with this hotel if you are a family, travelling solo or with friends. It's not a 5 star hotel and doesn't want to be. It's a property to stay for a few days so that you can see as many theme parks as you can. I didn't eat breakfast so can't comment on it. The wifi was one of the best I have every used at a hotel and best of all it was free. The room again was huge. Beds very comfortable. My only issue with the rooms were that the air conditioning sometimes didn't feel as if it was on, and secondly there were no opening windows so you could open in the evening to get a breeze through. Apart from that it is close to everything, especially if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for young families”
Reviews.Author: cookiedo90
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay from 30 May to 6th June 2010. We had a 1 bed suite with two queen beds and a very well equipped kitchen /living room. The sofa in the living room doubled as a pull out bed so we had plenty of room for us and the 2 kids. The buffet breakfast was not bad although I would have preferred "normal" cheerios to the psychadelic ones and no sweetner in the porridge but all in all the spread was pretty good. We didn't really use the kitchen but the large fridge freezer was a bonus for storing our packed lunch items. There are a publix supermarket and Walmart very close by (by car). We basically did a week at Walt Disney World Parks. The food and water and the parks is very expensive so we saved a fortune by taking a packed lunch. We bought a dozen small bottles of water for $3.50 at publix and froze them for daily use. At the parks 1 bottle cost $2.50! We didn't buy Disney tickets beforehand in case our trip was cancelled due to volcanic ash..the discounts we found were only about £20 anyway. We were pleasantly surprised to find a gentleman selling discounted tickets at the hotel. He even gave us a refund for unused days! Very friendly staff. It would be nice if they had a portar though. We arrived very late at night with 2 sleeping children. They had a trolley for us to take the luggage but we awere so tired a portar would have been worth his weight in gold! But all in all a brilliant hotel. Would definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “nice staff, clean rooms, convenient location = good value”
Reviews.Author: bmayes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference (held at a much more expensive hotel in Orlando) and stayed on for a few days at DisneyWorld with family. Good, clean, safe, conveniently located hotel and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: EmaWonderful1
Reviews.Content: Went for a holiday and had a budget to keep to - so the Hawthorn suites were perfect. Hotel was in a good location not a long walk to restaurants or local corner shop. Rooms were spacious and really clean, beds were lovely - really comfortable. Breakfast was ok - but good enough for a free buffet. The staff were very friendly - they all make you feel really welcome, nothing is a problem. Would definately stay there again and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and v.hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: markbarlow
Reviews.Content: The Hawothorn hotel was great. The rooms are huge and kept very clean. Location is great (Downtown disney is really only 3-4 mins away and Parks are 10-15 minutes). Service has been excellent - fridge wasn't working properly so the guy switched it for another (I suggested just defrosting it but he went to the trouble of switching it over which was great service). Everything else worked perfectly in our room - aircon was great, shower etc were brilliant. If I had a tiny complaint I'd say the breakfast wasn't up to much, some mornings it's great - others it's just ok, however it's free so you can hardly complain. You can walk to various restaurants (takes about 10-15 minutes to get to a large selection of restaurants) but there is a small kitchenette in your room or BBQ by the pool (free to use) so you can always cook yourself too. Overall if you are thinking of staying in Orlando I'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Worth of value - recommend”
Reviews.Author: michgu
Reviews.Content: Comparing to other places I traveled in east coast areas, this place is great for money paid for. The night I arrived, my room was upgraded to two Q-bed room with comfortable mattress and bath-room, good-size living area and kitchen(great for a family with kids). Breakfast was different during three days I stayed, really enjoyed it(during my trip to US, most of time I didn't quite their food). Great staffs, specially Jason, quite character, and helpful too. Agreed with other reviews, the shuttle bus to theme parks was quite restricted, renting cars will be better options. I definitely will stay there again next time to spend more time.

Reviews.Title: “not 3* hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fizzo
Reviews.Content: Extremely good room but breakfast certainly not "American Hot Buffet" breakfast as advertised in brochure! As everyone knows Americal breakfasts are vast and varied. This hotel offers 2 hot items,toast, one variety tinned fruit and yoghurt, porridge and one other item! Shuttle bus in poor state of repair and not at convenient times. Shuttle to Universal took 1 and half hours due to numerous pick-ups. Only drops off at EPCOT in WDW I never expect to eat off polystyrene plates using plastic knives and forks at a 3* hotel but this is apparently the norm here! Nowhere near as good as Sheraton safari Suites. It says 100% smoke free but apparently that does not include any outside areas including the pool. As I said, room great but you expect more than a good room for this standard hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have expected more”
Reviews.Author: PotCroydon
Reviews.Content: Went for a fortnight and stayed for a month (thanks to Eyjafjallajökull), but still we enjoyed every day! The rooms are roomy mini-suites (bedroom, bathroom/toilet, separate vanity area, sitting room with well equipped kitchen area). The staff were all fantastic, especialy Jason (as well reported by others - even though he forgot to mention the Ale House for a few days!), Warleen & Eliane. The pool area is smallish, but rarely crowded (except for occasions when school band/choir groups are staying). Breakfast was varied, albeit on certain themes, but with a wide choice, so it needn't be repetative (n.b. the "hamburgers" are actually sausage patties!). The manager's special evenings are generous. I can only think the reviewer who complained that the beer & wine weren't cold was a bit eager and hadn't given them a chance to chill down. Transport arangements to the parks was good (changing at Epcot can be a bit of a drag). However, the return times can be a bit restricting. The hotel taxis were expensive for short trips, but if you asked for/called a metered cab, they were very reasonable (compared to London). Metered and hotel cabs were comparable for longer journeys (e.g. to Universal). We used both, as we weren't driving. Lots of restaurants between 5 and 20 mins walk away. The best time we had was in the Kobe at a hibachi table, which was great entertainment as well as good food (with welcome vegetables too!). Given the big fridge & reasonable freezer in the suite, supermarket shopping is a viable option as well (although there is no oven, just hob & microwave). We need to offer a special thank you for the excellent help & support provided by the staff when we became "distressed travellers" following the volcanic erruption - they took away most of our concerns whilst Virgin were getting their act together. Would highly recommend the Hawthorn Suites as a base for the parks - we hope to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: ksteadman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 1bedroom suite over easter break while we visited the Disney theme parks. The hotel was above and beyond what we expected!! Very clean with such an amazing and friendly staff!! My youngest daughter, 5, had a small break down that she had to leave her baby doll in the room while we were at the parks, when we came back our housekeeper had cleaned the room and placed "Henry" in the made bed like he was napping, my daughter was so excited to see that Henry had been taken care of while she was gone!!! We are florida residents and visit the parks several times a year and we will always stay at the Hawthorn Suites!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jetsetjimbo007
Reviews.Content: Free breakfast ,free beer and wine , free shuttle bus to disney- say no more! oh ok then i will... staff very pleasant and helpful [ yes jason thats you and bernard must get a mention too]. Rooms are large , clean and well equiped. Pool area a bit small but was never really busy. Shops ,bars [HOOTERS]and restaurants are a 5 minute walk away and if your feeling energetic downtown disney is a very nice 45 minute WALK away. If you havn't got a car you will need to use the taxi service that the hotel uses who are all very friendly though not that cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money.”
Reviews.Author: gerberajo
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is a gem. The complimentary breakfast in perfect, there is not a huge selection but there is plenty of toast, fruit, juice, tea, coffee and always 2 hot items aswell. Between 5.30pm and 7.30pm Mon to Thurs the hotel has a FREE happy hour providing red, white and rose wine and beer plus crisps, tortilla chips and salsa. All the rooms are suits with a kitchen and lounge area with a fridge, freezer, dish washer, microwave, hot platesand ample plates , glasses and cutlery. The longe area has a 2 seater sofa and an arm chair along with a TV, large bed room with 2 double beds, wash basin with hair dryer and seperate loo with bath and shower over it. Down Town Disney is a 45 min walk but there are shops and restaurants 5 mins walk from the hotel. The hotel runs a free bus service to all Disney parks but it only departs twice a day at 8.50am and 10.50am and come back about 4pm ish, 8pm ish and 10.30pm. Taxi's are always an option, the hotel uses a company called STS transportation who are excellent however taxis are fairly pricey in Orlando. All reception staff are helpfully and very friendly, Bernard was always happy to help. All in all this hotel is perfect, clean, comfortable, the pool is small but an ideal place to cool off after a busy day at 1 of the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a young family”
Reviews.Author: jgl2005
Reviews.Content: Jason at the front desk was awsome, made us laugh right away. Room was very nice, it was perfect for a family of four. Their are tons of restaurants and fun things to do close by. We will be visiting Hawthorn Suites again!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: mokey01
Reviews.Content: Loved the location as it was convient to anything you might need. Short drives to Disney or it also has a shuttle available. The people working there are all friendly and helpful. Rooms are spacious and beds very comfortable. We now have many friends staying there because of recommendations. Short drive off of all major roads.. Will stay there whenever we are down to Orlando for Disney Parks.

Reviews.Title: “You have got to stay here !!!!”
Reviews.Author: fatzandfamily
Reviews.Content: This is a brilliant hotel, coming from the UK we are not used to excellent service, spotless rooms, friendly staff and free beer. We booked this hotel as part of a package, so I am not sure of the cost of rooms each night, but other reviews seem to rate it for value for money. We had a good, clean bright room on the fourth floor. Big enough for a family of four and with a useful large fridge / freezer. The kitchen utensils were a bit lacking - but we didn't do much cooking and nor will you. The breakfast each morning was great - you could eat as much as you like - more than enough not to bother with too much lunch inside Disney. 5.30-7.30pm free beer / wine / soda's around the pool was pretty good - help yourself !! The free shuttle to Disney was busy (08.30 am an early start but the parks are not too busy in the mornings) we were home on 6.00pm shuttle as the kids had walked enough. A car would be useful at this hotel - but we didn't have one and survived perfectly well - although Americans think you are odd or British if you walk anywhere !! Can't speak highly of this place enough as a base to do Disney, we had a villa on our second week - and sort of missed the amenities at the hotel. Well worth considering, quieter location than hotels on the 535 & 192 but with some restuarants within 10mins walk. 5 Stars from fatz and family.

Reviews.Title: “Ah!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: graciallen
Reviews.Content: The best nights sleep on our 6 day trip. The layout of the suite was perfect for our family with small children. The room was emaculate and clean and oh did I mention comfortable. We loved it so much that when we got our room at the Disney World resort, we wanted to go back to the Hawthorn.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE FOR $69.99”
Reviews.Author: kelchick
Reviews.Content: I chose this property based on location and price. It is 7 minutes from the Orlando Premium Outlet stores, which is where my mom and I were going. I wanted a one bedroom suite, so that my parents could have their own room with tv and I would have the sofa bed (very thin and lumpy mattress) and I could shut the door between the rooms so as not to hear their tv. Nice to have the kitchen, though we didn't use it, other than the fridge. I also wanted a hotel that came with free wi-fi, a hot breakfast and a 2 hour social hour (which is where my Dad could spend time while we shopped). The hot breakfast was scrambled eggs, hash browns and chicken strips (strange, but true), two types of cold cereal, porridge, white and brown bread, (where were the bagels?) and plain and powdered sugar donuts, coffee, tea and juice. The property has a very nice and comfortable breakfast area with lots of seating and a view of the pool. Room decor was average and tv was small and not flat screen. We were given a handicapped accessible room, not because I requested it. In my experience, hotels will put you in that room when you are using a discount and they haven't sold it (on line it was $84 with AAA and in the RoomSaver magazine it was $69.99). The other property I would have choosen would be Homewood by Hilton as it has all the same amenities and much the same location, though it was $89.99 and I went with saving the $20. I can always depend on Hilton quality, but can't say the same for Wyndham. I don't know why the Fitness Room was locked, though it is very small, I would have used the treadmill.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful,”
Reviews.Author: gussydad
Reviews.Content: very clean, quiet, would recommend to friends and family

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in Orlando...slept great...”
Reviews.Author: minnesotamom1969
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the hotel during spring break and enjoyed every minute. The hotel was very clean, rooms are large and the staff was very helpful and friendly. We had a 2 queen bed room and the space was wonderful, we cold have easily had 5-6 people sleeping in the room without feeling crowded. The beds were very comfortable and the halls were quiet. The kitchen with a full fridge, micro and stovetop helped to save money on eating out. Dining area with 4 chairs, 2 tv's. Doors that seperate sleeping from living room and bathroom can be accessed by either room with privacy. Daily breakast was wondeful with hot food buffet style and rotating menu each day (eggs, sausage, bacon, pancakes, potatoes), oatmeal and cereal everyday. Chips and drinks (soda, beer, wine) nightly and Wednesday night also had hot dogs. Business center has only 2 computers, although it was never crowded and there is a charge for using them. It was 60 minutes for $7-$8, but you can use the minutes throughout the stay with an access code. Money Saving Tip: Take advantage of the kitchen facility. There is a Publix near the outlet mall for buying groceries and lots of restaurants close by that offer delivery and take out options also.

Reviews.Title: “Hawthorn Suites Lake Buena Vista - Excellent Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ladye58
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights, excellent place to stay with Kitchenette, staff was excellent, very convenient for near by restaurants and near the entrance of Disney World, we could swim in the hotel's pool, well maintained place, would definitively recommend the Hawthorn Suites Lake Buena Vista in Orlando Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Magical hotel in the city of magic!”
Reviews.Author: funsized
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hawthorn Suites on Palm Parkway was by far the best hotel stay we have ever had! When we arrived in town we were earlier than normal check-in time, however since our room was ready we were able to check in right away. As we got to our room housekeeping had jst finished cleaning and let me tell you...what a great job they did, the room looked brand new. I have to say, that aside from it having all the comforts of home...the bed was out of this world, most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept on (we actually wrote the name of the mattress down before we left), the pool area was a kids dream (big kids too). They had a huge pool, large hot tub and a small padded basketball court right at the pool. I would recommemend this hotel to any one going to the Orlando area, I know my family and I will stay there again. Very quite, clean and affordable. We were only minutes from all the theme parks and within walking distance to severl stores and places to eat. Again, best hotel stay EVER!!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: MomsFun
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect fit for my family and our trip - we stayed here 8 nights. We received outstanding customer service and were always treated with kindness and respect. Our room was well-furnished, with everything we needed. It was cleaned daily and our housekeeper did a great job. The location was the best ever. Close to the parks, many eating choices, entertaiment, etc, but far enough off the road to be peaceful and quiet in the evenings. Pool was warm and outdoor facilities were clean and well-kept too. The breakfast was a huge added bonus and offered a lot of choices on a rotating daily basis. We will definately plan to stay here again and will recommend to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, with all parks and attractions within easy reach.”
Reviews.Author: twaeejits
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean, bright and airy with large reception area and adjacent breakfasting area off to the side. Breakfast is basic, consisting of scrambled eggs each morning with ONE meat (bacon, meat pattie, sausage, ham) which varied daily. A small selection of tinned and fresh fruit was available, with bread and bagels, as were coffee, tea and soft drinks. Although you were able to help yourself to as much as you could eat, those with a larger appetite and/or who wanted greater choice, could take a short walk/drive to one of several eateries nearby. Our suite was amply big, with two queen size beds and vanity area which was seperate from the toilet/bath/shower room. The kitchen area was equiped with a fridge/freezer and microwave and sufficient cutlery/crockery. TV's both in the lounge and bedroom. Housekeeping service was excellent - more than ample towels were supplied and changed daily. Complimentary beer, red/rose/white wines and snacks/dips were provided in the breakfasting area every Mon-Thur evening until 7.30. With the exception of two female receptionists all staff were excellent, very friendly and extremely helpful. Special praise to Jason, for whom nothing was a problem and went out of his way to be of assistance. This guy deserves a pay rise and promotion!! A very good hotel with great staff, in a superb location for easy access to all the parks, shopping malls and other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a small family...perfect location if not staying on Disney property!”
Reviews.Author: themacsofwilbon
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased overall with this hotel. I relied a lot on the other reviews written on this site and felt compelled to do the same. My husband and I have a 9 year old and an almost 1 year old and were looking for an affordable place to stay, within close proximity to Disney and Universal. We needed a place that would allow breathing room after being at the parks all day and for our littlest one to roam around after being in the stroller all day. Hawthorne Suites was perfect for that. It had a small kitchen...perfect for us though...plenty of counter space...nice size sink...normal size refrigerator and microwave...nothing miniature about it....perfect for small meals and bringing back leftovers! We had the room with a king size bed...we requested a crib once we got there and although it wasn't in the best condition, the pack and play was just what we needed. Our oldest slept on the pull out couch and had zero complaints...he had his own TV so that made him happy as well. I did notice there is some sort of gaming control hooked to the TV but didn't look into it at all. The living area was perfect for our small little family....a recliner and a small couch. The bathroom was clean which made me very happy...it was also a nice size...had plenty of counter space for all of our stuff and a nice seat to sit at while getting ready....The only complaints I think I could make are that we had to go down twice to ask for toilet paper (although we chose not to get housekeeping everyday, which is probably why we were not fully stocked) and there was not a lot of drawer space for "big packers" such as myself. Overall those are not big deals at all and I was extremely satisfied and would definitely choose to stay here in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: petronie
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ideally situated to visit the Disney parks and surroundings, plenty of shopping, restaurants and grocery stores around. We had a 1 bedroom suite, king size bed was extremely comfortable, sofa bed was adequate, the room was clean. Kitchen is functional but not very well equipped. Breakfast is standard, scramble eggs, some meat, bagels, toast, oatmeal, few fruits. Nice pool area and jacuzzi, nice basketball court, and nice exercise room. Very courteous staff at front desk. One of the downsides, Monday to Thursday happy hour,offered only chips and salsa, warm beer, warm soft drinks, and ok wine. Shuttle service to Epcot only will save you 14$ in parking. Expect 30 min to and from Epcot. For the price 100 can$ per night it was a excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Univor
Reviews.Content: This Hawthorne is two minutes from the maingate to Disney and minutes to Sea World. What distinguished this Hawthrone was the value for money, the service and the setting. For less that $100/night we got a fabulous room that included one bedroom w two queen size beds, 2 tv's, fridge, stove, dishwasher, microwave, a hidabed, and a bathroom separated from the vanity area. The rooms are a little dated but they are being upgraded. The overall service was fabuloius: rooms were spotless everyday, front desk was amazingly courteous and helpful and the breakfast staff always had a smile on their face. The hotel has a heated pool, whirlpool, wireless interenet, a gym, and shuttle service to the parks. WOW! One more thing, there is a free cocktail hour four nights a week. We are definitely going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: KiwiNewark
Reviews.Content: Greeted by friendly staff (Jason), reception and breakfast area looked very nice, pool very welcoming. Room - spacious bedroom, bathroom and lounge/kitchen area, very clean, with clean towels everyday. No safe in room, but a safe behind the reception desk free of charge. Breakfast - a good start to the day, variety of items to choose, bagels, croissants, toast, eggs, bacon, sausage, yogurt, fruit, cereals. Happy hour a couple of times a week - this was great if you got back from the parks early, cool beer and wine was offered with nibbles. Hotel could have done with a shop, although it wasn't too far to the supermarket or restaurants. Only downside to staying at this hotel if you didn't have a car was the transportation provided by the hotel, Virgin do not mention this in their brochure. You can only get the seaworld shuttle if you are Virgin customers and must book on it at reception the day before. Shuttle to Disney World okay, although there are a few pick up stops on the way, but the shuttle to Universal - you have to get on the Disney World coach and it goes there first then onto Universal, you seem to be on the coach quite along time, Virgin need to sort this out. A range of times to take you and to bring you back. Taxi's to and from the park are around £20 per trip. All the staff are very helpful and friendly. All in all this hotel was great and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Your money goes a long way with Hawthorn Suites”
Reviews.Author: dmocman
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service, very family friendly establishment. Loved the kitchen. It saved us money on dinning out. Provided free shuttle to Disney World. Free buffet breakfast- WOW

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Pam1981
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable, clean room. The entire hotel was well kept. Very Friendly staff. Includes Hot breakfast!. These is a booth near the enterance to buy theme park tickets. Very nice place. will definetely 100% stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: jengajen
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a week 2 adults and 2 teenagers, rooms cleaned every day, maid service very good, other staff very helpful, beds comfy, some of bedding bit shabby but clean, good kitchen facilities, breakfast ok menu changes every day couldn't get my head round chicken dippers on the menu though! We usually stay at Sheraton Safari but their safari suites were £150 more for the week and no breakfast included, location of Sheraton is better though for restaurants in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of space in this place”
Reviews.Author: DessertsDivaFL
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights (Sunday and Monday) and enjoyed our stay. Jason, as a previous reviewer mentioned, is great at the front desk. He's very nice and accommodating when you ask him questions. Staff was good, especially Rafael who assisted us with a shower curtain that was too short and replaced it. The location is wonderful. If you need a quick, inexpensive meal option, go to Ci Ci Pizza Buffet just a 1/4 mile down the street. There is a coupon book in the room for it which I wish I had known about and I could have gotten a buffet meal free. The kitchen is nice. There is a full-size refrigerator, dishwasher, toaster and microwave. They supply the dishwasher detergent but no dish detergent for handwashing. There are a few pots and pans to use on the two burner stovetop. There are plates, bowls, coffee cups, drinking glasses, wine glasses and silverware. The bathroom was separated by two doors. The toilet and shower were in a separate room. There was only one sink. The bedroom-suite had a separate entrance to the bathroom. That bedroom suite was huge! Plenty of space! The couch did pull out into a bed which was adequate for my two slim teens. My mom and I loved the comfortable King bed; we slept like queens. The pool and jacuzzi were nice. The half basketball court was used by both of my teens. We brought our own basketball from home so I don't know if they have one available. The game room is small. Only 5 games. The free breakfast buffet was just fine. Nothing elaborate but it is better than others I have seen. Here is what we got to choose from on both mornings: two cereals, toast, bagels, fresh fruit, canned fruit, hot oatmeal, eggs, corned beef hash, sausage, milk, juices, coffee, tea and English muffins. You won't find all of that on one morning but you will have something similar on your visit. TIP: get there right after it starts at 7 am and beat the rush. Yes, this was a long review but if you are like me, you'll want to be well informed BEFORE you spend your money. We paid around $100 a night. Was it worth it? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: ProfJustice
Reviews.Content: Amazing place! Clean, beautiful, modern, and incredibly friendly and accomodating. Outstanding housekeeping. But the best thing about Hawthorne LBV is JASON. The worst thing about our stay was a brief water outage apparently due to some mergency repair - and it was during the afternoon when we had returned only for a few minutes before heading out for dinner and night activities. Didn't have the breakfast so can't comment, but whatever assistance you need, Jason is there to provide it from medical to shopping, he helps. Very centrally located to all attractions, Urgent Care center and Walgreens nearby. Great suites, extremely comfortable and clean beds, very useful kitchenettes. Will not stay anywhere else when we return! Stay here and say hi to Jason. He truly is the MAN!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, tranquil, and in the best off site Disney location possible.”
Reviews.Author: DisneyMomForever
Reviews.Content: I was happily surprised with this quiet little all suites hotel. Walking distance to Downtown Disney, and a 5 minute drive to all major Disney parks. Too numerous to count were the great quality restaurants and two supermarkets at the ready to stock your kitchenette in every room. If you time it right, the hot, free! breakfast buffet and free shuttle to Disney parks, were definitely a major plus for me and four other family members traveling on a budget. Not to mention you save $14.00 by not having to park your car at Disney. The parking at Hawthorn is, you guessed it, also free! The rooms were spacious enough for three adults and two small children and everything was very clean. I will definitely stay here again for our next Disney adventure!!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL, QUIET, VERY CLEAN,”
Reviews.Author: MaroonMike
Reviews.Content: LOCATION Firstly, when you go to Orlando, your hotel is usually just a base, so if you want clean, friendly, good location (and if you have a hire car) this hotel is for you. If you rely on hotel/public transport and you like to be in walking distance of a lot of shops/restaurants then you would be better staying at International Drive, however, at the Hawthorn, you are within walking distance of several restaurants - Perkins, Dennys, IHOP, Red Lobster, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut, Macdonalds, Black Angus (we loved this steak restaurant, one of our favourites.) Hawthorn is a couple of mins drive from I4, and downtown disney, in Lake Buena Vista. There is a pharmacy and a doctors couple of mins drive away also. The doctors is open usually till 8pm, very good service, I had a chest infection :( very expensive though, over $250, we paid upfront, and claimed from our insurance when we got home, but I think if you take your paperwork in with you, they can sort the payment through them there and then. HOTEL We arrived at the hotel in the evening, and the desk was manned by Jason (Jason rules!) who upgraded us to an executive suite (Living room, kitchen, separate bedroom) We like our hotel quiet, and this one suited our needs perfectly. (Again, if you want to have your children entertained at the hotel, this may not be ideal, the pools are small, but there is a small games room and a basketball court) The breakfast was complimentary, if you expect a feast, this isn't for you. You get the basic choice - 2 cereals, toast, usually either bagels or waffles, porridge, and 2 hot items, ie sausages and scrambled eggs, tea, coffee. juice - you serve yourself, so you can eat as much as you want. (What do you want for free?! ) The hotel decor is what I would call basic American hotel standard, nothing special, but it all seemed new and clean. We never saw any litter in or around the hotel, it was always spotless. The maid service was always good. (If you don't have a 'do not disturb' sign, just ask a maid, she will provide one happily) We have been to Orlando many times and have stayed at a lot of hotels, and we would definately stay here again, another one of our other favourites being the Fairfield Inn at the Mariott Village, Lake Buena Vista. (Which has a full breakfast with every item you could think of being offered - for those of you who like a hearty breakfast!) TRAVEL We booked our hotel, car and flight (virgin) independently, I would recommend this if you have a few hours to trawl the internet, and it is always cheaper than going through a travel agent. (Internet prices always vary each time you check, but I've had previous deals through Expedia, Opodo, Travel Republic, Travelocity to name a few) and every time I have beaten the travel agents by at least £100 per person. Virgin have always been the best choice for us for comfort on the flight, however, this time they weren't as good as usual. (dirty planes, surly staff, inedible food, broken T.V. screeens etc) however, I would recommend them for their early check in at downtown Disney on your homeward flight. You can check your luggage in from 8:30am, then you can have a full day at the parks, and when you get to the airport, you just go straight to passport control. Please note though, that they will charge you $10 each for this service if you have not booked ALL of your holiday through Virgin travel agents.

Reviews.Title: “what a lovely reception we got at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gamboid
Reviews.Content: my husband and my son and daughter and i,booked this hotel back in january 09.After travelling for nearly 23 hours,the very freindly receptionist jason,had us booked in within minutes.The hotel was very clean with maid service to your room every day which was exellent.The food was good if you liked eggs,and there was plenty of fruit,bread,bagels,even porrige.The wine and beer in the evenings were lovely.My son really enjoyed the half basket ball court out side just over from the swimming pool.Because we were there for christmas the reception area was all decorated with a tree and stockings hanging over the fire place.The only down side was the pool is not so big,Christmas day was just another day over there,so we will be staying in the uk at christmas time.We really enjoyed this hotel and would stay here and in the lbv area again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it!”
Reviews.Author: PWTPWT
Reviews.Content: We visited South Florida and did our share of hotels. This was the worst by far. When we arrived we were told the quoted price/rate was wrong and were asked to pay more. Then the rooms were smelly. The breakfast (included in the prices) was completely below standard. Worst, they overcharged us and had to ask my credit card to review the charges. There are many other hotels in that same area. Avoid this one.

Reviews.Title: “clogged toilet ,left for days-had to use bathroom down hallway”
Reviews.Author: pickle2u
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for part of our trip to disney,universal,ect. (because the other goergous place didn't have any rooms for all of the days we wanted to stay. our toilet clogged the second morning we were there and asked them to unclog it. the maintence man came to plunge it pretty fast-i must say on his behalf. but alittle later (next time someone used the bathroom) the toilet clogged again (it appearently wasn't totally fixed the first time) we again asked them to unclog it again and later the man came to "fix " it. this time the maintainance man looked at us as if we were doing something wrong but i can assure you that we were not.when he came this time he grumbled that there was paper still in it and preceded to scoop it out and put it in our trash can and left it there! GROSS! the next time someone used the toilet yes, you guessed it, it was still clogged. this time my husband went down to the front desk and explained to them that the plunger was not fixing the problem and they will need to "snake it" (my husband said that is a tool they put down into the drain to unclog any "problems")the man said they would come fix it and that they do infact have one of those tools. we then left for the day to go to one of the parks. after a long exhausting day with the kids we came "home" to an awful smell hitting us in the face as we opened the door.it was late and not something i felt like dealing with after a day like that.i was furious that they left a toilet full of (i am sure you know what -that i do not need to describe) and all of the stuff that ran over on to the floor was still there.i told them again at the desk. to get the response of that we didnt tell them until my husband reminded them about the snake conversation he changed his mind and said oh yeah thats right and "if we want them to fix it let them know" and "we are welcome to use the public bathroom down the hall near the lobby". are you kidding me! my husband had to get up in the middle of the night, get dressed again to go down the hallway to the lobby to use the bathroom. (mean while our room smelled like crap!). we had to pull the bathroom door shut until the morning when we decided to just go home a day early. the man at the front desk at check out asked us how our stay was and even he was mortified that we were treated like that!!!! ****our other half of our stay we stayed at cane island resorts and would never stay at another place in orlando area! it is absulutely beautiful ! granite countertops in both full bathrooms and kitchen,desk everywhere a countertop was, both bedrooms had full walkin closets , beautiful full kitchen also with granite, ceramic tile floors through out unit. bedroom and living room had flat screen plasma/lcd tv's. another walk in closet in living area and a complete seperate laundry room with washer and dryer (soaps included for dish washer and washing machine) everything looked brand new and imaculate!!!!! also forgot fully stocked kitchen with every utensil and dish ever needed even a complete knife set in wooden knife block. complete dining room table with 8 chairs and everything is decorated beautifully.we got that beautiful place and was very affordable too!!!!! can't say enough about CANE ISLAND RESORTS!!! ***** GO STAY THERE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: bevshan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before in 2007 and the high standard remains the same.The suites are comfortable & well appointed,service is excellent,staff are friendly and overall this hotel makes our stay in Orlando a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “good amenities but overrun by packages”
Reviews.Author: joycelondon_England
Reviews.Content: Suites are nice and public areas impressive but cheap English package holidays have swamped the place. As individual travellers we found this off-putting.
