We felt that we were paying normal prices, while breakfasts and manager's reception evenings had been scaled down to package prices. The business centre is expensive and the public areas often noisy. We moved to the Embassy suites opposite where the suites were just as nice but prices and breakfasts were better and the atmosphere more peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyGToronto
Reviews.Content: Our fourth time staying at the Hawthorn Suites.....thoroughly enjoyed it. Great service, very clean rooms. Staff very courteous and helpful......great value for your money. Will be back again. Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay for Disney Visits”
Reviews.Author: haydenbilly
Reviews.Content: Excellent value Hotel .......great rooms and great hot buffet breakfast served every morning which saved so much time with getting young children out in the morning ! Just ten minutes from the Disney parks & Sea World with plenty of reasonable restaurants and supermarkets nearby, some within walking distance. Would definately stay here again . Jason and Rosalyn on reception are also extremely helpful .

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel that suited our needs”
Reviews.Author: mae610
Reviews.Content: The Hawthorn offered alot for the price we paid. During our stay, we were able to work out some important kinks. PRICE: We booked early and prepaid at a time when there was a special offer - ended up only costing $80/nite. BREAKFAST: They love their sausage and eggs. (some ham or bacon would have been a nice change). The only variety with the hot items was the shape of the food. Work around this by varying the type of breakfast you eat each morning (combo up fruit, yogourt, waffles, English muffins, toast, bagels, peanut butter, jam, cream cheese, pancakes, eggs, sausage, cereal, juice bar, and coffee in any way you desire) Breakfast was a great time saver when trying to maximize your time at the park. SHUTTLE: the hotel offers 3 morning departures and 3 evening returns to/from Epcot. This worked fine as long as you schedule your day accordingly. If not, arrange a taxi(not the hotel taxi - i'll discuss next} or try to catch a shuttle at another hotel. Be aware that you must prebook a pickup time with the driver when you board or phone to get on the eve shuttle(even when we called though the driver still did not have our name on the list (: ) A car may have been more convenient but a litlle confusing for 1st timers to find your way around, and definitely more expensive ( gas, rental, park parking $14). TAXI: the hotel taxi has a flat rate of $30 to Epcot! Call a Yellow Checker Cab instead- $17 to Epcot or take the Checker Cab to a Downtown Disney hotel (called "hotel plaza") ($5) - their shuttles run every 1/2 hr. to several parks. We caught the same shuttle back, and then would taxi back to our hotel. The busses MAY also run to the parks from Downtown Disney transter station (our cab was cheaper and closer to a Downtown Disney hotel though (Double tree or Best Western). POOL: Was pretty small - nothing fancy, but was a nice area to lay around in the sun. LOCATION: the Hawthorn is not very close to convenience stores, but a 15 min walk or a short taxi ride will get you to a couple of food marts. Also, some decent restaurants are the same distance (Olive Garden). Delivery food (Italian, pizza, Oriental) became our specialty when we were at the hotel. Portions are quite large. Crossroads is a shopping /restaurant area a little farther away at the intersection to Downtown Disney. HOTEL: the hotel dest offers a free safety deposit box to use. They were friendly and helpful. We requested a room change(original room was musty and on lower level) and they obliged. They provided extra requested bedding. Also offered to confirm and do online checkin our airport arrangements. All in all a good stay at the Hawthorn Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing paradise!”
Reviews.Author: ms_nick25
Reviews.Content: I spent hours scouring through hotels in the Orlando area and stumbled upon this one! I was looking for a hotel with free breakfast,fridge in room and hot tub! This had all of the above! I booked it on www.cheaprooms.com and got an amazing deal. The rooms are lovely comfortable 2 queen beds. The internet is fast, the shuttle bus it great and it allows small strollers. I loved loved staying here. The staff are really nice! Pick this hotel and you won't have any headaches!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, lovely staff very central”
Reviews.Author: MICKEYDUCK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on a family trip to Orlando. This hotel in situated in the Lake Buena Vista area. It is a hotel rather than the usual motel which I felt very secure in. The fact that it was a hotel was one of the main reasons we chose it. The hotel is on 5 floors ( I think). We were intially given ground floor rooms but asked for this to be changed as we had asked not to have ground floor rooms on the initial booking. This was altered without any bother. Our room was on the 1st floor up looking on to the car park ( which was not really a great view as it just looked onto the car park and land that is dormant). The room consisted of a large bedroom with 2 double beds, bathroom, very small living dining room and kitchen. The bedroom was fine, clean, comfortable. Bathroom fine, The living area could do with updating, my son slept on the sofa bed and it was a bid worn out and could have done with being replaced. The kitchen again is very dated and was units were quite badly chipped. This put us of using the kitchen so we tended to eat out. Breakfast was okay but the hot food choices were very limited and not vegetarian friendly. Other than that you had the usual cereal, sometimes fruit was fine but not as good as the breakfast we had when we stayed at the Country Inn around the corner a few years ago. Staff in food area did not speak english so had trouble explaining about daughters nut allergy, needed to find someone to translate which was inconvenient. The pool area was small but nice. The only downpoint was that we noticed that someone had left a present in the spa pool ( luckily this was before we had went in). We brought this to the attention of reception staff who sent someone to have a look but nothing was done. I dont know if they left is to disintegrate or if someone did eventually clean it but we did not use pool or spa after this again. The receiption staff were mainly nice, cheery annd helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, will be back”
Reviews.Author: littlegang
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks at the Hawthorne Suites. It is a lovely place to stay - rooms are big and cleaned really well daily. Reception area and pool area are clean and spacious. The breakfasts were fine, managers receptions a little treat every night (during the week), and everyone staying there were lovely. There was my mum and dad (seniors), my 2 girls (7 and 6), myself and my husband and the location of the hotel as well as the nice pool area and the fact that Disney World is literally around the corner (we had our own transport) made for a brilliant holiday for all ages. We would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “I would return in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: DonJupiter_FL
Reviews.Content: From the moment the six of us seniors entered the lobby, a wonderful experience unfolded. Jason at the front desk could not have been nicer , helping us in coordiating our room locations , helping with dinner plans, to providing us with advice on our travels to DisneyWorld, etc. The rooms were spacious and comfortable allowing us to meet in the evenings, have a coctail and plan our next days adventure. The buffet breakfast was a treat. The only complaint I have is I was not happy with the shower head, but then I am never happy with most shower heads in hotels.

Reviews.Title: “will be back”
Reviews.Author: janetwildthing
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with helpful staff. The buffet was a plus, athough bacon or ham on occasion would have been a nice change. The closet needed more space with a higher rack to hang clothes on and the bathroom vanity needed to be larger, but the beds were super comfortable and my husband fell in love with the shower, This is a place we will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Hawthorn”
Reviews.Author: Disney
Reviews.Content: We always choose this hotel to stay when visiting Orlando. Great location & quiet. Free breakfast each morning with plenty of choices. Free beer and wine M-T with a light lunch on Wed. We also got free cookies and juice upon arrival and a free pizza dinner on the day of our choice. I found this special online and Rafael, the manager, made sure we got it. I always ask for a room facing the pool as I think this is the quiet part of the hotel as there are no roads in any direction. The room is a suite with separate bedrooms and full kitchen area. The only thing I think they should upgrade is the TV. A lot of hotels are getting flat screen and they still have the old fashioned ones. I always rent a car and this is best thing to do for this hotel, although they do have a free shuttle, which I have never taken so I can't comment on that. All in all the best hotel in the Lake Buena Vista area and such a value for your dollar with all the free amenties. Stay, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Runricardo
Reviews.Content: We spent two weeks at this hotel in september after recommendation by a close friend. It lived up to all our expectations. Rooms well generous in size and well equipped, with comfortable beds and super air-con in the room. Maid service was excellent with clean towels and rooms tidied each day. Staff were always willing to assist and happy in their work. Manager, Rafael, was so helpful. Breakfast was varied and had the family down together each morning as we all enjoyed the food so much. Outside pool was usually empty and open til 10pm each night, children swam in it each day, 3ft shallow to 5ft at deepest so safe for our children. Plenty of car parking space, with easy access onto the roads and off to the theme parks along the easy to find Disney sign-posted roads, about 10-15 mins to Magic Kingdom. Well situated for several restaurants, less than 5 minutes walk, with Olive Garden being the best attraction with well prepared meals. We will definately use this hotel again on our next visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at Hawthorn”
Reviews.Author: karchick41
Reviews.Content: Great rates! I paid $53.10/night with AAA card. We also got upgraded to a suite room upon check in. It's like a little apartment, kitchenette, living room, 2 queen bedroom with doors - 2 tvs, very nice. The beds were super soft and comfy after a long day in the sun. Great breakfast in the morning, they change it up every day - grits, pancakes, sausage, eggs, fruit you name it... very good. If you're planning on going to Disney and have a car or a rental, definitely stay here. I visited family at a Disney resort hotel (Coronado Springs) and their room didn't even compare to ours. The pool is tiny, but still nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: harrogatelass9
Reviews.Content: Just back from two weeks at this hotel, on arrival met by pleasent helpful staff. Joleen especially was always polite and cheerful.Rooms were bright clean and large, beds were really comfortable( especially after a long day at the parks) and it was quiet at night. Pool wasn't the largest but great for cooling off after the day out.Free breakfast was a good start to the day. Downside would have to be transport to the Theme Parks wasn't exactly as described in Virgin Brochure so we used the hire car every day. Also it was further away from Downtown Disney than expected.But all in all it was value for money and we had a pleasent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not try to sit around the pool.”
Reviews.Author: Dreyfuss45
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, room had bedroom, bathroom, kitchen area, and livingroom area. Hotel had hot breakfast in morning. The swimming pool area was very small, with about 20 chair to sit in for a 120 suite hotel. You get the idea. Florida is hot and it would be nice to have a chair around the pool in the middle of the day. I did tell management about the no chairs problem but they didn't do a thing about it. Will look for a bigger pool and more chairs at my next stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice - would go their again......”
Reviews.Author: Flowers1000
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from 3 wks in Florida where we stayed at the Hawthorn Suites LBV for the first two. The building is perfectly situated right in the middle of all attractions - a great location. The apartment room was light and spacious and the large seperate bedroom was ideal to house my two teenagers (especially as it was my honeymoon, and all being in the same bedroom would have been a nightmare!!!) Staff were very courteous and helpful, but my only complaint is that when we asked for a spare duvet for the sleeper sofa, we were just given an extra blanket instead & were left feeling slightly chilly some nights.The swimming pool wasn't huge, but was ideal and never crowded. A perfect cooler at the end of a hot day. Breakfast was slightly limited in variety, but bearing in mind that it's included in the price we were pleased overall. Beware of the people selling excursions tickets at the hotel entrance........my husband and son decided to take a trip to Kennedy Space Centre, whilst my daughter & I opted to stay local and do shopping. The display board at the excursion desk quoted about $38 for an adult ticket, and no extra costs were explained when my husband booked the trip. When he got onto the coach he was actually charged nearer $200, and was told the extra costs was the coach fare. Please make sure that you ask for the FULL price of excursions that require transportation to make sure you don't get caught out in the same way. We struggled to pay the statutory 15% tip for everything, as we're used to only tipping for a good or excellent service and begrudged leaving a tip for mediocre or poor service. I got the feeling that some restuarants weren't too keen on the English as a couple of waiters pointed out to us after the meal that a tip had NOT been automatically included in the bill (in other words, don't forget to leave me something). This incensed me, and made me feel less inclined to leave extra. On a parting note, one final word of warning to anyone driving on the I75 from West Florida back to Orlando. On the final stretch of road up to the I4, the road is swarming with traffic police, and I was issued with a heft fine for speeding. I know I only have myself to blame, but if I go again I intend to stick rigidly to the speed limit (even if it is a 5 hour drive!!). Anyway, great hotel & would go their again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great room. Great service. Bad shuttle service.”
Reviews.Author: boodoo83
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Expedia.com. Upon arrival, guest service was very friendly and helpful. We got our room in less than 5 minutes. The room is clean, comfortable, especially the beds. You can get a room with bed + bathroom OR a suite which includes bad(s) + bathroom + kitchen + living room. This hotel offers free hot breakfast every morning (sausages, eggs, english muffins, bagels, bread, coffee, hot cocoa, tea, milk, orange juice, apple juice, soda pop - the menu varies everyday or two). The breakfast area is clean and spacious. The hotel has one small pool and one small hot tub - and the closing time for the pool is at 10:00pm. The pools however are clean. Finally, the hotel offers scheduled shuttle buses that goes ONLY to Epcot. I would not recommand this hotel is you expect to go early at the parks and come back late after the shows/fireworks. The shuttle service is very slow. The bus driver was late every morning and had to go pick up other people from OTHER hotels. The earliest arrives at 8:45am (instead of 8:20am as scheduled) and actually get to Epcot only at 9:30am. Then you will have to take extra disney transportation to go to one park to another. We lost quite some time with the shuttle buses. We would instead recommand the shuttle bus service from the Comfort Inn Lake Buena Vista - which was GREAT! Again, hotel is GREEEAATT, shuttle buses aren't.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but expected a little more”
Reviews.Author: jam315
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Hawthorne. The hotel is nice and well kept, the staff was good. Our major concerns were the breakfast, the internet service and the pool size. The breakfast was a major selling point after looking at there website. When traveling with the wife and two kids of varying ages (15) & (7), everyone has different taste and wants. Breakfast was very basic and not as elaborate as they make it seem. The free wifi internet is a joke, we were on the second floor and the only way we could catch service was to sit the laptop on the window ledge and that connection was minimal. The messed up thing was that there was a pay internet service that had a super strong service (hmm....). there is also a business center downstairs that cost $3-5 per 15 mins. My kids live to go in the pool and this one was pretty small for a hotel that size. If you are just looking for a nice suite with the basics and don't need any of these amenities then this is a nice place and I would advise you to stay.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireShopper
Reviews.Content: just returned from spending two weeks at the hawthorn suites lbv , the hotel was very clean and rooms spacious. The hotel staff were friendly and the reception staff extremely helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast was a bit of a let down but it was free. The free bus to disney was an experience HIRE A CAR or take a taxi which were cheap and realiable. Resturants and supermarkets are within walking distance of the hotel so ideal if you dont want to be in the hub of the action. I would recommend a stay at this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: jakolk
Reviews.Content: This place was the most amazing deal and location for the price I payed! From the free drinks/snacks at night to the hot tub, easy transportation to Downtown Disney, and the AMAZING complimentary breakfast in the morning....the BEST deal and I will be going back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed”
Reviews.Author: pag63
Reviews.Content: Our family is just back from a 2 week stay at this hotel and we had a great time. We had a suite with 2 queen beds and a king size sofa bed in the living room, perfect for our family with 2 teenagers. As others have said the rooms are clean and comfortable, we were on the 5th floor and heard no noise from roads, air con (except when our own was on) or other occupants of the hotel. Breakfast is great to start your day, and tea and coffee are available 24 hrs. The free wine, beer and snacks on a monday - thursday is an additional bonus! There are restaurants within walking distance if you want to enjoy the wine and beer. We used the gas BBQ a couple of times and the tools are available at reception. There is a Walmart a few miles up the Turkey Lake Road so really handy to stock the fridge and to get snacks. The kids played basketball on the half court, the ball is at reception. The pool is small but welcoming after a day at the theme parks, and there are small towels provided at the poolside.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: robintexas_9
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our vacation and I highly recommend this hotel. The location is very convenient. Free breakfast will get you off to a good start. The staff is knowlegable and friendly. Guest services, right in the front lobby was also very helpful. The suite has everything needed to made you stay comfortable. Go and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a Great Room”
Reviews.Author: HpiCmpr
Reviews.Content: We love staying here because of the low prices for a full suite esp. traveling with small children. In a great location for getting to the parks. An added bonus to the low cost is the full buffet breakfast. This was our second time staying and we would defiantly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Value for Money a must stay”
Reviews.Author: POMPEYSMIFFS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in 2008 & enjoyed our experience so much we booked again to stay here this year and we weren't disppointed, as others have said the beds are the comfiest I have ever stayed in, breakfast is great and sets you up for the day & savs you time & money deciding where to go etc. Close to everything you can think of and Ok the pool isnt the biggest but it will do for an hour or so I mean you don't go to Orlando and want to laze by the pool for days on end thats what the waterparks are for right? Staff are very very friendly and hotel is quiet and adequately equipped. I would recommend thids hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We are repeat guests and love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: srcwec
Reviews.Content: We were repeat guests of this established for two nights arriving May 13 and leaving May 15, 2009. This was our 8th stay at this hotel since October, 2008. We are lucky enough to live an hour and 15 minutes away and we have Season tickets to Disney and go once a month. We can find no fault with this hotel at all. I have written a review in the past and still find this to be a great place to stay. The staff has always been friendly and the rooms clean and comfortable. The last morning we were at breakfast, there was a group of around 100 teens and they were all there getting something to eat. We were amazed at how well the breakfast staff kept up--replenishing all the food, etc. This was quite a feat!!!!! Have already made reservations for June as our granddaughter will be visiting and we are looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: crockerUk
Reviews.Content: An excellent location and handy for all Florida attractions if you have a car. Very pleasant and helpfull staff.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Will Defintely Go Back!!!”
Reviews.Author: J2uk
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed in this hotel for 3 weeks, it was great, breakfast was good, rooms were massive and the beds were very comfy, staff were very friendly and helpful. They even rnanaged to have a suprise birthday cake/fruit basket made for my 20th birthday, when my mother rang up and asked them to. It has a very central location, but i would advise a car as it is a fair way to walk everywhere, even though this is what we did most of the time. Only a couple of picky bits, it could do with having some internet access, more choice a the breakfast, a restaurant and a better heatlh centre. Apart from that i would 100% recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here for longer than a couple of days”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireDeb
Reviews.Content: Rooms are grubby. Breakfast is very poor, very little choice. The pool is no bigger than you would expect in a villa. It is about a 40 minute walk to the nearest eating establishment. Staff are rude and unhelpful. Over all if you want to stay in a over priced travel lodge (UK) or motel (USA then stay here

Reviews.Title: “A must stay!”
Reviews.Author: sliderjudkins
Reviews.Content: Staff was outstanding/friendly. Room was excellent. Will stay at again

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: amantha1411
Reviews.Content: I took a long time reading other reviews before choosing this hotel, and was very happy on arrival that I had made a good choice. It was easy to find from the airport, and the check in was smooth and the staff friendly and helpful. We were given a room on the 5th floor and had no problem with noise at all. the room itself was spacious and clean, and having a seperate bedroom meant we could put the kids to bed and then relax in the lounge/diner. The kitchen was fully equiped, and was great to be able to store juice beer and snacks. (we used a saucepan to boil water for tea!) Although coffee was available 24hrs a day in the breakfast area. The breakfast itself was a fairly basic selection of your average american fayre, but all good quality. there were two hot dishes a day, eg scrambled eggs and bacon, or sausage and corned beef hash, as well as toast and either bagels muffins or waffles. They also have cereal, fruit and yoghurts, so pretty much something for everyone, and certainly enough to set you up for a busy day at the parks. The beds have to be the most comfy of any hotel I have ever stayed in, and the linen was clean and fresh. I would say you definatly need a car, even though the hotel provides transportation to disney, it can take a while as you get dropped off at Epcot, so by the time you have got to any of the other parks, especially if travelling with small children, you will soon be tired out. This hotel is in a fantastic location for all Disney parks, Universal and Seaworld. it is also near the I-4 if you are going elsewhere after. If you do want to stock up on groceries, Walmart is about 4 miles up the road, just turn left out of the hotel and keep going! Its also great for getting Disney souvenirs and T-shirts for half the price. Overall a fantastic hotel that i would highly recommend, especially if you are travelling with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for both disney and universal”
Reviews.Author: gills88
Reviews.Content: I would have given this four or even five stars as others have but we must have had one of the noisest worse rooms in the hotel (118 on the ground floor) next to plant and electrical rooms so its a frustrating three. First night was woken up at 3:30 am by a right racket. Previous reviewers have mentioned plumbing etc and can only assume its all down to what room and floor you are on. First the negatives, no kettle so us brits have to rely on the coffee perculator or the 24 hr tea coffee available in the breakfast area for our cuppas. Had probs with the ironing board, the bathroom sink and the air conditioning - there are no variable fan speeds and the thermo needs constant attention. Beware if you like fresh air from an open window at night you're stuffed so this caused the Mrs problems. The fridge seem to give up the ghost later in the week. Users stole all the basketballs so my son and I couldnt play on the court later in the week. I might seem to be nitpicking here so here are all the positives. Very clean and spacious suites we had two very comfy king size beds a living room and kitchen, services were excellent. Free wi-fi and breakfast although repetitive and average quality, nice pool though small / grounds large reception lobby games / IT rooms and free shuttle to parks but yuo really need a car even for the meals out - no-one walks anywhere. Handy for local restaurants on vineyard thouroughly recommend bahama breeze, macaroni grill and olive garden but get there early especially weekends or youll be waiting an hour. The hotel is in a superb location for getting to disney parks, downtown disney, universal ( straight up turkey lake road where theres also a walmart) and sea world whilst you dont need to go on the I4. Friendly helpful staff. Free drinks and nibbles Mon -Thurs nights and yuo can take these and brekkie into your rooms if you want. Overall I would recommend the hotel especially for families but make sure you get a quiet room not next to a plant rooms and above ground floor level - and hire a car i was apprehensive about driving in usa but its rather enjoyable with 2 three lanes everywhere and those u turns!

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: carolina333
Reviews.Content: I booked Hawthorn Suites after reading the positive reviews here and we're glad we did. Our family of three enjoyed the extra space with a kitchen/living room and bedroom. After a day in crowded Disney, it was nice to have room to move around. The staff was friendly and the rooms were very quiet. The breakfast was nice (good oatmeal) as was the reception (beer, wine, soda and popcorn and pretzels the one night we made it). Our teenage son liked the pool, hot tub and basketball court. There's a good Indian restaurant across the street, where we got take-out. I'd definitely recommend this hotel and would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great hotel but fix the bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: Pippy437
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel late at around 9 pm and the front desk guy knew who we were since we were the last to check-in. I suggest getting a room on the bottom floor close to the lobby so that you do not have to walk far to the breakfast area or to your room after a long day at the parks. Luckily, our rooms were on the bottom floor with close access to everything, such as our car. My party had two rooms and both rooms were ready and clean when we arrived. I will list the pros and few cons of our stay at the Hawthorne suites. PROS- Room: The fridge and kitchen were a plus even though all we did was stock up on drinks and snacks. My mother in the other room actually used the kitchen to cook and had no problems. Just as others have pointed out, the beds are extremely soft and feel absolutely heavenly. Room service was always done well and there was plenty of room. Lastly, internet service was complimentary in the rooms and the connection was perfect. Breakfast: I stayed for a week and waited for bacon to be served (other reviewers stated they served it) but they never did. The only hot items alternated were scrambled eggs, sausage, and corned beef. In addition, some days waffles and english muffins were served with toast offered everyday. Cereal and fruits were offered everyday. We ate the breakfast everyday because even though it was not high quality food it was free and you can't complain about something free. Cereal and bread taste the same no matter where you go anyways. If you still crave something more delicious, a Denny's, Ihop and Waffle House are close by. Location: The location was perfect for us since we had a car. I highly suggest renting a car to get to the parks and not using the shuttle, which I overheard some guests complaining about. The shuttle will take a long time to get to and from the parks and you are also restricted to few pick-up times. We got a great deal on a car (about $130 with taxes and fees for the week) and great deals can be found on the internet. Also, if you plan on going to Universal then having a car would definitely be more cost-efficient since the hotel does not offer a free shuttle for that park. There are plenty of restaurants within a couple of blocks of the hotel, close access to I-4 with Disneyworld about 5-15 minutes away depending on which park you are going to. A Wal-mart which we frequented was also about 5 minutes away by car. Since the parks close early, I suggest eating breakfast at the hotel, lunch at the park, and dinner out of the park to save money. CONS- Bathroom: The bathroom is in need of a renovation. The shower curtain was not large enough to block the the water from spilling onto the floor. The toilet seat was cracked and chipped and the shower smelled of sulfur. Lastly, some of the towels had stains or were thinned out. Once the bathroom is revamped the hotel room would be perfect. It would be an added plus if the hotel could keep up with other properties and replace the televisions with LCD TV's. OTHER TIPS/COMMENTS: Before my trip, I did extensive planning and found the book, "Unofficial Guide to Disney World" to be quite helpful. I suggest using the touring plans the book offers to minimize waits in lines (we never waited long in lines!). Also, if renting a car I suggest either bringing your GPS or renting one from the car company. I also want to emphasize that the hotel is not too close to restaurants or stores in terms of walking distance and is somewhat isolated from heavy traffic. On the other hand, if driving then everything is just a couple of minutes away and very close by. The front desk also prints out boarding passes which helped a great deal when checking out. OVERALL: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at Hawthorne Suites mostly due to the fact that the beds were heavenly, free breakfast was convenient, great service throughout the hotel and convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: teetersonheels
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 weeks at the Hawthorn Suites in March. While we were there it was my mum's 73rd Birthday. Before travelling I phoned the hotel on the off chance they could get me a Birthday cake - It was there, on the table in the room when we arrived, and it was beautiful!!! I was travelling with a teenage son, and my mum (now 73), so we appreciated the space in the rooms at the Hawthorn Suites - didn't fancy spending 2 weeks with just a bedroom between us. The suite was great. Very clean, and spacious. All the reception staff were very helpful, and answered all our queries. Palm Parkway is a 10min stroll away, with lots of choice for eating out. As others have recommended; Uno's, Olive Garden, TGI Fridays, plus lots more depending on your taste. We also went to Cici's buffet restaurant, which for $8 each lets you eat as much pizza & salad as you could possibly want, with dessert thrown in. I chose not to hire a car (my mum is the worst passenger in the world here at home, so on holiday it would've been a nightmare!!) We used the shuttle bus from the hotel, which was always on time, sometimes we caught the shuttle back, or caught a cab back to the hotel. We didn't spent a lot less than the insurance package & parking fees in getting around. I know it was a little inconvenient, but to anyone wondering, you can definately get around without having a car. The free breakfast was a plus. Fresh fruit, cereal, muffins, waffles, bagels and something hot (sausage, scrambled eggs) Previous reviews have commented that the breakfast is a bit repetitive - I must be a bit predictable, I tend to have the same thing for breakfast everyday at home, and appreciated the choice available - and it's free!!!! Overall we had a great time, and have already booked for next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: rucohil
Reviews.Content: after months of searching for a hotel in LBV. we decided on the hawthorn suites as it was getting all good reviews. we have just come back from here and the hotel is superb , very clean the rooms are lovely, staff very friendly. breakfast good. pool isnt too small, there was only ever a few people around the pool which is open from 9am-11pm.complimentary drinks mon-thurs5.30-7.30pm was great and wednesday was beans and hotdogs. free shuttle takes you to epcot where you have to get another shuttle to the other disney parks. you can stay on the shuttle at epcot to take you to universal studios this is free for virgin customers also there was a shuttle bus taking you to seaworld but we only found this out on the last day so not got more information. lots of places to eat near the hotel. totally recomend pizzerio unos. do not go to ponderosa on i-drive the food is awful.it takes about 40mins to walk to downtown disney. we also went to pirates dinner adventure which isnt very good. and went on the miami and everglades tour which was very rushed and spent a lot of ur day on the coach as 1 day isnt enough to see everything.also apparently kennedy space centre is shuting down next year. i dont think there is a fussier person than me but this hotel is great and totally recomend it .would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: SmurfUk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two fabulous weeks at the Hawthorn Suites Lake Buena Vista. We cannot fault this excellent value for money hotel. The staff were very polite throughout our stay and were happy to help with any request. The rooms were clean, comfortable and ideal for getting a good nights sleep after a hectic day at the theme parks. The hotel is in an ideal location to get to all the big theme parks with ease (Disney 10-15 minutes drive time depending on which park & Universal around 20 minutes). We agree that it is probably best to hire a car to get around, simply for the convenience of coming and going at your own leisure, but there are two regular free shuttles back and forth to Disney (Epcot) daily from the hotel and you can take a shuttle to Universal for an additional $10 per person. We would thoroughly recommend The Olive Garden (Italian Restaurant) just down the road on Palm Parkway, if you want a good quality and affordable restaurant to unwind in on your first night in Lake Buena Vista. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely return to the Hawthorn Suites Lake Buena Vista when in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Price & Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: RF2009
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 5 night stay at this Hawthorn Suites. It was the first time we have stayed at a Hawthorn Suites and was very pleased with our experience. We were really impressed with the convenient location, general cleanliness and overall value of this hotel. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and provided good directions and great recommendations for local restaurants. The staff also freely volunteered to print our boarding passes for our return flight. We will stay again at this hotel on our next visit to Lake Buena Vista.

Reviews.Title: “VERY comforatable bed!”
Reviews.Author: Been_there034
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We were pleasantly surprised to find that the kitchenette in our suite featured a standard size refridgerator and a dishwasher. The rooms were clean and spacious. There was a large closet in the bedroom as well as a second T.V. And I cannot neglect to mention that this was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in away from home! The location of this hotel is great for both DisneyWorld and Universal studios. We enjoyed the breakfast two of the four days we were there. We found the staff to be pleasant and friendly and overall our stay was comfortable, quiet and very well worth what we paid to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfortable lodging in an excellent location.....”
Reviews.Author: Larson-7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this facility for 5 nights and found it to be excellent on all basis. The rooms and grounds were well maintained. Proximity to Disney ,Orlando and all area attractions is very convenient with lots of restaurant and shopping choices nearby. The staff was friendly and the breakfast was varied daily and much appreciated for a quick start to the day. The Monday - Thursday wine / beer and snacks were also a nice touch at the end of a tiring day followed by a nearby dinner and back to a very comfortable bed and room. We would recommend this location to any traveller and would definitely stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for a orlando stay is here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Short
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HSLBV for 8 nights before our cruise, We have been to orlando 5 times before & stayed in all types of hotels. (Disney hotels, on International drive ect & the last 2 times a house) but for all round value & ease this place can not be beaten! The rooms are large & space for all of your luggage & shopping you will do there is easy! The beds are just so mmmmmmm slept like a baby from the 1st night to the last night, the rooms are cleaned daily & the staff are really nice & helpful. When we checked in it was late but Mike the night manager got us to a room in next to no time even asking which floor would you like & telling us to take the car round to the rear door to save the luggage trips! (Thanks Mike). And the FREE WI-FI was a godsend! The breakfast was not really our cup of tea so to speak but with 3 ponderosa`s close by who cares! We will stay here again without doult

Reviews.Title: “Terrific experience and value.”
Reviews.Author: daisyhenrymom
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of HSLBV yesterday: Great rooms and fine common areas. The beds & linens are top quality. Plenty of room for all our stuff. The maids were excellent, the desk and breakfast room staff friendly and responsive. Breakfast offerings were sufficient...not a fine dining experience, but hey, it's included with the room. (We're presently staying in a "higher end" hotel at twice the price and about 1/2 the quality & space - and the breakfast is $13.95/day!) Oh, and the rooms were totally quiet. Didn't hear a sound from other rooms even though they were filled with families. Location is terrific; close to all the WDW, Universal, Sea World parks. Only negative is that the pool furniture is getting a little worn. D & J, Woodinville WA

Reviews.Title: “Needs no improvement”
Reviews.Author: tampabobl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just two nights but I wish it could have been longer. Probably the most friendly staff I have encountered at a hotel. Room was clean and adequate size. Breakfast was a cut above the usual stuff one finds in a hotel. Free wireless internet in the room. A great stay, nothing to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: mfrank13
Reviews.Content: We spent WAY too much time researching Disney area hotels, and finally ended up at the Hawthorne, and it turned out to be a good choice. We booked on Travelocity for $70 a night, so for 4 nights, we paid only a bit more than we paid for ONE night at the (gorgeous) Wilderness Lodge last year. What the Hawthorne lacked in pizazz, it made up for in value. Pros: - Very clean, although a bit worn in spots (our room had a hole in the chair upholstery, hole in the carpet, and a hole in one of the towels) - Quiet (located on a pleasant, quiet side street off the main highway) - Roomy. The suite was perfect for our family of four, plus two grandparents who stayed on the (very uncomfortable) sofa bed one night. - The main beds were amazingly comfortable - Internet access was free (not sure why other reviewers had to pay - we accessed free WiFi from our room) - Very close to Downtown Disney, and an easy, pleasant drive to Sea World. Not too far (by car) from Disney parks... the drive to Magic Kingdom took us about 15 minutes. Cons: - The pool is very small - more like a private home pool. - The breakfast was underwhelming - after three days, I was pretty tired of orange wedges, toast and eggs. - You pretty much have to have a car. We didn't try to take the hotel shuttle, but I never saw one while I was there, so I doubt they come very frequently - While the hotel itself was quiet, the plumbing was ridiculously loud. Our first night, we were woken 3 times by neighbors showering. Not sure if that was just our room/wing (room 202), or the whole hotel, but we were pretty peeved with that. Overall, for $70 a night, a good choice for a family on a budget, with a car, looking to visit various Orlando attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: KirstyWS12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hawthorne Suites for 2 weeks in November. The hotel was clean and comfortable, the rooms were brilliant with comfy beds, 2 TV's and should you want to use them, all the self catering kitchen facilities you could wish for. The Managers evening reception was a nice touch - we had expected something more substantial than popcorn and crisps after staying at another hotel which offered a similar service, however once we got used to the fact that no more food was on offer - that was your lot, we soon got used to it. The drinks were also a nice touch and the breakfast was adequate although not much variety. Sizzler offered a more substantial breakfast for the occasional change. The pool area with the hot tub were very clean and quiet - we spent a lot of time here deciding on the days activites. The staff were all friendly and helpfull. The only area I was a touch disappointed with was having to pay for the internet access - we ended up not using it at all. But saying that though, we didn't go on holiday to sit on the internet so that's only a minor point. Anyway that's enough from me, overall we had a brilliant stay at this great and well priced hotel - if we return to Florida, we will definately be staying at the Hawthorne Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Room”
Reviews.Author: bobmk
Reviews.Content: We arrive at the hotel on Fri afternoon and the entrance and lobby were very clean and then we went up to the room and open the door to this spacious suite. We recommend to everyone to stay here

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for your Orlando stay - home from home”
Reviews.Author: WanderingClown
Reviews.Content: We've been to Orlando a few times before, and stayed in Disney hotels, however we wanted something a little different this time. With our daughter being 8 and wanting to do everything possible - Universal, Disney etc - me wanting to cram as much into 17 days as I could, and my wife putting up with both of us the ideal hotel was somewhere that we could use as base camp. We didn't want to be immersed in Disney 100% of the time, nor did we want to be sat on a bed in a hotel room on the days and nights when we needed to rest. Next time we'll probably get a villa as friends will be joining us, but this time we wanted exactly what the Hawthorne Suites promised in the brochure and on the website. I'm glad to say that everything we expected from the suites we got. The hotel is easily found in your rental car from the airport (Brit Tip - I took my Tom Tom and downloaded the Florida maps from the Tom Tom website before I went - I think it cost £19 but it's cheaper than hiring a Sat Nav over there and it was priceless!). There is ample free parking around the hotel, we went in peak season and there were always loads of parking spaces available. The location of the hotel, on Palm Parkway, really couldn't be better. We can recommend Olive Garden and Giordano's for eat-in Italian and we enjoyed the Flippers pizzas (which we had delivered to the hotel room on a couple of occasions - NB the hotel encourages you to order take-out delivered to your suite). There are a few supermarkets to choose from within a minute or two in the car, aswell as pharmacies. And the parks are all 10-15 minutes in the car - just enough time to get organised and get excited about each day you had ahead of you. Basically, we always felt that the hotel was in touching distance of everything we could ever need to make our holiday perfect. On arrival, check-in was fuss-free, and the staff were always smiling and attentive. Our suite on the 5th floor was possibly the furthest away from the reception but was still close - sometimes hotels can be so huge you feel out of it, but this was still close. The room was a great size, with separate bedroom, bathroom, vanity room and lounge/kitchen area. It couldn't be described as luxurious, probably functional, but that's what we were looking for. Although we are only a family of three, we each needed our own space to relax and with two televisions, bed, chair, sofa and dining table we could all do our own thing without getting in each other's faces. Lots of plug sockets allowed us to keep everything charged, and the tables allowed us to spread all out things out so we never felt anxious about all the clutter we were accumulating. Everything in the room worked (kitchen, bathroom, free wireless internet access) and it was always kept clean by the staff. Towels were changed as often as we requested. Hard to put into words, but on a holiday like this it's so important to have somewhere as welcoming, comfortable and spacious as this to prepare you for all the fun you're trying to fit in. The free breakfast was perfect for us. One of us went down each morning and grabbed coffees, juices and whatever was on offer (sausages,pancakes, eggs, bacon, waffles) and brought them back to the room. Each day it meant that we had already had our first coffee of the day and enough sustenance to keep us going until late morning when we could get an early lunch - thus missing the lunchtime crowds. Only once did we take advantage of the free beer and food. The small games room was handy, and the pool area was small (although we'd have gone to Spain if we wanted a pool/sun holiday) so if your kids want a big fun pool this is not the place to be. Bear in mind that you've got Wet & Wild, Aquatica and the 2 Disney waterparks to satisfy those needs! The problem when planning a trip to Orlando - especially when coming across from the UK - is that there are so many things to do and it's the kind of holiday most people only do once a year or once every 2 or three years. One hotel or suite can't cover all bases. Last time we stayed at the Polynesian, and the AKL. Next time we may be with friends and rent a villa. Depending on the kind of holiday you want and the ages of the people in your family you'll choose different hotels/villas to suit. If you're looking for a good solid foundation for your trip, and want space, ideal location for the parks, restaurants and shops, friendly staff and somewhere to unwind then choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive for price!!!”
Reviews.Author: samsab8
Reviews.Content: I will definately visit here again when staying in Orlando!! The rooms were clean and quite large with seperate living room/kitchen area and bedroom. Staff was very nice. Only 3 blocks from Disney entrance by Interstate 4 so easy to get to Disney. Why stay on Hotel plaza Blvd. {and pay resort fee because it is technically on Disney property} when plenty of excellent properties such as this on Palm Parkway only 3 blocks away!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great place will see you again real soon.”
Reviews.Author: ForestOfDeanNigel
Reviews.Content: From gloucester england .This hotel is great returned home yesterday from a week at this great place but next year we will spend two weeks.me my wife and our 6 year daughters first trip to america we only did the disney parks and we had free shuttle buses to (epcot DISNEY MAIN BUS STOP )3 times a day there and back .Very clean hotel with great staff which work so hard clean towels everyday, room cleaned everyday and all so happy to help.free breakfast everyday as much as you can eat, nearly the same everyday but always fresh food but its free. even had free phone call to take away food and brought direct to hotel room. swimming pool and hot spa was great pool a little small but very clean and lots of sunbeds .we past a lot of hotels on our travels in orlando ours looked one of the best .we are a bit fussy but no problems here well done to the hawthorns lake buena vista and we will see you next year .

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: TheBigFiveO
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two-week stay at the Hawthorn Suites as part of a Virgin Holidays package. We had stayed in LBV before, so knew the area but not this place. Initial impression was "oh my g*d!", the as the entrance hall had a traffic cone in the middle and the floor looked unsafe, but it turned out they were in the middle relaying the entrance hall and it was sorted a couple of days later. Check-in was efficient and pleasant and our suite was located on a high floor, just as we had asked. The suite consisted of the following: The door from the hallway accessed into the 'living room', in which there was a bed settee, separate armchair, good size TV (with games) and a couple of low tables. There was also a dining table with 4 chairs and an adequately stocked kitchen, complete with dishwasher (but no corkscrew!). The living room connected direclty to a bedroom with two king beds, with TV, phone and enough storage for two adults and a 6 year old. From the bedroom there was a door to a separate 'dressing area' with a wash basin, good size shelf, big mirror and a hair dryer. From the dressing area there was a door back into the living area and another to a bathroom, containing a low bath with a reasonable shower (water pressure was ok but could be better) and a WC. There is no safe deposit in the room, but there are free safe deposit boxes available at reception. Maid service was daily and sheets were changed every 2 days. In the communal area was a dining area where they served the free breakfast. This was a buffet providing cereals, fruit, various breads and a varied hot selection (eggs, bacon, corn beef hash etc.) over the course of the week. It was more than enough for us, although the lack of selection raised a few complaints (wot, no grits?) - but it was free and saved you having to go out and buy breakfast. There is no bar, but there was a 'Manager's happy hour' most evenings where there was free wine, beer and nibbles. They have a games room with a few arcade machines and internet access is available on 3 machines if required. They have a relatively small pool, but you don't go to Orlando to sit by the pool, and there was sufficient seating on the occasions we used it. They also have a hot tub - great to relax after a long day walking round the parks and I saw a basketball hoop as well. The staff were very courteous and on the couple of occaisions we asked for something, they were obliging and sorted us out quickly. As regards location, it is located on Palm Parkway, which is relatively quiet, when compared to I-Drive, but there are plenty of good value family friendly restaurants close by - Olive Garden, Perkins, Black Angus Steakhouse, Giordanos, CiCi's - most of which are in walking distance if you fancy a 10/15 minute stroll. There is plenty of shopping and the discount shops are not far away. One huge benefit, when compared to I-Drive, is proximity to Disney. Downtown Disney and Typhoon Lagoon are less than 10 minutes drive and the Magic Kingdom only 15/20 minutes away. In summary, whilst this hotel would not be to everyones tastes, I would certainly revisit next time we hit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Swed_Trav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights to visit WDW and Kennedy Space center. The rooms are spacious and the beds are very good. A reasonable good breakfast, without any extras was included. The hotel is one of the smaller in the area, which makes it less noisy and crowded. It also makes it easy for the kids to just run to the pool for a quick swim. The location is close to perfect: Close to WDW and Downtown Disney, but still away from the noisy and crowed International drive. The pool is quite small, but on the other hand it is very calm and there is also a jacuzzi, so it is perfect for a relaxed hour or two after a team park. Part of the staff is friendly, but part of the staff is rather unfriendly, so you have to choose when to request any help. As a tourist you do not want to be told that you are stupid because you do not know to make long distance call at the hotel (Apparently it is obvious that you must call the reception first, then wait 15 min, and then dial then number!) All in all the stay was nice. We might return again, if we get a good deal. On the other hand: There are plenty of hotel in the areas, and we might as well try if some of the other have a more friendly staff and a more extensive breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Was very pleased with all it had to offer!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lutzy_8
Reviews.Content: My sister and I attended a wedding in Orlando. We stayed at the Hawthorn Suites in Lake Buena Vista. Our room was more than we expected. It had all the ammentities we needed. It was clean and we received excellent custormer care from all the employees. The pool and hot tub was a great way for us to unwind. We will surely revisit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “liked it”
Reviews.Author: cuttsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1 bed apartment and paid $80 a night, which i thought was a great price for what you get. The bedroom was huge with large flat screen tv, the same in the lounge with adequate size kitchen. Breakfast was fine and the nghts that you get free drinks and nibbles was a really good idea. Coffee is replenished every day in the apartment and clean towels provided if needed. Quite a few restaurants to chose in walking distance which was good for a night out without having to drive :) Nice pool area although we never used it as only there for 5 days and spent that at the parks and wet and wild.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: NUGGYFL
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for the money. It was very easy to access and within minutes of the attractions. I especially liked the closeness to Disney Village. It was clean and staff were polite. Suites were compact. If travelling with more than 4 would be cramped. Buffet breakfast was delightful. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Hawthorn”
Reviews.Author: Floridashirl
Reviews.Content: Recently spent eleven nights at the Hawthorn Suite, LBV. and enjoyed every one. The suites are spacious, they are identical to each other apart from some being the mirror image with regard to layout. We had three suites because we wanted space for each couple but for anyone on a budget you couple easily fit 6 people into a suite, it would be a bit difficult with regard to the wc and bath but do-able. I liked the fact that the vanity area could be shut off from the bathroom and bedroom. There is a well equiped kitchen with a large fridge, dining area and a sofa bed and easy chair in the lounge area. TV's in both rooms, Iron and ironing board (NOT used by me). We stayed in suites 505. 507 and 509, we knew this to be a non smoking hotel but on entering our room (505) we all noticed a stale smokey smell that wasn't noticable in the other suites . The suites were cleaned daily and replenished with clean towels, soap, shampoo etc but it did get a bit late some days before this happened. We didn't go to the parks everyday and so wanted to be able to use our room to change to go swimming in the pool but sometimes housekeeping hadn't refreshed the room by 4pm. All very un-impoortant in the grand scheme of things but a little annoying when you are on holiday. My main gripe had to be that the pool gates remained locked until 9am, I like to get up early and sit by the pool in the early sunshine to read my book until my hubby gets up but the only place to do that was out in front of the lobby which also attracted the smokers. I know I have moaned a lot about little things but on the whole it is a nice hotel. The staff are friendly and very helpful and I would consider returning if they unlocked the pool earlier. The hotel is well located for Disney and its not that far to Universal either. Premium Outlets is not that far away for some great shopping too. We ate at the Black Angus Steakhouse just up the road on a couple of occasions and also at Uno's and Denny's and had good meals and service at them all. We look forward to returning next year as long as the pool gate is unlocked.

Reviews.Title: “A great off-Disney-property alternative”
Reviews.Author: Joselle
Reviews.Content: GENERAL: We were pleasantly surprised at the spaciousness of the room. It's wonderful when traveling with young children (7 & 5) to be able to put them to sleep in a separate room. There is a TV in both the bedroom and living room, a table to eat meals at, and a full kitchen. Only thing lacking was an oven, and really, who needs that on a vacation? The rooms were modestly decorated, but clean. The separated bathroom area was really great (tub/toilet in one room, sink and vanity in another area. Also, there's a little stool to sit on at the vanity area.) The pool area was modest, but decent; it was never crowded when we were there. Pool towels were a little joke between my husband and I - more like a hand-towel. We needed two of them to dry ourselves off. ;-) The jacuzzi is nice and hot, and was great on the one rainy day we experienced! Overall, from making reservations to checking in we were met with pleasant staff. The housekeeper did a great job, and would always arrange my kids "lovies" (stuffed animals) in funny ways on the beds. LOCATION: The location is great! You're just a few minutes from Downtown Disney, a couple blocks from Winn Dixie grocery store (good chicken to go!), and many restaurants (Bahama Breeze, Macaroni Grill, fast food, Carving Station, Asian, etc.) There's a mini gulf place among all the restaurants down the road, and a hop/skip/and jump from Hwy 4. AVOID THE SOVIENIER shops along the main drag! The stuff there is way overpriced - no bargain at all - you might as well buy the stuff at Disney. The Walmart has a small Disney area and we got a couple things there cheaper than anywhere else (take Hwy 4 East to get to the Walmart. It'll be on the left hand side of the hwy near one of the International drive exits.) CONS / AND A WORD ABOUT THE BREAKFAST: Only thing I didn't care for was the "full, hot American, breakfast buffet" (quote off of Hawthorn Suites own website). On Sunday, the breakfast was none-too-tasty scrambled eggs (powdered eggs maybe?), brown & serve sausage links, canned fruit, English muffins, packaged waffles, cereal, juice, milk and sludge coffee (this was the best day for breakfast; it just went downhill from here.) The second day of our stay, the breakfast was plain runny oatmeal, hard boiled eggs, brown & serve sausage links, fruit, bagels, cereal, juice, milk and coffee. Are you kidding me?! I hardly call that a "full hot American breakfast". Another day they served sausage gravy and biscuits and my husband couldn't eat more than one bite (maybe I've spoiled him with my own cooking, but he said it tasted like it was made with liverwurst, which is generally a clue that very cheap sausage was used.) Anyway, my suggestion if you're comparing this hotel to others is to not take the breakfast included here into your decision making process. The food isn't that great, and you'll likely end up buying a box of donuts or cereal at the Winn Dixie a few blocks down the road like we did, and just hit the "buffet" up for juice, milk, and a plain bagel. Other than the disappointing breakfast, we were pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Suitesfor3
Reviews.Content: I worked with Marriott for 20 years and after leaving 4 years ago we started to stay at Embassy Suites. Our family (13 yr old son) typically stays at Hilton and Marriott family hotels and we were pleasantly pleased. We take 3 vacations a year and with the price of Disney we decided to look for a better hotel price. It has been 6 years since visiting Orlando and we knew that much has probably changed. The hotel looked very nice on the outside and the lobby was impressive for being a value hotel. The staff was very pleasant and accommodating to all our needs. The rooms are clean and a good size with a separate living room that includes a kitchen/dining area. The full size frig was a nice change from a dorm size. The pool was small and the walls needed be cleaned better. The plumbing was very loud when the shower is turned on so light sleepers will wake up. The location is right around the corner from the Embassy Suites we stayed at before which is good but it ½ mile from Disney property not the parks. You are about 5 miles from Magic Kingdom and a couple of miles from downtown Disney. You are down the street from Wal-Mart and Universal Studios. The only drawback is that there aren’t many restaurants in the area for walking or short driving. The breakfast is OK if cold cereal, rotation of mini store donuts-bagels-English muffins-frozen waffles, toast and rotation of hard boiled eggs & pre-fab eggs along with canned fruit and rotation of apples-oranges-bananas, then this would be good for you. I would suggest going out for breakfast if you eat a big meal. I was not expecting much for the price of our room but other value hotels offer better food at breakfast including the airport Hawthorne Suites which we stayed at for 1 night. They offer a manager reception similar to Embassy as they said on Mon - Thurs 5.30 p.m. - 7.30 p.m. The only problem is that they only offer free beer and wine (out of a box) and soda along with chips. On Wednesday they did offer burgers but we didn’t have them since they were not appealing and there was nothing to go with them. Again the airport hotel offers a full bar with limited selection of hard liquor. We had booked another hotel for 3 nights (Comfort Suites in Kissimmee) and after driving up to that hotel, we decided to call Hawthorne back to see if they had any rooms. The Lake Buena Vista location didn’t have any rooms for that night but they booked us at the airport location and then back to them the following nights. We were extremely pleased with their level of customer service. When it was time to leave we needed to print SWA tickets and they have a room with computers available to print for free. Bottom line, this was a great visit and we will be staying at this hotel in the future and other Hawthorne Suites. We can live without the breakfast or managers reception because we saved about $60 a night and we can buy a lot for that. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Free Upgrade and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: mhitchco
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here one night. We checked in before going to Universal Studios Halloween Horror Nights. The guy at the front desk, Mike, was very friendly. We only booked a standard room, but we got an upgrade for free! The room was great; there was a kitchen, living room, big split bathroom, and a huge bedroom. The bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept on. So much so that when my wife and I went looking for a new bed we called the hotel to see what kind of bed it was. We were able to get a late checkout, which was great because we didn't get to bed till late. There was free breakfast in the morning. The location was good and the staff gave great directions. All around a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: axelLincs
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great holiday in Orlando, our stay at The Hawthorne Suites in LBV was just great. The staff and management are helpfull and friendly, the rooms are clean and well equipped. We had two teenage children with us and they felt very much at home, nice pool, small games room and very laid back friendly approach. It was located close to disney with a shuttle bus three times daily each way not to expensive for taxis to Downtown Disney at night, approx $9. Plenty of eating places an shops within walking distance. Cicis Pizza House $5.99 all you can eat salad,pizza,soup,dessert very good value. Dennys good variety of food good value and many more steak houses, chinese etc. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GOING DOWN HILL”
Reviews.Author: traveloldies
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a trip to Disney World, and stayed at the Hawthorn Suites Lake Buena Vista, Florida. We have stayed here ever since it was built, and we found that it is going down hill fast!!!, When we entered the room, we found M&M candy on the floor, the floor in the bathroom was dirty,(dirt bulit up in the corners) the carpets are so dirty that my white socks were black when i removed them that night, the sofa is torn and dirty. The staff at the front desk are just great, Mike was off, i know if i had gone to him it would have been better. The happy hour on thu. was a laugh, the beer was flat, and warm. Not much to eat!!!! Morning breakfast had cold hard boiled eggs and sausage. What is going on at this beautiful hotel??? They need to clean up this place and get it back to my "A" plus rating.

Reviews.Title: “what a great place”
Reviews.Author: stemufc
Reviews.Content: just came back from orlando and we stayed here at the hawthorn suites and we found this hotel very good, the pool was just about the right size because most of the time other guest are out of grounds most of the day and that left the pool virtually empty throughout the day,and the jacuzzi was very nice also. the rooms were very spacious with microwave,iron coffee maker,toaster,cooker and a fridge everything you need when you have had a hard day at the parks. the breakfast they suppl in the morning was great it was enough to start your day and fill your stomach's for a long day at the parks. they also have a social hour throughout the week monday to thursday were there is wine and beer on tap from 17:30 to 19:30 and on the wednesday evening they also treat you too either hot dogs or beefburgers,which we found great...the only thing that we had a problem with was the shuttle they provided to the parks was not very good so i wood recommend renting a car,we did after exprienceing the shuttle,but i would say you need your own car in this area because it is nice and quiet and you need the car to get around to restaurants,but their is retaurants just down the road walking distance from the hotel,,,dont go in the carving station it is terrible but that is another story,, but overall we will be coming back here as we loved it,,,the staff were great and very friendly and helpfull and there is a laundry room on level 2 which was also very usefull. what a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: K1000M
Reviews.Content: Rooms very spacious and clean with bedroom, bathroom, kitchen and living room. Pool area nice but small - didn't have any problems getting sunbeds. Set in a quite location about 10 minutes walk to nearest restaurants and shops. 5 minutes drive to Downtown Disney and 15 minutes drive to I-Drive. Breakfast consisted of a couple of hot things, toast, cereals, waffles and muffins - basic but more than ample. Staff very helpful - would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: easy_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quiet & out of the way of traffic. It is run very professional by a great staff, from the manager to the front desk personnel. The hotel is located near restaurants & Downtown Disney, The hot breakfest is great. The all suite hotel is clean & up to date. We stronly recommend this fine hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Family friendly property.”
Reviews.Author: HP134
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks doing Disney. Whole holiday booked via Virgin Holidays. Chose Hawthorn suites after many hours extensive review reading on this and other sites. Having now been I cannot believe any of the negative reviews. The whole experience was very good indeed, the only downer being Tropical Storm Fay which was hardly the fault of the hotel. If you read the reviews on this site the majority say the same thing and it's the majority that are right. Rooms are excellent - Fantastic size, extremely well stocked and very clean, with maid service and clean towels daily, whether needed or not. Free breakfast is a little limited but always sufficient choice, if a little repetitive. For a change try Shoney's appx half a mile away and Fantastic! Pool area and pool itself are quite small but are normally deserted so the small size not really an issue. I would confirm that a car whilst not essential, was definately worth while as downtown disney and seaworld, being the nearest attactions are probably 2 miles away. As had a car we didn't use the hotel shuttle service. I did speak to other guests about the shuttle and it didn't appear to be the best ever! There are plenty of good value places to eat nearby and for something a little better try the Olive Garden which was fab. When the tropical storm struck Orlando we were kept fully informed by the hotel who put on films in the evening for the children to help relieve the boredom of being confined to barracks during the storm. This was organised by the night manager Mike who along with the other staff was excellent. I didn't experience any dirty rooms, noisy plumbing or bad service that other reviews speak of and wouldn't hesitate in returning.

Reviews.Title: “space to chill”
Reviews.Author: theenglishmanabroad
Reviews.Content: stayed during may/june for 2 weeks. location was excellent close to both disney & universal . breakfast was changed each day with - cereal, eggs(of some description), toast, sausage or bacon, with either muffin or waffles, yoghurt or fruit. only made it once to the free wine/ beer evenings but it was constantly re-filled. excellent value! reception staff could have been more friendly but who cares when you are just walking past! however the waiting on & maids could not have been more helpful. my son hurt his toe & the staff on breakfast duty rushed over with ice & sympathy. fantastic space in the room with the separate lounge area so adults could stay up at night without disturbing the kids & in the morning when 1 of my 3 children got up it didn't have to disturb the others much needed sleep. kitchen area had full size fridge, 2 hobs, microwave but no oven. walking distance to carvery, pizza, steakhouse & chinese. amazing holiday & would definately go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and friendly service - Ron & Don from UK”
Reviews.Author: jonesesCrosby
Reviews.Content: I have been lucky to visit Orlando 9 times and this is the only hotel I have been back to. I love the rooms as you have a seperate room from your bedroom that includes a kitchen/dining area with a lounge and TV. Your not going to do much cooking, but the fridge/freezer and microwave are useful. I don't know why anyone would complain about the breakfast, you have a selection of cereal, muffins, toast and hot breakfast along with fresh fruit. Also, hot and cold drinks are available. You also have from Mon - Thurs 5.30 p.m. - 7.30 p.m. free beer and wine. So after a hard day at the parks - what a great time to chill by the pool with a drink. I think it is a great location, more so if you have a car, as really easy to get to Universal, Sea World and Disney is just down the road. Don't worry if you haven't got a car, you are only 5 minutes walk away from plenty of restaurants and bars. As for the staff they all work hard and always have a smile on their face. Thanks especially to Bernard for getting me the UFC results on the internet and thanks to Mike for the basketball tips. Yes they also have a basketball court to work off some of those burgers and chips you eat in the parks. The pool is ideal, as it is just the right size for keeping an eye on your children whilst you can relax at the side. We have a 6 & 4 year old and because the hotel isn't massive they got to meet the same friends each day, I feel if you stay in a large hotel you are just a number and the staff don't get to remember you (so not the same personal service). I didn't really want to write a review as I didn't want a problem when trying to book next year, but I'll take my chance! I've stayed in 7 other hotels in the tourist area of Orlando and this one is the best by far - don't get the Hawthorn Suites LBV confused with the one by Sea World, as the Sea World one is okay but not nearly as nice. We will be back for a third year in a row next year! Jones's from UK

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION!!!”
Reviews.Author: CEEBYWorksopNotts
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our trip stayed between 23rd June to 3 July. The purpose of our visit wasnt really to do all the major theme parks on this occasion however the location of this hotel is fantastic and being at the top of Palm Parkway was out of the way from the huste and bustle although plenty of eateries close by our favourite being Olive Garden. Overall we enjoyed our stay here although we did a lot of travelling so was rarely there. The breakfast was adequate although a bit disorganised got busy people pushing in to use the toasters. The free drinks and snacks provided on some nights was a nice touch although we only made it on a couple of occasions. The suite itself was spotless and cleaned everyday. The bed linen and towels were not at all grubby but quite fresh and prestine, The rooms are perfect for families due to being quite spacious. The pool area is very small we sat round the pool on the first day and that was enough it was by no means quiet. Kids running and throwing themself into the water with no consideration for others adults just didnt seem to get any chance to use the pool which dissapointed me. The staff on reception were very attentive and helpful . We would return to this hotel again as its great value for money. I would recommend this hotel to anyone although if you like a day around the pool occassionally I would suggest that you got to an hotek with a larger pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Loud Plumbing”
Reviews.Author: mpg1063
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and nice. Great for families. A seperate bedroom. Nice pool. Very clean lobby. Breakfast was pretty good. Loved the fact that we had a kitchen and could drive to the winn dixie around the corner for food. Also a very short drive to disney. BUT it would have been nice to not have been awakened EVERY morning at 5 am by people above, next to below??? taking showers and turning on the bath room sink. The plumbing is so loud it knocks you out of bed. I find it hard to believe that no one else has noticed this.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: readbe4ugo
Reviews.Content: After a mix-up with the booking of the condo we were supposed to be renting we found ourselves with no accommodation. We know the Hawthorn Suites are good as we have stayed there before. We were still impressed - the suites are great, the beds have lovely bedding, spotlessly clean with immaculate linens and are very comfortable - a godsend. The breakfast in the morning was great, plenty to choose from and replenished immediately. This is a good hotel in a good location, we would certainly recommend it and would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “The Fab Hawthorn Suites LBV”
Reviews.Author: Andiscope
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Hawthorn Suites LBV and they were FAB. The rooms were really nice and big with plenty of room to move about and the option to cook your self if you want to. There was a nice big fridge to keep drinks cool also great if you need to keep medication refridgerated. The location of the hotel is excellent aprox 10 min walk to a local supermarket where you can buy everything - and i mean everything! It's also only 1/2hr walk to DownTown Disney which is good if your like me and don't drive as once here you can then use the Disney transportation system. The staff at the hotel were outstanding as they couldn't do enough for you, always very friendly no matter what time of day or night!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this family hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: soccermomOklahoma
Reviews.Content: First of all I want to say that I did alot of research before going to Orlando and spending the best vacation that we've ever had. We bought the Foder's Disney World book and visited TripAdvisor many times before we decided on a hotel. After much thought, my husband and I chose Hawthorn Suites Lake Buena Vista. We chose this hotel over staying on Disney property. (This was our first trip to WDW too.) We decided that having a suite, a hot breakfast and a good deal def. won over staying on Disney property. When we got there, we felt a little disappointed at how far the hotel seemed to Disney property. (We drove our own car.) After going to Disney the first day we realized that you can't walk to any of the theme parks so there's really no point in staying on Disney property anyway! Where ever you would stay, you either need to drive, take a shuttle or a monorail.
