After getting over that realization, we noticed how easy it was to hop on and off the highway to arrive at the Disney theme parks. Now, on to the hotel itself! The front desk people were absolutely fabulous! They were very helpful and enthusiastic about our staying with them. We got a suite on the 2nd floor of the hotel with 1 king size bed. We stayed here with a total of 5 people. My husband, myself, 7, 6 and a 3 year old. The girls shared the sleeper sofa and my 3 year old took turns sleeping with us and her sisters. The king size bed was delicious and so so comfortable. (Especially after walking ALL day at the parks!) The girls were comfortable in their sleeper sofa as well. We actually cooked lunches on the stove top. We would wake up early go eat our hot breakfast (which was great) then we would go off to the parks and return for lunch. The night we arrived we went to the local Winn-Dixie and bought a few things for lunches and snacks. The Winn-Dixie is within walking distance of the hotel but we drove there. It is about 1/2 mile behind the hotel. After lunch we generally we take a nap or a swim at the hotel pool. The pool itself is not anything grand, simply a hotel pool. After a swim we would go change and head out back to the theme parks. Our rooms were generally cleaned while we were at the pool or right before lunch. We stayed at this hotel for 5 days and we got a discount because of that by booking on the hotel web-site. (Under specials and packages) There are two things I didn't mention that weren't a big deal at all, but I feel I must mention in order to validate this review. These 2 things of course are the negatives! I didn't realize there was a laundry room on the second floor. I called down to the front desk were a young guy who I hadn't spoke to before answered. I asked if there was a laundry area in the hotel. He said "No." I asked if there was a laundromat somewhere around town. He said, "Look in the yellow pages." I said, "Um, there are no yellow pages here in the room. Do you have a place where I can get on the internet to look it up?" He says, "Yes we have a business center but we charge for getting on the internet. I guess I'll have to look it up for you and call you back." (Was this guy for real?!) Long story short...he never called back but it was ok because I mentioned the story to my husband who let me know that I obviously I could not see since the laundry room was clearly 2 doors away. hahaha Anyway, so he was the ONLY non-helpful person in the entire hotel. The second negative I had was that our toilet stopped up easily. We actually had to ask for a plunger. If you added too much toilet paper it seemed to want to overflow. Not a big deal, but alittle embarassing to have to ask for a plunger! Anyway, so all and all we had an excellent experience at this fabulously clean, comfortable and overall wonderful hotel! This is the perfect hotel for families wanting to save a little money, who have a car and are wanting to enjoy Disney in a beautiful and comfortable hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MrCelt
Reviews.Content: Booked through Virgin Holidays to this hotel, and must say that as an accomodation it was excellent. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite, which was very spacious, with 2 bathrooms and a small kitchen-ette. The maid came in each day, providing fresh towels when needed and also putting any extra glasses, etc into the dishwasher! The pool area was small, but rarely busy and we were able to get into the water or the hot tub whenever we wanted. Throughout our stay we found that all of the staff were helpful, with both enquiries about the accomodation and the Area in general. The breakfasts did have a limited choice, but there was always something there to get you ready for the day, with an ample supply of toat, cereal and coffee! The cooked items varied every couple of days, nothing earth shattering, but not bad to get you going. The area around the hotel was pretty quiet, as it is the last hotel on Palm Parkway, before the Floridian Wilderness begins. This is a prime location and I think that development will take place in the near future. There is already a massive new Hilton being built a little way up the road. The Hawthorn Suites is a small complex, on 5 floors, and on a busy morning they opened the conference room as an extra space for people to have breakfast. As a non-driving option, we found the amount of local eateries, etc a little limited, although there are a few places in the nearby "Buena Vista Shoppes", including Cici's, Dominos, Hooters and "The Carving Station", which had an excellent Buffet dinner and a nice outside bar (We spent pretty much every night here - great company and Karaoke!). The property is also further from Downtown Disney than advertised. The 1/2 mile is to the "Downtown Disney area", with the shops and attractions being a couple miles further down the road. The free shuttle buses from the hotel left a little to be desired. They did feel as if they were about to fall apart and never ran on time. With several other pick-ups, it usually took between 40 minutes and an hour to get to Epcot - its only drop off and pickup point in Disney. During our stay, we also visited Sea World, Discovery Cove and the Orlando Premium Outlets. These were all around $15 each way in the hotel's preferred carrier (Usually in a well decked out 4x4), otherwise it was about $10 each way in a checker cab, which we found to be a reliable way of getting around. Overall, an excellent choice for accomodation if you are looking for a quiet retreat from the parks, but you would probably be able to make more of the area if you have a car. I would have no problems about coming back here next time I'm heading to Florida!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: GMKISOK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at HSLBV for 5 nights last week and my family and I really enjoyed our stay. We were close to all attractions and dining and also used the courtesy shuttle to Epcot. The rooms were pretty spacious and clean. The free breakfast was nice - hot and cold buffet. During the week, the hotel also had a happy hour in the late afternoon with complimentary snacks and alcohol. Overall, I don't think you can beat the accommodations for the price. We used the Orlando Magicard when we booked and paid $99 per night. I would definately return to the Hawthorn Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: janey1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hawthorn Suites for 2 weeks in May 2008 after reading previous reviews on this site. This is the perfect place to base yourself if your looking to get the best that the Theme Parks have to offer. On arriving late after a flight delay we were really impressed by the look of the hotel. A relatively easy checkin although the one and only complaint I have was that there wasn't a crib waiting and we were told that they are provided on a first come first serve basis not great when you have a tired 10 month old!! This was eventually sorted and so the start to a great holiday. We had 2 x 2 bed appartments and were really impressed. The kitchen had a full size fridge, dishwasher (which house keeping put on nearly every day even when there wasn't much in the sink!), microwave, 2 ring cooker, coffee machine and all the basic utensils needed for a snack or meal. Bedrooms were lovely, beds really comfortable, 2 bathrooms and 3 tv's - one in every room! The air conditioners is a bit noicy but you do get use to it very quickly and its just was you need after a long day at the parks Breakfast included set you up for the day and included eggs (mostly scrambled) bacon or sausage, bread/bagels/waffles, cereal, fruit, juice, coffee and tea on tap. The managers reception Mon - Thurs 5.30 to 7.30 is an added bonus and lovely touch. We only managed it a couple of time but it included beer, wine and soft drinks and snacks. On a Wednesday there is hot food when we were there it was bread, burger and beans. Basic but lets face it they don't have to do it. Coffee available on tap 24 hours a day - in fact we used to fill up our pot rather than making it in our room The pool area is clean and you can always get a sunbed. Pool perfect for a dip and includes a jacuzzi and basket ball area if your feeling energetic. Or there is the gym room with treadmill and other equipment. Location is excellent for exploring all the parks and Lake Buena Vista and of course shops. Seaworld is 10 mins drive, Disney is 20 mins, Down town disney 10 mins drive, Orlando Premium Outlet 10 mins drive. In my view you do need a car but can walk to local shops and restaurants. About 10 mins walk and you'll find a selection including Olive Garden Italian (my fav - great take out), Black Angus Steak, Crab House, CiCi Pizza (what a bargain), Macaroni Grill, Chilli's the list goes on. Just watch out for the sprinklers in the evening along Palm Parkway a couple in our party got soaked!! Michael on reception recommended a lovely chinese who deliver to your door! They also have Papa Pizza who deliver. If your travelling with a baby the variety of baby food is limited. We tried Walmart, Walgreens and Goodings. Only when we found the local Winn Dixie 3 days before we came home which is 2 mins drive was there a wide selection. Too late for us but will save you giving the same thing day in day out - Beware of taking any products including baby food with pork product in ours was thrown away at imigration. Chicken is fine though Overall great place to stay and wouldn't hesitate to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent A++++”
Reviews.Author: mia0214
Reviews.Content: I just came from Orlando, I stayed at this Hawthorn Suites Lake Buena Vista for 3 nights. The location is the best, close to Disney and restaurants, and you can avoid I-4 by going on the Palm Parkway to get to Universal or the outlets at International Drive. The staff is very attentive and always looking to meet your needs.The Free Breakfast is a Big PLUS , eggs, sausage, bacon, waffles, pancake, bread, fruits, cereal, juice, coffee, etc. The rooms are big and well maintained the fridge has an ice maker, so you dont have to leave your room to find ice, the beds are very comfortables.The area is very quiet and secure. I just loved it and if i come back again to Orlando, i will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: emills
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with students. A school music trip. The staff was excellent, polite and helpful. The rooms are very very comfortable and large. A bedroom, kitchenette, dining, living room, and a bathroom. The bathroom is divided into two rooms. Tub & toilet, sink. Pool is fairly small but there is also a half basketball court. Walking distance to shops, market, and restaurants.Very convenient to Disney World and all of the other attractions. Many have said that the breakfast isn't that great but they have plenty of options and the price is right. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. A great stay. The chaperones and the students really liked the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hawthorn Suites - Definitely Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne77895
Reviews.Content: We changed our accommodation to the Hawthorn Suites only 3 weeks before departure from our original accommodation (Wynfield Inn) after reading the reviews of the Wynfield on this website. When we arrived at the Hawthorn we were really impressed. We arrived late in the evening and the staff were really helpful. The hotel was really clean and we were really impressed with the room. It was fantastic to have a separate living area to the bedrooms so my husband and I were able to chill out after our children had gone to bed without worrying about waking them up! The kitchen area was excellent - we had a dishwasher which was actually filled daily by the staff and put on while we were out and about at the parks. The staff also made little displays with our daughters' soft toys on the bed every day when they cleaned, which was just a lovely touch for them! The location was great - we were very close to all the disney parks and downtown disney and also were close to some great shops and restaurants. There was an amazing amount of different kinds of food within easy reach. We did have a hire car, but there was daily transfers from the hotel anyway. The pool area was very clean and there were towels provided. Even though the hotel was full for most of our stay, the pool area was never overcrowded - there were always sunloungers and only ever a few people in the pool. The breakfasts were also good - great choice which changed slightly on frequent occassions - cooked options and cold options available. Again, even though the hotel was full as it was Easter break we never had a problem finding a table and there was always plenty of food. I would definitely recommend this hotel - we will be returning here again in the future. Fantastic! So glad we changed the accommodation at the last minute - it was worth the extra money!

Reviews.Title: “great stay at the hawthorn suites”
Reviews.Author: matty15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hawthorn Suites, LBV for 2 weeks at Easter. We were really impressed with the hotel from the start. We received a great welcome from Mike Quick the Duty Manager and immediately felt comfortable. The rooms are excellent and very spacious and spotlessly clean. Even though the hotel was full during this busy holiday period, it never seemed crowded and it was never noisy. The breakfasts were adequate with a choice of hot food, cereals, bagels and bread for toast. Occasionally the selection was limited, but we never went hungry. The location of the hotel is just right, only a few minutes to Downtown Disney and just a few more to SeaWorld. It is also very conveniently placed for a good choice of restaurants and shops. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and we are already thinking of booking for next year.

Reviews.Title: “will be returning”
Reviews.Author: wanabee_yank
Reviews.Content: we have stayed in Lake Buena Vista 4 times over the past 5 years at various hotels ranging from the Palace to the Vistana and the Safari. We booked the Hawthorn as we wanted to be on Palm Parkway so that we were able to walk to restaurants/ bars and grocery stores. Also its proximity to both Disney parks and I-Drive for Universal is second to none. We were pleasantly suprised by the hotel. The welcome from staff in reception was lovely (especially after a long day travelling). We asked for top floor and got top floor. Room was more spacious than any of the above hotels suites that we have previously stayed in and very clean. Breakfast is basic but free (what do you expect) and the happy hour was a lovely starting point before going out to dinner. The pool is small but as you are staying in a fairly small hotel it was never crowded. We were there over the 2 week Easter break and there were always beds available. Considering we have stayed at some very high class hotels in terms of cost and sales pitch I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and look forward to staying there again next year. One last thing, if you go to Orlando hire a car do not rely on hotel transport as inevitably it will be busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Near Disney, no matter why you are visiting”
Reviews.Author: saxonkc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hawthorne Suites Lake Buena Vista from 3/28-3/31/08. This was our 3rd trip to Orlando in 6 months, and the 3rd different hotel we tried. I love staying on Palm Parkway because you are so close to Disney, and it is not hard to get anywhere else in the theme park district of Orlando. The hotel was very nice, definately more than I expected after my last two stays in the same area. We booked a King Suite, and wow, I could not belive the space we got for the money. The bathroom was rather large, which is nice when you have more than one person getting ready for the day at the same time. Our bed was very comfortable, room very clean and it is really nice to have a full size fridge, dishwasher, microwave and all the dishes and utensils needed to make a quick meal. A decent breakfast is availible each morning. There are always some sort of eggs, meat and either pancakes or waffles, bagels, toast and lots of fruit and cereal choices. We happend to be staying the same time as a high school marching band, that would be the only downside, but that is not the hotels fault. But the staff was very attentive to us and constantly asked how everything was....even called 30 min after we got to our room to make sure everything was fine. Oh, and wireless internet is not free in your room.....but I dont think there is a hotel in this area of orlando that doesnt charge for it. Otherwise, it is a great family place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, would definitly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Becks1234
Reviews.Content: Really loved the hotel, the rooms are large, and for 2 people we had so much room. The beds are really comfortable and we had a great nights sleep every night. The separate kitchen, lounge area and dressing room areas were brilliant. The hotel staff were always very polite and helpful and a bonus monday-thursday was free lager/wine and snacks betweeen 5.3- & 7.30. The only slight problem was the transport to Univeral which took over an hour as the bus went via Disney first but it was a disney area hotel so this was to be expected. All is all a great hotel which I would definately recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great place and location”
Reviews.Author: clsbend
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my husband and I have stayed here, and we obviously like it. The location is great. From Palm Parkway, you can get to Disney sites and places like Sea World, etc. without having to negotiate the International Drive mess. Also an easy on/off to I-4. The staff is superb about giving directions. The hotel also is a short drive to a small restaurant area, where you can eat at a crab shack, pizza place, Japanese restaurant, Hooters, etc. There's also a small grocery there. Our rooms were clean and comfortable, with the advantage of a separate bedroom, so one person can read or watch TV in the main room while the other sleeps in the bedroom. Or you can both watch TV in different rooms. The breakfast isn't fabulous, but it is certainly OK. I'd eat either yogurt or oatmeal while my husband stuck to eggs and bacon or sausage. They also have cereal, fruit, bread for toast, etc. Plenty to fill up on. We didn't do the Happy Hour stuff, so I can't report on that. Next time we're in Orlando, we'll definitely stay here again. Friendly, helpful staff, nice room, good location. A real winner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet area!”
Reviews.Author: Nana.lisa
Reviews.Content: After researching the reviews, we found the Hawthorn Suites to meet and exceed our expectations. The best part was how clean the rooms were! I've never stayed in a hotel as clean as this one. My pet peeve is hair in the bathrooms! Every day there did not appear to be any left, after the thorough cleaning job. I commend the housekeeping staff and made sure I let them know. The downside, which isn't really a big deal to us, was the kind of boring breakfast. Pretty much the same everyday. And the front desk always seemed to be understaffed. They got our reservation wrong even after confirming the week prior. But all was taken care of as soon as we arrived by the manager. Other than that things were great! Can't beat Palm Pkwy. local, it's the best out of the way place. We've stayed in this area some years prior. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: SueDouglas
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Hawthorn Suites in Lake Buena Vista. Would highly recommend for value and quality of accomodation. Free breakfast and happy hour a great bonus. Beds to die for!! Would probably not stay here without a car, although Theme Park Shuttles advertised they are not very frequent. Great staff, nothing too much trouble. We stayed at the back of the building and never heard any noise at all, great after a really busy day at the Theme Parks. Only slight complaint rooms were not serviced until 4pm some days, however this would not stop me recommending or returning to this comfortable and clean establishment.

Reviews.Title: “We Want To Go Back To Hawthorn Suites”
Reviews.Author: EJP2902
Reviews.Content: My family and I (6 of us in total, 4 adults, 2 children) enjoyed two wonderful weeks at this fantastic hotel. The staff were extremely helpful when we suffered a problem with our booking, due to a mistake by the travel agent, but they provided us with an extra room until we could contact the travel agent the following day to sort it out. The night manager, Michael Quick, who happened to be on duty the night we checked in and helped us resolve the problem with our room, was an absolute diamond. I don't think our stay would have been as enjoyable if it wasn't for his wit, charm, superb service and total dedication to his job - he was an absolute star and we looked forward to seeing his smiling face after a long day trawling around the parks! The accommodation was second to none. The two-bedroomed suite we had booked was huge, which completely surprised my sister, who had stayed at a Disney Hotel last year and was not expecting the room to be so big after her experience. We were very impressed with the two king-sized beds in one room, one queen-sized bed in the other, two bathrooms and a kitchen, dining area and sitting area - luxury! The breakfast was a little bit dissappointing in terms of the hot food but there was always an alternative, cereal, toast, muffins or bagels, so we couldn't complain and always left with full bellies. The kids thoroughly enjoyed the swimming pool and basket ball court where they could chill out at the end of the day. All in all, our stay at the Hawthorn Suites was absolutely wonderful and we would certainly return there without hesitation. A big thank you to all the staff for making our staff so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “nice but very quiet”
Reviews.Author: jessthecatEngland
Reviews.Content: me and my family went to stay at the hawthorn suites in janurary this year,it was a very nice and clean place.The only things we could fault with it was,in the brochure it says that you get a free full american breakfast everyday. If you call boiled eggs and bacon a full breakfast then I'm mistaken,then on one day we only had scrambled eggs,sorry but thats not what i call a FULL american breakfast. The other was the transport to the parks,we were one of the first to get picked up and the last to get dropped off,this hotel is only 10 mins away from universal but it took us an hour with all the pick ups.The outdoor pool was freezing to swim in.there is no cocktail party mon to thurs only beer and wine,no bar and no smoking

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Cpalm
Reviews.Content: Five of us stayed at Hawthorn Suites in Jan. Great location and excellent choice for a family who wants some space. Kitchen area was fairly large for a hotel room. There was a kitchen table that would hold 4 comfortably. Kitchen was equiped with a lot of kitchen items which was surprising for a hotel room and not a condo. Dressing area with sink separate from toilet/shower. This area could also be closed off from the sleeping areas too. Hotel was quiet except for the palm leaves beating against the windows on a windy night. Room was very clean and beds were comfortable. Breakfast was ok for a buffet but you can't beat it for the price. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Always plenty of parking spaces available. Weather was too cool for the pool so I can't comment on those facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: KingCobra7003
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 (23 and up) went to Florida with Reservations at another hotel. The previous hotel turned up horrible, so we decided to drive around and look for a new place. Stopped at the Hawthorn Suites and ended up staying their for 10 days. Excellent choice of hotel when staying at the Disney Area. Very close to everything. The room was clean (1 bedroom with 2 beds, pull-out sofa, full kitchen, bathroom). Offered free full breakfast every morning from cereal to toast to hot items (different each day). Even offer complimentary beer, wine and soft drinks with a snack Mondays through Thursdays. On Wednesdays they offer free food, either hamburgers or hot dogs with chips. Saved money staying here, however look online for a better deal through their website or grab one of those roadside hotel books for a cheaper price. Service was excellent. No complaints!! Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our last minute return christmas visit”
Reviews.Author: Maverick69Uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hawthorn Suites in August and last minute decided to return for christmas to see our friends. Hawthorn staff were friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The room had been revamped with new bedding and a fabulously comfortable bed (needed when you have a water bed at home). The suite provided for all our needs again. When comparing what other people got in Orlando at Christmas , I think for value Hawthorn is excellent. The breakfast hasn't changed, although there is a variety each day, but basic things hot and cold. If nothing else its there, its free and it saves a daily $30 trip to Denny's. Unfortunately the outdoor pool wasn't heated during our stay - broken? However the spa was in full working order. In conclusion we had an enjoyable, relaxing break in great surroundings. We would definately return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: pyanders
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Tripadvisor I was a little worried about this hotel. However, I found this hotel to be clean and did not have any problems with service or noise. Check-in was a breeze and all areas of the hotel were clean and in good working order. The complimentary breakfast was different every morning. Eggs were a staple, but they were fixed differently each morning. Hotel is a 5 minute drive from Downtown Disney and about a 10-15 minute drive to the other Disney properties. Staff was friendly and always ready to answer questions. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “ok, if don't mind holes in your sheets, towels and blankets”
Reviews.Author: texascs
Reviews.Content: As a family, we travel better with two separate rooms so we decided to book at this off-site hotel instead of stay at disney. Well, the first room they put us in had torn up couch cushions. We immediately called the desk without putting our things down and they moved us to another room. I will break this down as pros and cons: Pros: This room was fairly clean and there was quite a bit of space for a family. Hot water for showers. Cons: there were holes in the sheets, towels and blankets. The paper towel holder was coming out of the wall. The shower head was unscrewed so when we turned the shower on, water went everywhere. The soap holder in the shower was coming off the wall. The TV remote had dead batteries in it. The dishes were filthy and disgusting. We decided to stay here since it had a free shuttle and free breakfast. What they don't tell you is, at least in December, the shuttle only runs three times a day and you have to make a reservation so if you want to come and go from the park you really need a car. The breakfast is a joke at best. We actually ended up going to the grocery store and buying some items to supplement what little decent food they did put out. Do not count on this breakfast to fill you up before a long day at the Disney parks. The left hand never knew what the right hand was doing at this hotel. The service was awful and they always seemed one egg short of a dozen. I have to say that I will never stay at another Hyatt hotel again. We stayed at one of their resorts and the linens were in better shape but there service was about the same. It seems that all Hyatt's regardless of price are just not worth it. If going to orlando, check out other options unless you just want a bed at the end of the day regardless.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: Unforgiven2
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked 1 suite with 2 bedrooms, on arrival we were told the room had been let by mistake so they gave us 2 single bedroom suites next to each other which was more than ok by me, it meant my 2 teenagers had their own suite to themselves. Suites were very clean and included full kitchen, biiig bedroom, a TV in the lounge and bedroom and free wireless internet. Free full breakfast was very good, sometimes a bit crowded but you could fill up and therefore miss out a midday meal if you wanted to. Got a bit bored of the breakfasts after a week or so but there are several all you can eat breakfast eateries within walking distance. Downtown Disney is 5 minutes away by car, lots of eateries within walking distance, Disney itself is almost on your doorstep and Universal and Seaworld 10-15 minutes away. I4 can get a bit busy but being on Palm Parkway means you can drive straight up Turkey Lake Road and into Seaworld and Universal the "back way" and avoid all the traffic. Palm Parkway is quiet, never heard a thing all through our stay, no crime, no trouble. Desk staff were very helpful and polite. Pool was a little small but very few people use it so quite often had the pool to ourselves. In fact our stay was so good we are going back for 3 weeks in March '08.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Ruger32514
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best places to stay on Palm Parkway. The week we were here the staff took great care of us and the free breakfast was good for being free. The pool was a little small, but I am not there for there pool. Rooms were big enough for 5 people to stay in comfort. Beds were a little small and a little firm, but we are talking about a hotel. All in all a great place to stay while in Disney or Sea World. Not that far from either park, just a short drive. Downtown Disney was really close and there are a lot of resturants in the area as well as stores. Florida Mall is a bit of a drive, but worth it. We had a GREAT time at the Hawthorn Suites. ENJOY

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomcricket
Reviews.Content: Very surprised by other reviews. The hotel was very clean throughout our week long stay in Florida. The location of the hotel was fantastic. Turn right out of the carpark you were in Disney or turn left and you were on the road to Seaworld, Universal and Discovery Cove. You have to remember this is America, everything is spread out so you would need a hire car wherever you stayed in Orlando! We have been to Florida 6 times and have found this to be the best place in terms of location and cleanliness. The hotel provides free beer, wine and soft drinks between 5.30 and 7.30 (normally stayed open longer) on Monday to Thursday evenings. On wednesday evenings they also provided burgers and hot dogs. We found the free drinks brilliant. We were able to come home from the theme parks, have a couple of drinks and then walk about 5-10 minutes to lots of restaurants at the end of the road. (Including Olive Garden, Chillis, Slizzer). We did not have time to use the pool area so can not comment on that. My mum and dad are quite particular in the standard of hotels they stay in and they loved this place. Staff were very friendly and always said morning or hello etc. when they saw us. The breakfast did vary every day although there was not lots of choice. For example one day would be sausage and boiled eggs and another day would be bacon and scrambled eggs. Everyday there was toast, fruit, cereal and drinks. You have to remember the breakfast is free and very convenient. If you had a busy day you didnt have to waste time travelling to a restaurant. Also the rooms had a kitchen if you wanted to make your own breakfast. Our flight left in the evening and the hotel let us stay in our room for another couple of hours so that we could have a shower before making our way to the airport. Overall i would highly recommend this hotel. I slept on the sofa bed and had a good night sleep every night and never heard any noise from other rooms. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “You need a car”
Reviews.Author: MalBuryLancs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks and made the mistake of not hiring a car. According to our brochure it is 1/2 mile from down town disney, this is not the case it is about 3 miles. They have a shuttle bus that takes you to Epcot and Universal but by the time it turns up and picks people up from other hotels it takes about an hour for what is probably a 10 min ride in a car. A taxi cost anything from $10-15 to downtown disney and $15-20 to Epcot. It is not within walking distance of any of the malls. We noticed nearby bus stops and asked the staff where the buses went and the times but they didn't know there was even a bus stop! The hotel was clean enough and the breakfast was adequate, but it lacked a bar to relax in at night. The rooms are well laid out and had enough equipment for a family to stay in. A word of warning never use the phones to ring home (we made two five min phone calls to England )and it cost us $200. When we complained they said they couldn'nt help what the phone company charged. They add a 50% surcharge on top, we found the warning about this in the cupboard where they keep the iron. This notice clearly states it has to be displayed next to the phone when we told the manager she wasn't interested.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey”
Reviews.Author: gmomOrlando
Reviews.Content: The rooms were comfortable, the staff friendly. However, if you require sleep while you are staying there, you won't get any! All night long, we could water running through the walls from toilets flushing and showers running. It was terrible and none of us got any sleep. We checked out after the first night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Hawkintl
Reviews.Content: We just returned last night from our stay at Hawthorn Suites (August 24-31). Liked how the hotel location on the parkway was away from the noise (nice, tree-lined area) and traffic. The hotel was nice and clean. All staff we came in contact with were very friendly and helpful. The room was very nice and impeccably clean! Every day when we returned from the parks the room was immaculate. For the two of us, the size of the suite was absolutely perfect. The hotel was very quiet too. We never heard our neighbors or any traffic. The breakfast buffet in the mornings was sufficient to prepare one for the days' activities. Eggs, pancakes, waffles, biscuits and gravy, sasuage, tater tots, toast, bagels, fruit, and coffee are some examples of what was served for the morning meal. While not a 5 star breakfast, we were very content with what they served and it was a great way to get fueled up for the beginning of the day without having to pay extra to eat out. We never used the pool, but it looked very nice and every time we passed it, there weren't a lot of people there. We also had a rental car so we didn't use the shuttle service. The hotel was very close to the Disney parks-didn't take but 10 minutes or so to get to them from I-4 (a little longer if we decided to take the parkway that took you by Downtown Disney-it was a nice change of scenery from the interstate). There's a Super Wal-Mart on the same parkway the hotel is on (just a couple of miles past the 4-way stop) which was perfect for food shopping for meals we prepared in our room's kitchen. I would say that if staying there, I would definitely rent a car. Then you'll be able to not only go where you want when you want, but you'll also have more of a selection of shopping/restaurants to go to. This is our third visit to Disney and we'll never stay at or near International Drive again. For us, the hotel was the perfect price, area, and the accommodations were precisely what we wanted...and all with Disney right around the corner! When we return again, this is where we're staying!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: robin3NewYork
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel a couple of years ago and have found it to be a comfortable hotel -close enought to disney - for a good price. Therefore, when vacationing in Orlando this summer, I decided to stay at this hotel again. Perhaps it is under new management, but I had major issues with this hotel this time around. Firstly, upon arrival, I was told that they did not have the room that I had reserved available. How unprofessional is that?!?! What on earth is the point of reservations if they dont' actually reserve the room for you?!?! They told me they'd put me in a different type of room for the night and would move me the next day. This was annoying to me because i did not want to waste the whole next day waiting around for them to find me a room to switch to. I was there to vacation!!!! Not hang around the hotel lobby while they tried to deal with their screwups!!! Then, I asked them what they could do about the price since it was their screwup. So, my price for the night was reduced by $30. After spending the night there, i should have received full compensation! Here's what happened: AT 1:40 AM, SOMEONE ATTMEPTED TO BREAK INOT MY ROOM!!! Someone inserted a key card into the door and opened it!!! My sister started screaming. I went to check it out and sure enough. The lock was open. The security bar that we had put against the door had been moved. Someone had had access to our room, while we were sleeping. Thank God for that extra security bar, because I had not used it, the intruder would have been able to get in instead of merely opening our door a couple of inches!!! I have stayed in hotels before, but i have never had this before! THERE IS ABSOLUTELY NO REASON THAT ANYONE OTHER THAN THE OCCUPANT IN THE ROOM SHOULD HAVE A KEY TO THE ROOM!!!!! Needless to say, we did not sleep at all that night! We were freaked out. And we jumped at every little noise! And there were a lot of noises!!! The fridge and air conditioner are really really loud!!!!!! The next day, we spoke with the manager who claimed she'd never had such a thing happen before and that she was going to launch an investigation and check out the log book to see if she could find out who had broken in. Of coure, they never found out anything. I felt that we should have totally been comped for the night, cuz for all the "safety "and "security " we had, we may as well have been sleeping all night on a park bentch!!! After that wonderful night , the manager moved us right away to a different room in the morning so that our day was not killed. The rest of our stay was ok. The fridge and a/c made all kinds of weird noises. But there were no more intruders. Our next problem with the hotel was on our last day, when i requested a late checkout. After all the aggravation they caused us this trip and after everything we had experienced there, they could not grant us a late checkout. Oh, I"m sorry. Regualr checkout is at 11, so a late checkout would be at 2 and they'd charge a half day's rate. I needed the room til 4. They couldn't do it for me. They said they'd have to charge me a full day's rate for that! Like I said, considering all we had endured there, it should have been a no brainer and a freebio!!!!! (since they had not comped the first night). They also presented us with a different rate for our stay than I had made reservations for. After arguing at the front desk, they made the changes in their system and changed the price back to the original rates I had been promised. Two words: Thourougly aggravating!!! I would not recommend this hotel! I strongly suggest you seek elsewhere. Yeah, reservations can get mixed up anywhere, but when you go on vacation, you want to have a sense of comfort and security. I did not have that here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but you need a car!!!”
Reviews.Author: tvrgirlBristol
Reviews.Content: I looked at all the reviews before we booked the hotel and i am glad to say that we had a great stay. We are from England and on our last visit we stayed on International Drive which has everything on your doorstep, we like to walk and this was perfect for us. I was under the impression that this hotel was not far from shops,disney etc that was only if you have a car. We took the free shuttle to Epcot, it was always late leaving the hotel and takes around 30-40 mins to get there as you have to pick up from other hotels in the area. The shuttle itself has seen better days, the windows are scratched so you can't see out of them and the air conditioning was just about working. This hotel was about a 15 min walk to get to restaurants, shops etc and after a long day out at the parks, heat at night etc you do not want to walk any more!! The selection of restaurants are limited, TGI Fridays, Kobe (fantastic), Crab House (Yuk, the fish tasted of chlorine) Sizzlers (looks like a dining hall inside but the food was ok, cheap and plenty of it) and a chinese at the end of palm parkway that i would avoid at all cost, we left the entire meal as it was so awful. The rooms are a good size not massive. We had noisy neighbours(young lads of 15-18 years) and I heard every word at 2.30am, in the end I phoned the front desk who sorted it out for us. However after they left we enjoyed a good nights sleep, we found the beds to be very comfortable. The swimming pool was great after a long day at the park, it never got really busy and you could always find a bed. Because the sun is at the back of the hotel nearly all day long even when you get back you can still catch a few rays or swim in the pool. I would stay here again but I would definately have a car next time. If I had to choose between international drive and palm parkway then international wins every time. Palm Parkway is a lovely location but your not as close to disney as you think you are!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheUres
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 (2 children aged 6 &2) who stayed at the Hawthorn Suites 12th July -26th July 2007. Located on Palm parkway, around 5-10 min drive from Downtown disney. Very quiet area which felt very safe. The rooms "suite" arrangement was a real bonus for us as it was a 1 bedroom suite (Bedroom with 2 queen sized beds, Living/Kitchen room with sofa bed and dining table, Air con but no balconies (negative point) & both rooms have a TV. Great for families with young kids. Accomodation was very clean, staff polite and pool area was always clean. Pool normally quiet but even when busy we could still get a couple of sunloungers - none of the early rising to reserve a sunlounger (eat your hearts out 'Med' travellers) As part of the deal you get: -free Cocktails (Beer or wine) 1730-1900 Mon-Thurs. -free breakfast every morning (Typ. Always cereal, Tea coffee, milk coke, fresh orange etc, toast, bagels, Pancakes or waffles, sausage meat (switches between)burger shaped or sausage shaped), potatoe crunchies, & alternates between Omlette or scrambled. -free hotdogs 1730-1900 Wed We were never there for the free drinks and ate out every night. All above is nothing fancy but the breakfast does fill a gap and set you up for day - did the trick for us. Restaurant does seem to get busy at times and hit it a the wrong time and you may struggle to get a table. The toasters are slow - but you are supposed to be on holiday , so whats the rush !!! (Stop moaning) No complaints from us The place does not have anything beside it except other similar hotels - so driving everywhere. Although you could walk to a Buffallo wild wings bar (good atmosphere and great wings) take 15 mins - we drove !! (Our kids had enough of walking in the parks by nightime). Accomodation is on same road as Sheraton Safari hotel (3-4 min drive). We never really spent much time at place so it was perfect for us. Depends what you want from a holiday. It is not like staying on International drive where everything is on your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruger31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the week of June 10the 2007 to June 17th 2007. This is by far the best hotel on Palm Parkway. We have stayed at others on Palm Parkway and the Hawthorn was MUCH better. The pool was small but worth it on a hot day, and the breakfast was good for being free. The rooms were bigger then I thought they would be and the kitchen was good enough to cook in if you wanted to do a night in for dinner. The hotel was located about half mile off of the main road to get into Downtown Disney. So a bit of a drive, BUT every where is a bit of a drive in Disney. The Staff was GREAT to talk to and knew how to get everywhere in town. The beds are ok...just regular old hotel gueen size bed. Not bad but you can sleep on it after a long day in the parks. We had a great time in this hotel and will be back next year when we come back to Disney, I highly recomend this hotel for anyone. You will like it! I LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “Great for our family vacation...”
Reviews.Author: MagMagoo
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for families. Check-in was pretty fast--only took us 2-3 minutes tops to get checked in and get our key cards for our room. Our room was on the 3rd floor and we had a view of the pool. We thought that our room was well-appointed. We were impressed with how clean and comfortable the room was, considering it's not a 5 star hotel. We were also surprised that we had a full-sized refrigerator in our room! The kitchen was fully stocked with dinnerware, silverware, cups, and paper towels. Very cool, even though we ate out all week. The air control was easy and the room was always comfortable. Need the internet? This hotel offered absolutely free, wireless internet. The continental breakfast was great! Waffles, danishes, muffins, coffee, sausage, hash browns, toast, oatmeal, and a couple of other things that escape me right now. More than adequate and my kids didn't fuss about anything. So, perfect! The only two things that bugged me were the noises from our neighbor's shower. Especially, at 1 o'clock in the morning! ACK! When they showered or washed their hands, we heard it. That sucked. Odd, because we couldn't hear any talking or anything... just the shower and the sink. The other thing is the ac unit... it wasn't terribly loud, but it wasn't whisper silent. Made noise. If you're a light sleeper, then I'd take these things into consideration. Overall, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. It's 10 minutes from the airport (MCO) and about 5-7 minutes from Downtown Disney. 10 minutes from Walt Disney World (the parking lot). There are restaurants all over the place. Walgreens is about 2 minutes away (we used the pharmacy... hubby forgot meds). Super Walmart is about 10 minutes away--it was super crowded the day we went (Monday) and the lines were long. BUT, they have discounted Disney merchandise and you can get snacks and water for your room! Parking was never an issue... plenty of free parking and it's safe. It really is a great location. Gets 4 out of 5 stars from me! :o)

Reviews.Title: “super”
Reviews.Author: tjwGroesbeek
Reviews.Content: we stayed in hawthorn for 6 nights and we loved it. the best place we stayed in orlando ever! nice staff clean hotel suites and the suites were nice and comfortable. the hospitallity hour on weekdays was an extra plus. we loved to stay here and hope to come again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the Price”
Reviews.Author: get-out-of-the-cold
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel for the price. We had a full kitchen, separate bedroom and bath. We slept 5 people comfortably. There are lots of restaurants and shopping close by. I recommend having your own car if you stay here. Good for larger families or larger groups. We paid about $100 a night including tax which I is a great deal considering all of the space. Breakfast is just OK but it is included (free).

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average room, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: JoeD-Boston
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our visit to Disney. Tthe Palm Parkway location is excellent. The room is average and the breakfast is poor unles you like frozen waffles and pancakes. There are so many places to stay in the Orlando area, pick another hotel that has a good breakfast .

Reviews.Title: “Was a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: farfromflorida
Reviews.Content: We spent 11 nights at Hawthorn Suites LBV Mar/Apr 2007. The staff was great, especially Mike at the front desk. Everyone was very helpful and friendly, I don't think we passed a staff member without them saying hi or good morning. The hotel was clean and the room (we had a 1 bedroom suite) layout was excellent. We could get ready in the morning and leave the bedroom shut off from light and noise so our daughter could sleep longer. The bathroom had the tub and toilet separate from the sink and mirror so one could get ready while the other showered etc. It was one of the few hotels where my husband didn't have to duck under the shower head and water pressure was good too. We did use the kitchen quite a bit as you get tired of eating out every day, especially after a long day at the parks. It had fridge, cooktop, microwave, dishwasher, pots/pans, bowls, cutlery, dishes etc. Housekeeping was excellent! Our last day, we came back to hotel and wondered who left the tv on in the bedroom. When we walked in we saw that the maids had placed my daughters 2 stuffed animals on the bed facing the tv with the remote under Shamu's fin and they were the ones watching the tv. My daughter loved that. Breakfast was great. I don't know what people expect for a free breakfast based on some of the breakfast reviews here. The only thing I can think of that they didn't have was bacon. They had sausage instead. Had eggs, either scrambled or omelettes. Bagels or English muffins, hash browns, cereal (hot or cold), toast, waffles or pancakes, oranges, juices, milk coffee,etc. How much more do you need or want for breakfast?? The pool area was fine too. Although the pool was small it was never too crowded as most people are at the parks. We always found 3 lounge chairs together as well. The water was not heated but felt refreshing after the heat of the parks. We only went in hot tub once as it was too hot out to want to sit in hot water. The beds were comfortable and the air conditioning was easy to control. The only noise I heard was if water was being run or if someone was noisy as they passed the door. I never heard anything from next door although hubby said he heard a kid saying "daddy" over and over at 6 am. The location of this hotel is Excellent, very easy to get to Disney, Universal, SeaWorld and to shopping or restaurants. We did rent a car so didn't use the shuttle. The price was very reasonable for all that you get. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So-so room; Unheated Pool”
Reviews.Author: ican
Reviews.Content: Our stay was not what we expected considering all of the reviews here that gave it five stars. Generally, the room didn't seem to be clean: the bathtub was grimy, and the carpet was old and stained. My wife said that it had a "low rent" feel to it. The pool area was a disappointment: the unheated pool was very cold, and the whirlpool did not appear to have been cleaned or treated very well. On the positive side, the location is very good and the front desk staff were very helpful. The breakfast was filling, but not exceptional. This was our first trip to Orlando, and I would be inclined to try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Hawthorn Suites was great!”
Reviews.Author: New
Reviews.Content: We used points from Hyatt Gold Passport to stay for two nights for free at this hotel, and we loved it. The front desk staff was very polite and helpful. The room was clean and spacious. The location was great. (We were able to take a cab to and from Downtown Disney for less than $10 each way.) We would definitely stay here again even if we had to pay and would recommend the hotel to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there again, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Allthingshorsey
Reviews.Content: We've been staying there for the past 5 years - Location is excellent - you can get to Universal and Seaworld without hitting the busy roads. There's a free hot breakfast and social hour. For the first time we took laptops across and took advantage of the free wireless internet. The rooms were very clean and having seperate cooking area means that food smells aren't in the bedroom. Highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: baaz747
Reviews.Content: Note: The hotel was formally known as the Savona Suites (see previous reviews ---) URL for hotel: --- ------------------------------------------------------------------------------ We just got back from a trip to Orlando (today) and we stayed at this hotel for 1 week. Our experience was similar to the other positive reviews: Overall assessment: - We arrived early (11:00 am) and they allowed us to checkin since the room was ready. - Hotel lobby was large/airy and spacious. Also had a large breakfast area. - Breakfast everyday was excellent with eggs, saussages/bacon, pancakes etc etc. - Mon-Thu was Happy Hour with some snack (chips/salsa), beer. We never had time to try this. Location: - The location is excellent. Once you turn right onto Palm Parkway from the main road (Apopka Vineland) there are lots of restaurants of everykind. We triedd the lunch buffet at Pizza Hut and also the Indian Palace restaurant on Palm Parkway (both were excellent). - The hotel itself is almost the last one on the street so very quite area. - There are lots of shops such as Winn Dixee, Walgreens just north on Apopka Vineland roaed. - There is a major outlet center and a Publix on the south side of I-4 (on Vineland road). - The best feature was the proximity to Downtown Disney with the Disney marketplace being literally a 5 minute drive. - The theme parks were very close as well and a short drive back after a whole day at the Magic Kingdom. - International drive etc are also 15 minutes away. Kitchen etc: - One reason to select this hotel was the kitchen etc which was well equipped. This is a real time saver since you can quickly fix a meal after a long day at the Theme parks. Overall a great hotel. We will definitely stay at this hotel when we return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Above-average Hotel that we would recommend and visit again”
Reviews.Author: drabb
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week here. The hotel in our opinion rated "above average" with just a few things that require minor maintenance. We arrived at 7am one morning having flown 12 hours from New Zealand to LA. Then a 7 hour stint at LAX airport before flying 5 hours to Orlando, all in all more than 24 hours without decent sleep. Anyway, they allowed us immediate access to our room even though check-in is about 2-3pm-ish. This was a fantastic gesture on there part. But I guess this was because the hotel was virtually empty with only 3-4 families at the free Breakfast each morning. The hot part of the free b/fast varied in quality and was probably a bit on the fatty side for our taste. The pool was also virtually to ourselves but I can appreciate previous reviews written here that it is a small pool if the hotel had lots of guests. Our kids are 14 and 16 and they enjoyed it. We caught the free bus to WDW for 6 great days. It drops you at Epcot but the buses and Monorail to other parks were usually very efficient and ran regularly. The lines at the parks of WDW were non-existent except for one day at Magic Kingdom. We did Animal & Magic Kingdom, Epcot, MGM Studios & both Water Parks. It was 90degrees most days and had only 1-2 heavy rain showers that lasted only minutes (and not a Hurricane in sight). We took most of our own food with us from NZ because we don't enjoy high sugar/fat foods. There is a WinDixie Supermarket about 10-15mins walk away (good exercise) or if you have a car then 3-4mins. The kitchen facilities were great for our family situation enabling us to cook our own dinners and make our own lunches to take to the parks (even though signs say not to take food into the parks). All in all a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place, but there is better!”
Reviews.Author: Postmasterrings
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights out of a 10 day vacation and if I hadn't stayed at two other places may have given it a 4. But the mattress in our room was sloping in the middle and the other queen was just average. Breakfast was just ok. A nice variety but beside the waffles the quality was below average. As I said there is better and only a couple miles from this place called the Orlando Marriott Residence. This place was only $9 more a night but had a breakfast that was out of sight and the mattress was heavenly! Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Savona suites awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the Savone Suites late the evening and the staff where so happy to see us like we where family and this was only our first stay with them. I would be happy to tell everyone that the hotel was very clean and fresh. No problems with parking , plenty of shops in the area , a mile from disney's magic kingdom , and blocks to sea world what a location. the conitial breakfast was much more than the sandard hotel stuff. WE are so pleased with the hotel we will back again year next year for our second family vacation. the Suite had a refrigarater, cooktop and microwave and dishwasher that was awesome and very easy on the wallett. The pool area was great the kids have a basketball hoop and a nice shallow pool safe for children of all ages. what can you say it was beyond words we where shocked how nice and affordable the rates are for what you get .

Reviews.Title: “my thoughts and opinions”
Reviews.Author: quakerquisp
Reviews.Content: we were to stay 4/16-4/22 in the 2 bedroom suite(really just two conneciting rooms with kitchen. living area in middle. For us the room did not have a clean feel to it I would not want to use the pots and pans or dishes, the sheets had dried stains on them. We spent sunday night after going to the store to stock up on groceries. After waking up to the garbage truck and to the little darlings across the way running back and forth slamming the door our kitchen and dining table covered in ants they even got into the unopened bread and danish. I was done we checked out and checked into the JW Marriott Grand Lakes(heaven for 54.00 more dollars. A couple of notes: In addition to room tax there is a OCC tax all hotels do this and they charge a 15.00 resort fee I disputed because I did not see this anywhere noted(could be my mistake.) In a nutshell I went from feeling like I was camping to feeling like I was truly on VACATION.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: P.D.S
Reviews.Content: Hi. This is the Sykes family. We are on holiday now......in our room writing this. The reason we can write this in our room is because you can rent laptops for just $5.00 for a half an hour! We recommend Savona Suites to all ages. Savona is so close to all Disney theme parks that you can have a ten minute walk, and you are there. Savona is in a great location and we recommend it for everyone. The Sykes Family x x x x

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: chox
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel close to Disney and Sea World with great room size and a fantastic free breakfast, this is for you. If you want to spend a lot of time at the hotel and swimming is a priority, go elsewhere. We stayed for five nights the last week of March--2 adults, three kids 10, 9, and 5. The room had a separate bedroom with two queen beds, a separate living area with a sofa sleeper (queen, I think) and a dining/kitchen area with microwave, two burner stove, dishwasher and full-size fridge. The pool, however, was tiny and not heated. The whirlpool was small, but adequate. The kids liked the outdoor basketball hoop, although the surface was hard on bare feet. The breakfast had all the usual fare: cereals, bagels, toasters, doughnuts. But it also had make your own Belgian waffles and sausage, hash browns and omelets or scrambled eggs every day. Perfect to eat heartily in anticipation of a long day at the parks. Since we spent most of the time at the parks, it was nice to be centrally located between Disney and Sea World. It would have been nice to be able to splash around in a large, heated pool during the down times, but it wasn't essential to our overall enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!! Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had never heard of this hotel until our last trip. It was late at night, and the original hotel we booked was a disaster. We started driving down hotel plaza blvd and I walked into the Doubletree Suites.. They didn't have any rooms, and recommended we try Savona Suites on Palm Parkway. Boy am I glad they did.. Room was very large with full kitchen, etc.. Very clean and comfortable.. Can't say enough good things about this Hotel and its staff. They were extremely friendly and did everything to make sure our stay was enjoyable. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone!! Try it, I don't think you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dragoms
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while visiting WDW and Seaworld in February. Rooms were clean and spacious. Maid service was excellent and towels were folded in unique shapes each day. Staff at hotel was friendly and followed through on all our requests. We had a problem with our garbage disposal that was quickly repaired. The beds were comfortable. Having a full kitchen was a bonus but not really needed since breakfast was provided and we were gone all day. We did have pizza in the room one night and it was nice to have a table for the four of us. The jacuzzi was clean and set at the perfect temperature. We couldn't swim in the pool as it was too cold (55 high!). Towels were available near the pool/jacuzzi both nights we used the hot tub. Breakfast was adequate. Muffins weren't the freshest but bagels, cereal, oatmeal, and breads were good. The breakfast room was large and there was never more than a few guests present. In fact the hotel did not seem that busy. We were there the week before the busy season and they told us the hotel was sold out for President's Day weekend (Daytona 500 weekend). We loved the location as it was very close to SeaWorld but also about as close as you can get to WDW without staying on site. If you need room to spread out and don't want to spend $200++ this is the best hotel in LBV in my opinion. We only paid $108/night.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a trip to Disney and would definitely recommend the Savona Suites. I was concerned when I learned it was no longer a Hawthorn, but I was thrilled with the accomodations and would definitely return. You cant beat the location and the size of the suite was great for our family of 4.

Reviews.Title: “Going to WDW, read on...”
Reviews.Author: AnnaShorewood_WI
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a vacation to WDW... which was a trip we hastily planned just two weeks before. With two small children, we were torn between staying at a Disney property or opting for more room in a suite off-site. When we researched properties and ran the numbers, we couldn't pass up Savona Suites. However, the low cost made me nervous... how could something that sounded so good be so cheap? I am writing to say that we absolutely made the right decision and I would encourage anyone to save some $ and stay here. We couldn't believe the proximity to WDW (we did rent a car which was necessary). Even though it is outside the resort, it is closer to the actual theme parks then some Disney properties. The room was VERY clean; sheets were nice and white; and the crib was a very nice,new Graco pack n' play. Housekeepers did fun folds with the towels and tucked the stuffed toys into bed, which are nice touches for the kids. The best part was that we were able to put the kids to sleep by 9:30-ish and still have our own space:)If location and cleaniness are most important to you, save some $ and stay here. P.S. The breakfast is no great shakes, but there is a juice machine, milk, cereal, etc. Don't complain... it's free.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: WDW11
Reviews.Content: Savona Suites is definitely the perfect hotel to stay! We were repeat customers of the Hawthorn Suites Sea World and decided to give Hawthorn Suites Lake Buena Vista (Savona)a try this year, mainly because of its location. I must say that when we first heard that Hawthorn LBV was now Savona we were concerned with our reservations. The director of sales, Kathy Tobin was a big help and did a wonderful job calming us down. But from the moment we arrived at the hotel, we knew that it was going to be a marvelous stay. We stayed from Dec 3 to Dec 18 and it literally became our home-away-from-home for these wonderful 15 days. Let´s be more specific: 1. The LOCATION is the best you can get. The hotel is located at 8303 Palm Parkway, Lake Buena Vista, less than 2 mins from SR 535 and the Downtown Disney entrance. We have stayed at two Disney hotels before (Coronado Springs/All-Star Movies) and felt kind of in the middle of nowhere. That´s not the case with Savona. Exiting the hotel make a right towards 535 and you are in the middle of everything: The Crab House, Olive Garden, Macaroni Grill, Pizza Hut, McDonald´s, Post Office, two Walgreens, Wal-Mart, Orlando Premium Outlets(off 535), Black Angus Steakhouse, Sizzler, Dixie´s Supermarket (good prices), Gooding´s Supermarket (expensive), Ponderosa (off 535), only to name a few (really). Nothing compares to this location; 2. The HOTEL is lovely! It´s new and looks like it. As you walk into the hotel you´ll be greeted by a beautiful lobby with an enormous chandelier and an exquisite floral arrangement on a marble table in the center. To your right is the front desk and the staff is always helpful and friendly. There´s a sitting area with a fireplace and when we were there, there was a Christmas tree . To your left is the dining area where breakfast is served everyday. It´s a continental breakfast, not the hot one they used to serve but it´s still good and...free. I think it´s ridiculous to give this hotel a not so good review based on its breakfast. The great majority of the Orlando hotels don´t have any breakfast at all. So, I think that having cereals, milk, hot beverages, juices, bread with two toasters, bagels, muffins, donuts, jam, cream cheese and fruits is a nice way to begin your day and plus you get to avoid the hassle of having breakfast at the parks. To your right are the corridors with plush carpeting and soft lighting leading to the rooms and the elevators (big and nice looking too); 3. The ROOM is just as lovely as you see at their site. Big, beautifully decorated and cozy! Ah, and no funny smell too. We stayed in a King Suite. First of all, there´s a full kitchen and I mean full. There´s a big refrigerator with ice-maker, dishwasher, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, two burner stove top, and all the utensils you need. The dining area adjacent to the kitchen is charming with a wooden table and 4 chairs and a chandelier providing plenty of light when you eat. And then there´s the sitting room with a comfortable sofa, a couch and a 25´ TV with remote. The room was a really big one, with a king bed, a reclining chair, a work area, a dresser with 3 drawers, a big closet with lots of hangers, ironing board and iron, alarm clock, another 25´ TV and plenty of room for our 4 gigantic bags (I love shopping!) . The bathroom is pretty much standard, with a tub and a shower (a good one) and a big sink outside with all those nice toiletries; 4. The HOUSEKEEPING was terrific! Not too much of an intruder but always making sure the room was clean. Everyday when we came back to our room everything was looking good, the bed was made, the dishes had been washed, we had new towels, new tissue box or whatever was missing before but our stuff was untouched. Perfect! Spending our hard earned vacation in Orlando is our definition of heaven but staying at the Savona Suites upgraded our expectations even more. Now we are officially spoiled! Needless to say we are going back this year.

Reviews.Title: “Disliked, totally.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the worst hotel that we have ever stayed in. The rooms were dirty, old and very small, the staff at front desk were unhelpful, very grumpy, and I would advise anyone wanting to stay here not to. Then that will guarantee me a room when it gets very busy ,because we found this hotel, top rate, very pleasant and helpful staff throughout the hotel,large rooms, nice pool and overall.it made our stay so much fun, but maybe you will only read as far as the bad comments,so we will then be able to get our room for this year. Again top notvh. Paul Pam and james U.K.

Reviews.Title: “Savona's the Best in Buena Vista”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I first heard that Hawthorne Suites was being bought by a company called Savona, I was concerned if the hotel would be as good. Being repeat customers of the Hawthorne, I was worried about the hotel's stake. However, as soon as I checked in, I knew that we had absolutely nothing to worry about. If you are considering not staying here because of the name, think again. Just about everythig is exactly the same as the Hawthorne. As soon as we arrived in the hotel lobby, we were greeted by a courteous front desk staff. They warmly welcomed us into the hotel, and in minutes, we were up into our luxury suite. When you walk into your room, you will be shocked with how much it has for so little money. You will immediately see a kitchen to your left fully equiped with utensils, plates, cups, pots and pans. As you continue walking, you will see the living room, with a fold-out sofa bed, and 20 inch TV. Walk past the door, and you get to your bedroom, with two queen beds and another TV. Last, if you walk right, you will come to your bathroom. Another important thing in choosing this hotel is the breakfast quality. Each morning, from 7 to 11 am, there is a free continental breakfast. Although it is not bacon and omelettes, it is still pretty good for no money whatsoever. Last, but certainly not least is Savona's relation to the theme parks. It is only about 10 to 15 minutes away from the magic Kingdom, whether you take I-4 or local roads. This is very important, as after a long day, you want to be able to get back to your hotel. Overall, Savona could be summed up in one word, excellent. On my next trip to Orlando, I will most certainly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Savona Suites is a perfect Suite hotel for families! Clean, upscale...better than Disney property resorts for the money...can't go wrong. We will definately stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: TravelerLost
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 8 nights with my family and had no problems. Would stay there again. Room was clean and quiet (The only things that counts in my book) Staff was courteous and attentive. Disney is just a few minutes away, quick access to Interstate 4, restaurants and grocery stores near by. Since it was off season, the price I paid made it a great value. I also appreciated the attraction/ticket desk at the hotel. In other Orlando hotels I have stayed at, the people manning the desk would almost tackle you to get you to their desk. I've actually have had someone yell across a lobby to get my attention once... (I was trying to ignore them) This not only happens in hotels, but also at most of the family restaurants too in Orlando. At Hawthorn Suites, the attraction/ticket desk was more like a Concierge desk. A service to you, not a outlet for someone to sell you something. Okay now the downside, if you really need to have one... As you have read from other reviewers the free breakfast does gets old for us adults. Menu is basically an assortment of instant oatmeals, 2 of the same cereals, donut or danish, 3 juices, orange slices, apples, toast, French toast or waffles, bagel or english muffin. The hot items were sausages, tater tots, and scrambled eggs or pre-made omlettes. Don't know why they couldn't add more variety to the hot food offerings. The kids didn't complain and if they were happy; my wife and I were happy. Besides, it saved me at least $30 each morning. Cha ching! Was planning on using the free bus shuttle to the park to save the $8 daily parking fee. You have 3 pick up times at the hotel (7:50am, 10am, 12 pm) Now the catch... You also had to specifiy when you were going to return when you were dropped off at the EPCOT transportation center. If that time was going to change, you needed to give 2 hours notice to the transport company. Pick ups at EPCOT were (6 pm, 8pm, 10pm). These scheduled times may change throughout the year, but in September all of the parks were closed by 9pm to the general public. Trying to predict when we would leave the park with the children in toe was hard. Especially if we planned on staying late for the show/fireworks and tired little feets were still needed to walk quickly to make the pick up in time. The 10pm at Epcot was cutting it way too close even when the other parks were closing at 8:00pm. If you're going to use the shuttle service, you'd better plan. We ended up driving because our children are young enough that falling asleep while standing is still a possibility. Last time we were at Disney, I ended up carrying 2 kids totalling 100 pounds while my wife dragged a stroller and 8 month old from the Magic Kingdom to the world's 4 largest and probably farthest parking lot. Didn't want to recreate that again, but this time doing several bus transfers over a couple hours.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Great Location, Spacious, Clean, New”
Reviews.Author: step
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Hawthorne Suites in Lake Buena Vista. This is a newer property located very close to Disney. The rooms are spacious and clean with 2 TV's and a full kitchen. Even though we didn't use the kitchen, the refrigerator has an automatic ice maker which is great. The price was a great value and I would suggest going directly to the Hawthorne website. I would definitely stay here again. Some negatives.. Reviewers mentioned the breakfast is not that great, it's not..but its free! Not alot of fruit or selection or danish's. The pool is small for a hotel this size. Children tend to occupy the entire pool. Also, Jacuzzi is not working properly, no bubbles. The managers reception is horrible, beer and wine, chips and salsa, skip it..trust me. Not sure what one reviewer was talking about..hamburgers and potato salad? I did not see this. Bring your own hair conditioner, they do not provided, only shampoo. Bath towels are small. Housekeeping needs to sharpen up, our bathroom tissue was not replaced, spare change was taken, I suppose they thought is was a tip. TV remote needed new battery. Bathtub drain was very slow. Some grease around stovetop (need to invest in oven cleaner for cleaning hotplates). Overall the property is a great value. The negatives are not significant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for the Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hawthorn Suites was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. They do not charge a lot of money and give you great things. For only a little over $100 a night, they give you a full kitchen, regular size refrigerator, dishwasher, two TV's, and a living room as well as a bedroom. What more could you ask for from an inexpensive hotel? The breakfast is also nothing to complain about. For a free breakfast, they give you tater tots, sausage, bagels and various other things. The location is great, only about 10 to 15 minutes from the parks. We will definetely stay at the Hawthorn on our next visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “had a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my family and i stayed at hawthorne suites during peak season (july 4th) we had a great stay here. everything you could possibly want is provided. (pots, pans, even dish washing liquid ) was provided. i don't know how anyone could say this hotel is anything other than great! definetly would stay here again. ( my family and i go to fla twice a year.) see you next year!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: DARLOMAGS
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at the hawthorn suites the last 4 yearsand we are returning this year(2005). it is in a great location for all the parks and most of all THE OUTLET SHOPS!!!! downtown disney is only a few minutes away The staff are excellent and very helpful and have become very good friends, we were there during hurricane francis and although it was a very, very,very long weekend we always felt safe as the staff had worked hard taking all the precautions they could for the storm, they stayed very calm even with the most awkward guests!!! The breakfast is basic but it is free and just meant to send you on your way to the parks so go on give it a go,check out the web-site, book on-line and pay a few $'s extra and get a pool view

HotelInfo.Name: Hawthorn Suites Lake Buena Vista
HotelInfo.Address: 8303 Palm Parkway, Orlando, FL 32836
